website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: I carefully reviewed all of the options that were available. I knew I wanted to use WordPress, but who to host it was a huge question in my mind. This was the best decision I could have made. BlueHost has been easy to use, quick to load, plenty of support available.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Globally, I was very satisfied with Bluehost. Support: So far, I have not seen such a great customer support. People on lie support were very helpful even though I'm a beginner, and they gave me basic advice on what I should accomplish even when I decided to change host (reasons later).
Uptime and speed: I did not notice any issue with this aspect of hosting. My website isn't a behemoth, though, so I can't testify so much on that part. Value: As a renewing customer, I was a bit disappointed by the price they offered me for a 3 years hosting.
I was seeing better offers elsewhere (and even for Bluehost NEW customers) so I decided to leave. The customer support did try to find a way to keep me, but it was not enough. Globally, if you're ok with the price, go all in. They're great!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've been a BlueHost subscriber for the past 3 years and have had an excellent experience through them. When I first subscribed it was a matter of pricing->feature value, but the cPanel experience was weak and the upgrade process was hit and miss. Over the past three years BlueHost has resolved any issues I had with them.
They're cPanel is greatly improved, they're feature set is much broader with few limitations, and with their new reseller account options I can host clients without any of the problems I used to run in to. BlueHost's cPanel in particular is where the best value comes. When I started my subscription with them I was less than savvy about many things relating to hosting or marketing or anything else that would otherwise lead to solid web presence.
There are many included tools and promotions that BlueHost provides with the subscription that put me on the right track and led to more opportunities as I matured. Technical expertise is not a requirement as BlueHost has most of those tools available to you, but there is still enough flexibility for more savvy developers to get their hands dirty. The only one quorum I have is a lack of root level access, but that isn't a dealbreaker for myself personally.
Overall I'd consider BlueHost as one of my favorite webhosts. There are others I've tried, but BlueHost has been the most reliable and their customer service team has always been quick and knowledgeable. For those who want a simple but reliable experience then BlueHost is the way to go; those who want complete control over their experience may not like how BlueHost does things.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost support is bad. Yes you have live chat but it's entirely outsourced to third-world countries and they are painfully slow at replying. As well, I upgraded from shared hosting package to cloud hosting and they did something wrong in the transition and my website went down.
I then had to create a ticket and it took 4 days to get an update on the ticket. As well, in terms of page speed, the "Server response time" is always above 1 second, which is way above the Google Page Speed recommended limit of 300ms, and this is with cloud hosting which is supposed to be fast. All in all, if you haven't chosen yet, don't choose bluehost.
The only reason I'm still with them right now is because it would be a pain the *** to move all my sites and contact with no downtime or seo hit. Stay away

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Hi,
I have been using BlueHost for my Wordpress Site for the past two months. Earlier I was using NameCheap hosting and now I feel glad that I switched. Currently, I'm using the Basic Shared Hosting plan.
BlueHost's shared hosting is not only fast but reliable with good customer support. I am also using the Cloudflare CDN which BlueHost and it has really improved the site's loading speed.So far, my site has been down only for once and that was just a few days after I switched to BlueHost. However, their customer support was fast in responding to my issue and they got it resolved within half an hour.
Since then, I haven't faced any issues with my site. Another good thing about BlueHost is their Control Panel. It is easy to use and user-friendly.
Bluehost's control panel also provides additional services like SEO based services and CloudFlare integration. I'll definitely upgrade to better plans at Bluehost once my website begins to generate more traffic. For small site owners and bloggers, I'll definitely recommend BlueHost for their excellent services.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: In the past it was a good hosting provider, but now it is a shame the low quality of service, the lack of knowledge of the support staff and do not refund your money when you decide to leave. I've been trying for weeks to get back more than 500 USD and they do not, it's a shame and a shame

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
This support is the worst ever! Support people don't even know their own system and don't want to help! Anything you ask from them they are not able to answer or they want to charge for everything.
I would not use them ever! They are useless.... Never use them! Stay away from them!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
We bought a shared hosting for 3 years, the biggest mistake of my life. Value per money is the worst thing. Support was loading hours everytime I wanted to fix something.
Leaving from this hosting after 1 year, I know there is no refund policy for the rest of the 2 years it's lost money, but I hope people who read this feedback won't choose this company. Search before you choose.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been with Bluehost for several years. I always give their support team kudos. However, in the past year, their email is getting worse and worse.
Their servers are black listed and they don't do anything about it. They respond with "Try sending it again in an an hour when the servers rotate." This affects everyone in my business. We are working and with this kind of terrible service, we never know if your email goes through to a client or customer.
Their excuse is that email servers are shared so things like this happen. When I point out that email has been this way since before AOL and companies like AOL, gmail and others seem to deliver email just fine, the rep always seems to finally admit the senior management at Bluehost is not funding email support to force people to buy paid email services. IMO, email is a cost-of-doing-business type of feature.
Meaning if I buy a car, a steering wheel is a cost-of-doing-business feature. I have a car (Bluehost) and it used to have steering wheel one hundred percent of the time. Now, the steering wheel is only there 70 of the time while I am driving.
I then call the service department, they tell me it's not a safety risk. I should keep the car but get an Uber (Paid Gmail) to be able to get to work every day for reliability and safety. My answer is no thanks.
I just get any other car on the market, even one like GoDaddy which I hate, and get a working steering wheel. It reminds me of the old Lily Tomlin skit about the phone company. She would always say, We don't care.
We don't have to. We're the phone company. At least with hosting companies, there are many options.
It was nice while it lasted Bluehost. I have been patient trying to let you get your act together. Good luck.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Bluehost hosting service is the best service provider out there. If you do a search for web hosting providers they come up number one in each category and there is a reason for it. They are available 24 hours a day and money back guarantee was one of the reasons I picked them. I own a web development business named Cyber-Farms and the up time is critical.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I spent 139 (!) minutes on the phone yesterday trying to get them to map a domain to a subdirectory in our public_html directory. Something trivial that you can do yourself with other hosts like Dreamhost, mediatemple, pair, and so on. In the first few minutes, they messed up the existing path and then spent more than 2 hours telling me this is not possible and ended up leaving me having to migrate my site to the root on the server (where a dated site was located I had been trying to preserve).
I have worked with dozens (100's?) of hosts since I started web dev in 1996. This was THE worst I have experienced. Luckily I only have 3 clients with these ppl. Unreal.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I purchased a 3 year hosting plan from BlueHost on a Saturday. They assigned me a temporary domain name which support told me would last from 25 minutes to 5 hours. During this time I was able to access Wordpress and start putting the page for my blog together.
After 5 hours I contacted BlueHost live chat to ask how long it would take for my domain name to become active. The person on chat never seemed to understand my problem. I even copied and pasted the error message from their site that explained the situation but to no avail.
I couldn't see how my blog looked or access email while the domain remained with a temporary address. On Sunday I tried 2 more times with live chat but couldn't get my problem resolved. I tried again on Monday and after chatting for a few minutes I realized that I wasn't going to have my problem resolved and asked for a refund.
The person took my information and said that I would be getting my refund. The refund hadn't been posted to my credit card account on Tuesday so I called customer support and talked to a person who understood my original problem and offered to solve it. I said no, I would just like to get my refund.
They told me that I wouldn't be getting the refund for my domain name purchase because the person who was processing the refund on Monday didn't complete the process and it had been more than 3 days since I had purchased the domain name and they would only refund that purchase during the first 3 days. (By the way, Tuesday was 3 days after Saturday) I received an email detailing my refund (less the price paid for the domain name) on Tuesday but it hadn't been posted to my credit card on Wednesday. I filed a claim with the credit card company and they have issued me a provisional credit. I know that stuff happens but when a problem is brought to the attention of a support person the problem should be worked on.
The live chat people should have been able to solve my problem or pushed it up to someone who could. If you use BlueHost I would recommend that you use their phone support instead of live chat for even the most simple problems.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Well, overall I think the service is okay. I am an English teacher and I use Bluehost for my blog about writing. I use their WordPress hosting service and I am satisfied with the service, although there are some flaws.
Pros:
-Easy setup
-Very good uptime (all the time)
-Good speed
Cons:
-Support is not great
-The price is higher than other hosting
During my last semester of teaching I was approached by one of my students who said he could optimize my site and get many more readers quickly, but found some security flaws in the site which should be fixed first. He offered to fix it himself for free, but first I contacted support. They did not do much and claimed the site was in good standing with security.
They have their own "intrusion detection/prevention system" which stops their service from getting hacked, but I found out it doesn't actually protect my website. I reluctantly let the student fix my site after giving him my account details and he managed to find all kinds of flaws from the inside as well. He fixed most of them within a couple of days, from bad configuration, bad plugins, and hiding my personal email/account.
I'm not very good with this kind of stuff but was astonished by how much the student was able to do that BlueHost was not able to do. The student also showed me that there were much cheaper hosting plans I could have gotten, and sure enough he was right, so I don't think the value is great for this host. Other than all that, the first setup of the website was really easy, only a few clicks and it was ready. Everything went smoothly and although the site isn't super fast, it is up 100% of the time (or very close, I don't know what happens when I'm not on it.)
Overall I give this host somewhere between 3/4 stars.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: I wanted to setup my company website, after comparing and reading reviews of many webhost, I finally found BlueHost, believe me I had the best experience with bluehost, their cpanel have all the features and helped me a lot to setup my website in just a single day, I found the web hosting price in my budget, I would really recommend bluehost for any web hosting needs.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Bluehost has a very nice list of features, and the best of them being the 'Unlimited Bandwidth" in a very low cost, cheaper than many others as of the quality of service that Bluehost provides, but what I don't like about the host is that they have a good customer service but some of their employees keep turning rude at some moments!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: I'm using BlueHost Since last 2 to 3 Years, I found BlueHost to be reliable and customer friendly hosting service. Their 24/7 customer support is among the best.That’s why I love this Hosting Platform, and they give all time Something Amazing Like 150$ foAdvertisingnt oAdWordsds. I'm Happy and Feel always Free about my Hosting Issues. I'm using their Shared hosting Plan and Get Everything Unlimited.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
This is best hosting company for law budget customer with Indian perspective. It delivers budget plans with offer on the occasion of the Independence day. It has a variety of CMS within the server.
It helps to make a good website within a minute. Good security with Linux based server. I give them 4.6 out of 5.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I registered my domain on Bluehost. I chose a monthly package which I think should deduct approx $10 monthly. I made sure that everything is good to go.
So when they processed my order, it showed that I selected an yearly package and they deducted $120 from my account. I contacted their support and they were not admitting at first after I showed them screenshot of my order, They agreed to give me my refund but they agreed to give only $60 so I decided to use the hosting.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been using Bluehost for almost a year or so, it was so tough for me, to get started my blogging career with hosting issues. I was using a local hosting company before, with no support and which was in the dark. I don't know, what other reliable option available out there, but I was left alone, although the company was closed because of their problems.
Bluehost packages are so accurate that they're made by, keeping the exact requirements of a site owner, in mind. They are very optimized regarding pricing, features, and security. They know and they've best and exact solution at the correct time.
I would recommend others for this particular hosting. I love them, until they continue their hard work and I 'll use them.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Very disappointed in the level of support I received to resolve an SSL certificate renewal. The wildcard SSL in question was set to auto-renew but is was not being applied. Customers to my website were receiving an insecure error.
Bluehost support's solution was to just wait it will apply eventually. Sounded like they didn't really know what was happening. So I waited 5 hours.
Still no new SSL cert. I called again. This time they said it was Comodo's fault and told me to call Comodo even though the SSL cert was automatically purchased on Bluehost site.
When I called Comodo they said they needed the Comodo order number. Well, I don't have the comodo order number because I purchase the SSL cert on Bluehost's site. Been on hold now for 25 minutes with Bluehost to try and get the Comodo order number because it was not on my Bluehost invoice for the SSL cert. Uggggg........

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been with Bluehost for almost a half year. Several times my email has been down. Customer support at Bluehost is not very helpful.
In some cases I was given feedback that their servers were down for maintenance. Down for maintenance!?! Why would a emai hosting be down for maintenance during peek working hours in Eastern time?
The answer was that they have several customers on the west coast and in Australia. Last time I checked the majority of the working population is in the eastern part of North America. What a joke.
I am also continuing to have several issues with my email not being able to receive. In some cases it seems to think my inbox is full. Seems ridiculous when I don't even have 500 emails in my inbox. I will be switching soon.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
BlueHost ranked as my number 1 web host. Because of their outstanding rating,
and BlueHost give you a long list of features and plans which is easy to use, Which suit every user 100%. According to my knowledge BlueHost host more than a 500,0000+ domains and manage more then 10,000+ of servers across many cities of 3+ countries and approximately, The last 30+ days BlueHost give an up-time of more then 99.00%.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Don't believe the hype. I've been with Bluehost for many years, and watched it get worse over time. It makes me sad, because they used to be very good back in the day, and I was happy with their service.
It's super slow now. Even if you install a clean empty WordPress, the page load times are awful. You run out of patience way before you get to set it up properly.
My bills kept getting bigger for no apparent reason, and even after an upgrade to the "performance cloud", my WordPress site didn't get any faster. They're only interested in sales, not so much their existing customers. I strongly recommend looking somewhere else for a fast reliable hosting.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Setting up my blogs with bluehost was easy just because of their great support team. They  are of immense help and even though I was noob they got me through without giving me a headache. Post purchase I realised I had bought site backup pro which I didn't need.
When I told them about this they immediately offered to refund my money - and they did this pretty fast. Their control panel is very intuitive an even though there are sponsored listings users have the choice to hide those bars. Uptime is also pretty good, and I really enjoy the performance that my blogs give. I can vouch for excellent performance when my blogs got traffic of up to 9000 uniques a day.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: They are very professional and I would highly recommend them. Specially I love their control panel since its user friendly. In the last 3 years my sites went down only couple of times and that too only for a very short period.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
First a few gripes I have with Bluehost... Everyone goes on about how cheap it is (e.g. $3.50 a month for hosting) but then you´re usually tied in for years to get such cheap rates. Try and switch to a 12 month renewal of their basic plan, and the price shoots up to $8.99 a month.
So you need to be careful before you commit. I alsodon'tt appreciate their having to pay almost $80 to access thwalkthroughgh video of their services, when most hosting companies offer this for free. With all that said, I´ve been happy with the service as far as uptime and the level of security features available to implement. Overall, there´s no denying that Bluehost offers great value for money.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I am bluehost reseller account holder since 2012 . But first 2 years its perfect then 3rd year there management change and suddenly they close the reseller accounts and for existing users they increase charges. But Now from last year i don't know why they close ticketing Complaint system and there support is become worst then ever.
For small issues you need to wait min 30 mins so they answer your live chat. And if soon they never fix there support issues. I will get my all clients account to other host providers.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo

Whenever I have a problem, the live-on-the-phone folks at BlueHost are friendly, courteous, knowledgeable, and they listen. So, my problems always get solved. They will walk me through the solution, wait while I go through the steps, offer suggestions, and then send me downloads and links if I need them.
I compare ALL the support I get to BlueHost. BlueHost always wins.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Email is frequently in and out. I can only suspect my sites are doing the same. Your chat support has plummeted to an all time low.
They're not knowledgeable,  screw things up,  and are not customer-focused. When I asked for a manager last time I saw stonewalled,  so now I still have to call to get my issue resolved. I'm planning on moving everything to a new host as soon as I can make the time.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: I have been a Customer for Bluehost for Past 6 Months and I have not faced a single issue with them they service is great and support also. I did have some issue with PHP Mail which was solved by their support team after contacting them 4 times. Rest the uptime was great

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've been on BlueHost for about nine months running handful of WP sites for clients. The downtime has been unacceptable. Most have been during the night, but I've had up to three hours during the day and today their server went down at 6 AM and they tell me I'll be down until 3 PM.
Embarrassing when you have a client waiting to review changes in their site. This is unacceptable.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I am very happy with bluehost VPS plans. I am using it for past 6 months. I never face any issues but in last week one of my site was sent wrong email to some one ( Probable my site is affected by malware ) so their supporting team suspended my account.
And i contacted them to resolve the issues then i am deleted the all files of that site. After i fixed the issue with malware i contacted again but they are not responding for my requests and all of my sites are went offline. After contacted them so many times i gain my sites.
I recommend their VPS plan to any one who need cheap and best VPS. But  for Hosting support they are still not good.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Truly awful service and uptime. If you value your website Do not host it with Bluehost. There data center goes down at the slighest breeze and they are nowhere near their promise of 99.9% uptime. Shocking - Avoid

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
As BlueHost provides 24/7 support and easy interface, I had best experience with it. It is fast and reliable. At the starting of my web carrier, I first happen to choose BlueHost and   due to its support and features I am more attracted to it.
As it impressed me a lot I always refer my friends to use this hosting service. Bluehost really rocks!!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've had 2 bluehost accounts since 2006 I think. I just got another, after having hosting and several other hosting providers. The server they put me on sucks royally.
Every night it times out for 3-15 minute periods of time 5-6 times between the hours of 11 PM and 2 Am cst. I talk to support and yeah they talk to within 15 minutes, but who gives a crap about halfway decent support response time if 1 out of every 10 visitors gets a crappy slow load time which is what I'm having happen right now.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been a longtime HostMonster/Bluehost customer. I have over 10 shared web servers with Bluehost. The past year has been a nightmare.
Constant email problems, sites going down, entire servers taken off-line for days. If there is an issue, they will take your server down without notice. I repeat - without notice.
I had an infected file on my server and I received an email stating the server has been taken down and the files will be removed in 15 days. I have 10 customers on that server - all are calling me this morning. One tech at Bluehost let it slip that they have some servers that are blacklisted.
I just paid another $50 to have them clear the infection with Site Doctor which will take 24-48 hours. You get what you pay for. Don't waste your time with Bluehost.
Pay a little more and get a legitimate hosting company. I'm in the process of transferring all of my client sites over to LiquidWeb.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I regret only one thing. i wish that i used bluehost earlier! After my horrible experience with HostGator i was reading some of the hosting reviews from whoishostingthis.
Well ,not all of them were good. but after a "careful" or maybe lucky decision i choose bluehost. Why ?
Many features for a great price! this was the main reason. With a little fear hoping that i don't have the same "luck" like with hostgator i send them a ticket to ask about a hosting plan for wordpress.
After Only 15 minutes i receive an answer in which they recommend me the hosting plan ,saying that they will help me with site moving/configuration to new server and also they answered to all my questions included in ticket (12 questions included!!!) 
30 minutes and my site was already on their servers! Fast ,huh ? Yeah, i know.. :D
...
And the rest is history... So..
 beautiful support
 no downtime (until now)
 fast servers
 great hosting plans with many features
What you want more ? Try bluehost and you will not regret!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Bluehost has been a great platform for me. I host many websites there and the pricing plans are tough to beat. I get my domains at godaddy and host my sites at bluehost. It has been a good working combination!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:

If I could buy him a gourmet meal and take him drinking, I would. Thank you John. You seriously are the bees knees.
TO the Bluehost Gods. He is the epitome of excellent customer service. He is valuable to your team. xo
Sonia Roselli

2.
Website hosted on blue host got malware attacks thrice in 4 months. Security measures seem to be outdated.

You have to wait 5 -10 mins in front of your screen to get the connection.
4. If you are not able to respond within 2 mins, they (chat support) hang up.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Moved from WebHostingPad (who were not good) to BlueHost. Have since had zero noticeable downtime, excellent and prompt help whenever I ask and great value for my $. Cannot ask for more in a Host and I am on my 4th one now in 7 years! Well recommended.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been with BlueHost less than 2 weeks. In that time my site has been down almost everyday for up to 3 hours at a time. This morning they have been down 5 times with an average time of 20 minutes a time.
This is the worst hosting experience I have ever had and I've been publishing web sites since 1992. They say they have a 99% uptime. This is simply not true, be warned, stay away from BlueHost.

reviews.review_text:

cheirs!!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
bluehost is an excellent hosting to buy. Everything from reliability to speed is outstanding. In the past, I was conected to a local hosting provider for my several sites, and they were charging 3x from bluehost with absolutely "Zero" support.
Bluehost provides all of my needs with very helpful customer support. I am an SEO expert and I was looking for a hosting provider with no back-end tensions so that I can focus on front-end development and content writings. Thus, bluehost is worth buying for their incredible services and competitive pricing. Additionally, their best thing I like the most is, they know how to give explanation and satisfy their customers for every possible reasons I've ever faced.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've been with BlueHost for over 3 years now - I bought 36 month hosting (as it works out cheaper per month than 12 months or 24 months) - and had very minimal complaints. I currently host my own blog and the blogs for some friends. There were occasionally tricky things, such as figuring out that I needed to make sure my IP was whitelisted when I wanted to remote access the MySQL database - but once I made a note in my config to remember that, it hasn't been a problem.
There were some points when it seemed that the page loading times were a bit slow, but I have not noticed that recently. The main reason for my high review is that when I received the renewal notice (I appreciate the 3-month, 2-month and 1-month warnings - I don't act on them immediately) I was quite shocked that the renewal price (about $11.99/mo) was more than double my initial price (about $4.99/mo). I did some research and found out that this was because it had been a promotion for new customers, etc.
I was all set for going with another host, but before I bit the bullet, I decided to contact BlueHost customer service. To make a long story short, after I explained the situation, the customer service agent spoke to a manager and then came back to say they would offer me a renewal price that actually was a few pence cheaper than my initial price 3 years ago - the moral of the story being, you don't ask, you don't get! I was happy to sign on for another 36 months at that price, having had no major complaints about the service, and preferring to avoid the hassle of switching to another host (for the medium package, no one else beat the price anyway).
I recently set up a couple of new simple blogs and it was very quick to do and use. I'm not sure if someone requiring business hosting will find all their needs met by BlueHost, but in my case as someone hosting a few personal sites for myself and friends, I have no complaints - and I appreciate BlueHost's valuing me as a customer by offering me a good deal.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been using BlueHost for 2 years now. While it is true, I was lured in by an attractive low-rate offer, when the price rises, it doesn't go above what other hosts offer, so it's still a discount. The first thing that stands out regarding BlueHost is that I receive by far the best customer support, at least by chat, that I can think of in any form of business.
They are always available within 20 minutes, which is fine because the chat box pings when they are ready, so I'm never just waiting on hold, I am free to do something else while waiting. When they respond, they are knowledgeable and helpful and I always get my questions answered, whether it is a developer-type technical question or simply about billing. The second best thing is the interface.
It is clean and the blue branding is beautiful. It is easy to use and offers me tons of control. The only negative, why I dropped stars for features, is that on a shared system, there is no way to run a Java application on my server.
Otherwise, between using cPanel, Sequel, and Cyberduck, it is a breeze connecting to the server and moving files around. Some things are even too easy in that I feel it should be harder to do certain tasks, not that it is in any way a problem. I've never had any problems with uptime nor any issues with the technology, besides the inability to add Java apps. Overall, even though I got involved with them based on the low introductory rate and WordPress integration was touted on their site, I was a little skeptical that they didn't have the same recognizability as GoDaddy, but I can honestly say, I am pleasantly surprised.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Great Support, great features expect for performance options like SSD and caching, what kills them is performance is pretty terrible, sometimes ok, often 5-8 second page load times, my pages are 2mb with all images so some delay ok but Bluehost must be one of the worst performing holsters out there based on my research, moved to SiteGround just now, sadly had paid $4 a month for 2 years more but with no upgrade options under $20 a month, I am glad to let go of my investment in bluehost and part ways forever!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have used a plethora of hosting providers over the years and BlueHost by FAR has the Worst customer support of any major hosting provider. Consistently poor support service and excessive hold times. I was on hold for an hour for tech support only to be transferred and placed on hold another hour.
Once transferred I was told I needed the support from the previous chat. Transferred again, on hold another hour before finally calling support. Once I phoned in, again was placed on hold for 30 minutes, transferred 3 times and then hung up on.
Called back, same process. In total it took 4 hours for a very simple primary domain rename.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
BlueHost has the worst support ever. I've used many hosting providers and I've never seen such a horrible support. I had to contact support three times so they could successfully disable a hosting feature they had that was crashing my website, and I had to find what was causing the issue all by myself - they kept saying it was not host related - and in the end it was.
The only good thing about BlueHost is that the website is fast and online most of the time, and I have heavy traffic. So, if you're thinking BlueHost, just hope you will never have any issues, because if you do... it will be a nightmare!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been hosting with bluehost for past 6 years and I had no problems with them at all, their custom service is superb. Though I feel that their waiting time is something which should be reduced for chat duration. In terms of uptime, I have rarely seen my website go down and that is one of the best part of hosting with bluehost.
I never faced any difficulties with backup of data, I feel bluehost is really good because once i made some changes which completely ruined my website but support gave the backup and I was able to restore my website in minutes. That became one of the reasons why i never switched from bluehost. The pricing is appropriate, I use a tri-annual plan for my hosting and it works out pretty well which gives me decent saving on my pricing, i only go for long terms plans because I know that I am at the right place. It is always satisfying to be hosting my website at bluehost, I will say go without any hesitation.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
About 3 years ago I decided that I wanted to make a personal website, and knew absolutely nothing about domains, web design, and hosting. I went to Bluehost, scanned the cheap pricing, registered my Free domain that Bluehost provides, signed up for a fairly cheap price, and started monkeying around with it.
1. Easy to Use
Within 2 hours I had added my domain, installed Wordpress (an easy to use website builder), and created an exceptionally good looking & fully functional site.
You have immediate access to all your files in Files Manager, so there's no need to use FTP. The interface is also completely arrangeable to your liking.
2. Customer Support
BlueHost support is top notch.
They have over 60 user friendly video tutorials, a live forum, email contact, and 24/7 phone support. If you're serious about your business, website, blog, etc. then it's vital to have this kind of immediate access to help.
Their phone support is incredible. NO, you don't get some guy who can barely speak English. The staff there is friendly, patient, knowledgeable, and real people who aren't just stuck to some script.
My blog one night at 2:00 PM crashed due to a PHP error in my code. I called them up without having to wait, the guy remotely went into my files and fixed everything. I've also accidentally deleted some important files...no problem I just sent an email and within minutes they'd restored my entire site from their backup system which runs nearly every hour.
3.
Unlimited/Free Features
Unlimited Domain Hosting - I have a little over 100 domains hosted with Bluehost, and there hasn't been a single problem. Host as many as you'd like. Also what's nice is that Bluehost keeps track of when you're domains are going to expire, and will warn you ahead of time to renew.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I took time working with them and I found it m Very Satisfactory . The server runs répido and stable, the activation it has also been , and correct support by chat and email as well. Currently Do I have 5 Pages in basic plan and work perfectly .
Subdomains therefore Como redirections and Email will Perfection. Previously Work with 1 & 1 But given its price rise esta In Alternative and I look like or happier than the above . Advisable . A greeting .

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost is one of the most reliable hosts out there when it comes to features. It's attractive features include a free domain name, cheap pricing, incredibly high uptime (~99.5%), and one-click install for WordPress. For most purposes, a website built on WordPress and hosted on BlueHost is all you need.
Sites load faster in comparison to when you host them on HostGator. But, if your website gets tons of traffic, it is not the hosting service for you.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost hosting service is going downhill. I've had my website hosted by this company and it's been one disappointment after another. When I first came to them, the service used to be better.
However, I can't left unnoticed the fact that they told me I would be able to use a wildcard SSL certificate on their shared server. Indeed I was; however, they soon started blocking an IP address for the translation company that provides translation service for my website. Bottom line: I had to call them almost every 3-4 days to have them remote this IP address from the blacklist.
Eventually, someone suggested getting CloudFlare and whitelisting the IP address on their server. Sure enough, this solved the problem. However, I started getting 503 error messages occasionally; the new suggestion was to get Cloud Business Pro.
I was told I would be served by three different locations instead of one. Most of the 503 errors were gone; now I started getting 404 errors which turned out to become a Huge nonsense to the point that my uptime a few days ago was down to 50%.Not kidding. But it got worse.
Yesterday, monitor. Us sent me a notification stating that they suspended the monitoring service due to "continual failure for a duration of 12 hours". Wow!
How can a business operate under such circumstances? I filed a trouble ticket and I've been for 10 days and no response from their technical gurus! Stay away from Bluehost.
It seems like their servers are overcrowded and they can no longer handle the website traffic for the companies they "serve". For me, it's just a matter of days and I'm out of there.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I was managing a website for a client who was using Bluehost as their web hosting company. When I was checking his WordPress websites, I noticed both of sites were pulling a 500 Internal Server Error. That error is the most vague WordPress error.
I called up Bluehost, and when I told them about the error, they knew exactly what it was and took care of it. They made sure the permalink structure was working on both websites before hanging up. Their support staff is knowledgeable and personable.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been a customer for years with Bluehost for years. As of the last year or so no longer can I just reach tech support easily with a simple call. Now frequently my sites are down because of their server.
Getting tech support is like torture. You have to wait forever to talk to someone. Seems like they're outsourcing as well,  though I'm not sure.
It's just really   bad. They have totally changed everything since they got too big for their britches,  as the saying goes,  and started all that advertising. Anyway, there's no excuse for their server to be down so much. I'm so disappointed.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Support: Reps are hit and miss, most have an "attitude" when I contact them. They will tell you something definitively, even though they have no clue what they're talking about. For example, when I contacted BH to alert them that there is suspicious activity on my account and they tell me that there isn't, I have to wonder (a) how stupid do they think I am and (b) how many people who know nothing of malicious files are fooled by a quick talking rep..?
I've had two reps close our 'chat' session without assisting me, simply because I told the rep that I was losing confidence in his abilities! Features: What makes BH features any better than any other webhost that offers CPanel? Nothing...
Uptime: Every time (about six times) I get files reinfected after BH runs their Site Doctor, my site goes down for several days. On a more recent occasion, I had close to 10 days of downtime... Let me say that again... 10 Days of downtime!
This could be expected from some discount hosting company, but not for the type of money I pay. Value: There is absolutely no value in a webhost that allows your files to be infected, charges you to fix it, allows your files to be reinfected, charges you to fix it, and Does not fix the problem. They simply stand there with their hand out, charge you for a service, and don't deliver on removing malicious files from your account.
They simply point the finger at you... As if I purposefully infected my own account! Terrible customer service.
I'm tempted to copy and paste my 'chat logs' and maybe some email responses that they've sent me. It would likely serve as the #1 deterrent of Bluehost on the web! My advice, don't choose Bluehost. Go with one of dozens of other companies that charge roughly the same price, but treat their customers like "they are always right!"

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I'm hosting my game for Facebook canvas (Fantastic - Ivy & Evy) at bluehost. I was advised by sales to get the Cloud Pro package in combination with the Cloudflare Platinum package. Everything that I've asked for was possible (stability and a wildcard SSL cert.).
It sounded great! However after I became a customer nothing was possible and support is near to zero. I couldn't get the products (SSL cert, Railgun) as was advertised, when I pointed out the section on the website that said the package included an SSL cert and backed my claim with the chat sessions that I'd saved on my machine, they said I needed to contact the sales person I've had the chat session with.
You guess, the guy was never available and I still didn't get what was promised. Also, the uptime is terrible. Server is down for hours and when I ask about it the answer is maintenance.
Without notification and for many hours. Bluehost has some good technicians though. My problem with Railgun was fixed very fast, the problem is that the people on the helpdesk frontline don't know anything just sell no for an answer without consulting a technician.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: BlueHost seem pretty good. I have a WordPress website hosted with them and I haven’t had any issues. I especially like the 1-click installation with Mojo Marketplace. I would highly recommend them if you just want to host a basic WordPress website.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
My Experience with blue host was worst... I can't change primary domain their support said as I used a wrong domain while registering. They told me to purchase a new hosting plan to host a new domain...
after I purchased a new hosting they my site up time was not good at all ... I contacted them they said it is because your domain is hosted on godaddy so transfer domain and purchase premium DNS Bluehost sucks :(

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: I've been BlueHost customer since 2011 and I always recommended my all clients and friends to this wonderful hosting. I have never come across any problem so far except one time when they locked out one of my hosting account. But they were very prompt in informing me and gave me reasons and then supported me till the issue is resolved and got my sites live within next few hours. I love their support.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: After being a 5 year customer Bluehost deleted all 8 of my live sites, 3 in development because of a late payment. I then requested a full refund and all 3 operators agreed to a full refund. This is not what happened. After several outages this year and no compensation to any of my clients I have ended a 3 year run with them.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
It has been nearly 2 Months after shifting My Web hosting from ZNetLive to Blue host and I have seen the result in my performance of my website. They Server are extremely Well Maintained and So Fast that my WordPress Website take seconds to load than my old host. I am on they Shared Hosting Plan and I faced a little-bit issue with they cpanel to understand as they have completely change the look of Cpanel.
The Support was bit disappointed as it takes time to Get Answers from them on phone and chat both. Well As per Performance I would Recommend Bluehost to any person who want to setup an basic hosting. And Yes Bluehost Rock.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Hi all,
I think this is the better choice than others because they win confidence of their customers. Some days ago me and my brother decided to take hosting services of BlueHost for our blogs. Today i think that was a superb decision i have ever made.
BlueHost's dealing with us is unique. they look after of every website which they host. their trained staff, 24/7 services, money back gurantee and one click install is really great.
i want to salute this hosting company. I have not enough knowledge of website building but my favorite BlueHost makes it simple and interesting for me. There prices are low from market with 100 percent satisfaction.
they are not new in market, they have 2 million customers world wide. BlueHost is a back-bone for my blog. I think it is fantastic for all type of websites but it is superb for my blog. last but not least it is a complete hosting solution for online world.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: They advertise CPanel hosting. But after you create your account you find out that they build this into their system and make you pay extra for functions that are actually part of CPanel. They should advertise that as 'Partial Cpanel'.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Bluehost offers just about everything one could ask for. Their customer service, however, is not sufficient for me to remain a happy customer. When online chat times are measured in hours, that is not OK.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Hosting Service: 3.5/5 stars
I have 2 shared hosting plans with BlueHost for coming up on a year now. After experiencing what there is to offer on the shared plan, I believe for the price you pay (which is usually between $3.95 -$.5.95/month depending on what price you see it at) is an above average level of service that you get out of their hosting. You get an unlimited amount of bandwidth, databases, space (even though it does have a limit but to hit that you must be doing some heavy file storage, or a boatload of websites.) If you're going to setup a Wordpress site the one click install for it is handy along with the many other quick installs they offer, but it's nothing that any other host doesn't have.
The downtime on the servers can be weird at times. One thing that I still ponder to this day is how a hosting companies website goes down as well, and for periods of time that I contest to be unacceptable, and can contribute to a loss to any business running on their servers about 1-2 times per year. I believe the trouble with the downtime that they have is that they share their hosting servers with their sister hosting companies such as HostGator, and a few others that the parent company had brought into their happy hosting family (even if they deny the fact of being associated together, but it's no coincidence that Hostgator is down the same time as BlueHost each time it does go down).
Other than that, the hosting for BlueHost is again, above average. Customer Service: 5/5 stars
 One thing that I must say though is that their customer service has always been there to answer questions that I have had at all times of the day, and night. They are very helpful, friendly people who will do everything they can to help you figure out an issue that you may have, even if it doesn't fall under the category of it being their problem.
One thing though, make sure that you have an adequate amount of time to wait late nights U.S times, because it seems that they are only staffing a few people if not one person on at those times, so expect anywhere from right away to 25 minute waiting periods. Just don't forget that you have that extra window open, because nothing is more frustrating than forgetting you had it open and the person leaves because you're not responding. Price: 3/5 stars
The pricing for their product aren't the best deals if you attempt to go past the shared hosting subscription.
Buying a domain name from here would be silly for anyone to do considering you can always go to GoDaddy.com and use some coupon code to get one for 0.99 - 2.99 all day long. The rest of the products are priced as they are in many other places. I believe they can do better on pricing so they can compete more.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
First of all Bluehost is slow, very slow, and my sites have minimal traffic. Mandatory php updates messed up my sites, so I had to fix them. Calling bluehost is bad idea as you will be spending long time before the maybe pick up, so I usually just go for live chat.
Today I received an email telling me about malware and all my sites are disabled. Disappointment is the word. Will be switching to another hosting company.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Their support is a team of professionals, hey always have my websites up and running 24/7, also super quick at responding to our emails. The servers always are up. Bluehost is awesome.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Worst experience ever with Customer Service. After chating via 'support' repeatedly because e-mail server is down (this happens almost twice a week) i end up being dumped by their operator ! He requested me to give outgoing and ingoing email server which i did.
Twice, i repeat, Twice he did not read among my lines and reasked me the same information. First time i kindly told him to read above, but the second time I Demanded him to pay attention... on which he answers saying that I , a client, am not Professional!!
Can you believe it? He operator cannot pay attention and read my information and calls me a client, Unprofessional. After that he closes the chat support !
And say goodbye. Unbelievable & Shameful. I have sent the whole transcript to the feedback of Bluehost and have so far not received any information!
The e-mail server is still down, and as a business conversing daily with cients !! This reprents a big problem. I will switch to German Server.
Forget Bluehost... To many problems and customer service is unprofessional!!! The irony...

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: BlueHost has excellent customer service. I signed up and about a week later I saw they were running a special on the hosting price. I contacted them and they gave me the option to get the promotional price,  no problem!!! Just know what you are asking,  be specific,  ask for supervisor if the agent working with you is unable to assist you.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost has gone down twice in the last 100 days for more than 12 hours each time. No email and no website. Their phones have gone down too, so the only option was to communicate through Twitter.
They gave standard answers to the hundreds of people wondering what was wrong. They won't give an estimated repair time or disclose the nature of the problem. After service was restored there was no further communication.
No apology, no offer of a credit for downtime, no statement of what they are doing to prevent the problem in the future, no nothing. We pay for a dedicated server, but that doesn't seem to make any difference. We are investigating the options and will move our hosting elsewhere.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Appalling service, terrible uptime and best avoided if you value your business. My site has been down 7 times this year - the latest being for over 24 hours.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been with BlueHost for 3 years but they are having issues. I was caught in the 2 days of intermittent downtime for 4 sites. My sites were offline for updates to the servers longer than expected (why is this necessary when they could have mirrored to online servers?).
When the servers were back up they were insanely slow while they "fixed a problem". Simply pinging the servers take about twice as long as my other previous hosts
Their support simply does not know the technical side and give only what the people actually running the servers give them. having the tech people report to a superior who relays the information live to the support staff would help this a lot.
Even their twitter account provided more info than they could. If you are running a blog or low traffic site they are not bad because your viewers are more likely to wait when the site is slow. I can't recommend them if you do any e-commerce because the site can come off as not reliable turning customers away.
Would I recommend it to friends? Depends on their needs but most likely not any more.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I am extremely delighted by using BlueHost on my blog. Six months back it was a new and completely unknown name for me and I used to wonder why so many of the webmasters prefer using BlueHost for the websites/blogs rather going for an alternative. My friends recommended me to BlueHost and I am using it since the last six months.
I did not face even a single problem and my website has 100% uptime till date! The hosting service is also very good. The website opens in a moment!
I had zero knowledge on handling a website but their services are very simple hence I did not face any problem while managing my website. Also, their support is very user-friendly and is ready to solve customer's queries within 24 hours. This host is suitable for everyone - from the new webmasters to the most experienced ones!
I can't even believe that my site has grown and is one of the trusted websites in my niche! Thanks to BlueHost, for giving me an esteemed online presence and making me feel proud. I would like to recommend this service to all my dear friends!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
No Doubt About BlueHost Rocks! Bluehost offers a shared web hosting solution to all customers. BlueHost allows the cost of server maintenance to be shared between users, allowing Bluehost to offer a professional quality web hosting solution to each user for a matter of a few dollars each month.Each client domain is situated on its own section of a server that is shared with other client domains
Free domains are one of the most beneficial features offered by Bluehost.
You can get one free domain from Bluehost, no matter whether you want to register a new domain or transfer an existing domain. Many web hosts offer free domain name, only if you register a new one with them. Bluehost is the only web hosting company that allows you to get a free domain name even while transferring your primary domain name to them.
You can avail of a domain name for free for the first year and you need to renew afterwards. Bluehost supports WordPress. One can set up a site or blog easily and quickly with Bluehost’s one click Simple Scripts install. Bluehost also allows to install several WordPress sites on the same web hosting account effortlessly.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I enjoy BlueHost over the majority of hosts I currently used. I recently switched to BlueHost when I had enough of GoDaddy and their "support"
I went with BlueHost and it basically was an instant setup. I just had to configure my site to WordPress in the cpanel.
They do handle my support queries easily, as long as it's in the morning or at night. If it's in the afternoon, I'd have to wait 15-20 minutes. The staff for the most part is friendly, easy to work with, and setup my nameservers easily. I'd recommend this to my friend because their prices are Extremely cheap and easily affordable for a small business.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: BlueHost was fantastic and I don't regret going with them, they have a good support team that has fixed all my inquiries. I don't know any code at all but that doesn't matter, using their one click installs you do not need technical expertise. I have recommended this site to my friends

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I can only relate my own story but searches online suggest that my experience is quite common with this company. Firstly I wasted over a year on their shared hosting that constantly throttled my sites. I went down from 300 to 500 visitors a day to maybe 150 per day.
Google stopped sending me traffic as some pages would take up to 19 secs to load. Then I decided to move over to VPS and this was the final straw. After less than 24 hours my site went down and although I started up tickets and received automated responses, I never had a human get in touch after repeated emails, Online chat was unavailable after moving to VPS and my only option was to phone them.
Being from the UK, I decided to cut my losses and give up on hosting. Before my sites went down, I'd luckily decided to mirror my site on Blogger. When my VPS went down I lost all my images, as they were being hot-linked from Bluehost, but I'm happy to go through my entire site as long as I don't have to suffer by the likes of Bluehost.
My advice is stay clear of this company. In my experience, they're a complete waste of time, as their customer care was none existent for me. Since moving to Blogger my site has risen in rank from just under 2 million to 700 near thousand.
My page speeds, even on image intense posts, are under 5 secs. My site is basically where it should have been for the last year or so but which was kept under by poor hosting.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I hosting about 10 sites in my bluehost account for an year now and i could say that it has the best shared hosting platform ever built . I have not faced a downtime with the sites. But the response time of the server is little slow compared to HostGator.
After i bought a dedicated Ip address the response time to service improved a little. I am overall satisfied with their hosting service and its the best value for our money. I Highly recommend them.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Blue host sucks and here is why:
We wanted to upgrade our account to the pro account and they messed up the backend of switching over from one server to the next. When we tried to call "tech" support, no one could help us and led us to various dead ends- one being to backup all of our websites which took ten hours and did nothing. We lost thousands of dollars in our worth of time by trying to fix their mistake.
We finally received help from a tech who said that normally, the hosting company would not support switching over files from the backend which is ridiculous since everything that was supposed to be switched over from one server to the other was not switched over by them! Our websites were down for two days at this point and while this sixth tech helped us, he had to cap his time because bluehost would not allow him to help us any further - I am completely outraged and disappointed that "upgrading" was like "downgrading" because we are paying more for hosting in which they broke links, plugins, switched around other various files that did not exist before, and did not wish to fix their mistake. The thing that really got to me was when I was giving the supervisor feedback, all he said was that the support could not help us any more because our website developer should have known how to fix this.
Well, 1. how would the website developer know what the server was in the beginning that we used versus the one that they changed it to? 2. Why couldn't the first five of your tech guys identify this issue if this is such a routine change?
He had no answer to the first question and to the second question he just said that the last tech we talked to had to delve "deeper" and that is why he could not stay helping us - how does that answer my second question? He was no help at all and just basically said well now that you know how we messed up Your Site, you can fix it now. I definitely do not suggest going to the hosting company because the customer service is horrible, and don't upgrade if you want the same quality of service that you get before you upgrade.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've signed up with dozens of webhosts through the years and Never had this much trouble setting up a new account - and None of them have asked for a copy of my driver's license and credit card!! If you're trying to setup a site fast, Don't use BlueHost!
2 days of trying to setup the account - finally I called them on the 3rd day and was told I had to send them a copy of my license and credit card. I asked them to please wait while I send it, and they said No one was available to review it until tomorrow! This, combined with people just didn't seem to care about me as a new/potential customer means - Awful customer service!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
The only thing I would add is that when one technician helps a customer, that he/she take notes for when they're gone and someone else takes that first technician's shift. Perhaps they do this. Because someone (like me) may call just an hour later needing help and they second shift needs to know what the first shift did.
Otherwise, I have been very happy with the level of support and training at Blue Host. I became an affiliate because I believe strongly that customers need help 24/7 availability plus phone help plus technicians that are based right here in the USA. That is why I went with Blue Host in the first place.
Those three things were vitally important to me as a customer. Brenda Kula

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: I have a site that gets less than 50 visitors a day and my site is being Throttled for CPU usages! If running Wordpress Look somewhere else! There are obviously overselling their servers.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Bluehost is fantastic, I've had hosting with them for almost 3 years, I've had the occasional downtime, for server issues. But it's a shared environment no one can really guarantee 100% uptime. They definitely have the best technical support I've ever dealt with. I've had websites with over 10 other providers and I will choose bluehost again and again, over and over.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost is a great host, I've been with them for a couple of years. There offers are great, aswell as their friendly support. I've told all my friends about them, and family.
It is a very stable host for practically anything, their prices fit all boxes and suite all needs. I shall continue using bluehost forever.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
There is nothing that I did not find in Bluehost hosting. They give you everything. Unlike other webhosts, the web site configuration is very easy.
The hosting is loaded with options. The best thing is unlimited hosting space and unlimited domain names. Support is always very helpful and quick to answer.
They answer queries very professionally whether over the phone or online chat. I never had any big problems with them. The only problem I had was mySQL connect error, which they responded to very quickly and tackled in 5 minutes.
being a pleased customer, I have mentioned and recommended Bluehost in many of forums I visit. The one thing I noticed is that when you sign up for first year they charge you $6.95 a year. But you should know that this is discounted price only for one year.
From second year onwards, the cost would be a little higher. But then you wont have to pay for the domain registration ever in life! The cost of Bluehost webhosting is a little higher compared to other ones but it is something you can depend upon.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been with Bluehost for nearly 8 months. Generally speaking, this hosting is considered to be an awesome hosting. High as its price is, the performance is exciting.
Here I will make a comprehensive evaluation of Bluehost. Fame
It is generally acknowledged that bluehost is a Superb Hosting provider, which is recommended by wordpress.org. Established in 1996, its experience and reputation are much superior to other hosting providers, which is a crucial reason for me to choose Bluehost.
Customer Service
Live chat, ticket and telephone consist of 24/7 customer service. The problem can be solved rapidly by means of live chat. And you will get a reply in ten minutes if submit a ticket.
Uptime
Hardly am I satisfied with the network uptime of Bluehost, which scarcely reach 99.9% that they guarantee. It is always down couples of times every month. According to the statistics from jiankongbao.com, there is only one month in which the network uptime percentage is more than 99.9%(January, 2011, 99.97%, down only 1 minute).
Accordingly, fortune, to a large extent, is a significantly indispensable factor when you purchase a web hosting. Value
Numerous hosting provider maintain a policy that paying a little money for first purchase, but considerably higher price when you renew it. Bluehost is not a exception.
From promotion link, it only costs $59.4 every year($4.95 per month). Nevertheless, when you want to renew it, you will find that it cost $107.4 per year($8.95 per month) for one-year-duration. But it is worthy to buy it.
Features
SimpleScripts, one-click script installs, is a not only excellent but also convenient tool to install trementous quantities of scripts. Free shared SSL can be used by small commercial websites. Conclusion
As far as I am concerned, Bluehost is the best web hosting I have used, which performed exceedingly well.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been with Bluehost for 6 months now. I left Fatcow (ugh) because of very Very poor support that liked to blame it all on you for any failures. in the end my website was always going down.
Blamed me but it always turned out to be them..every time. I am using the Cloud service with Bluehost. Uptime has been 99.9%.
the chat support is sourced overseas. the phone support is USA based. I got alot more accomplished by phone.
The chat support has no clue whats going on. The wait time has been 10-20 minutes and on one occasion 30 minutes. thats FAR too long for me so thats why I am not happy with support.
The price is very reasonable and I always look to what the renewable coast will be...not what first year entry is. ignore that. thats just the cherry on top.
Anyway, I am not a fan of cpanel because i learned my way around using the vdeck. Also alot of pages in their site to jump around to. To me its unorganized but..i get where i need to be by following the same path each time.
i use Weebly pro and Bluehost is the Only webhost that has NOT upgraded their weebly. Very disappointed in this and have complained repeatedly. Zero replies from their feedback emails.
i have sent in atleast 6 emails requesting them to upgrade this. i have gone ignored which pisses me off. the cpanel sometimes has issues loading weebly as well..but provides a link for it if it isnt.
ugh..another link to click on. Andddd to explain why it is important to me for them to upgrade weebly is..the old version of weebly publishes the Entire site. The newer weebly software Only publishes what changes you made..making it fast when publishing.
I have a large website and it takes hours to publish then sometimes it takes 2-3 times before it shows to have gone through. If they would upgrade weebly, i would be tickled pink. But right now I am on the fence about leaving Bluehost because of this one issue.
If you dont use weebly then their wont be an issue i am sure. I am afraid to go elsewhere too because of so many up and down reviews of other webhosts. I have tried SiteGround and Host Gator.
They wouldnt let me rebuild my site without moving it over to them immediately...meaning my down time would be 2-4 weeks. thats how long it would take me to rebuild it. Its about 500 pages.
so I left them and Bluehost allowed me to do this so I had Zero downtime. So its tricky to find the right webhost that will offer what you are looking for. Everyone is looking for something different and so reviews are not really something to go by.
I mean the star ratings. you need to Read the reviews and see what others are complaining about. It is obvious some of these people have no clue what they want or need and just complain.
So that makes the star rating go up or down. sad to say really. I think all you can do is make an effort to call and speak to someone on the phone to get fast answers and solutions.
Waiting for an email/ticket is not a high priority way to contact them. Call!!!!!! Is there a place to leave reviews about websites?
Cause I sure see some really horrible websites that people actually think are acceptable. Scream. Huge text scrolled from side to side..no images.
Pop ups as soon as you log onto their site. Try reading an article with constant pop ups. I leave those and never go back.
same for the large texts. also the click bait sites. OMG what a nightmare.
It should be neat, organized and in a font that everyone can read easily. these girly cursive funky lettering wont work. you want to run people off?
thats how you do it. all I mentioned above.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Choosing a good host for your website can be difficult, especially if you're on a budget. However, I decided to choose BlueHost and it turned out to be a terrible mistake.
1. In the first few days of joining BlueHost, my website was down at least five times and in the customer support, when I told them about the problem, they didn't know how to fix it or they didn't see anything wrong yet my website was clearly down!
The times my website was up, it lagged a lot and was loading slowly most of the time, yet there was little to no content on the site itself! If anyone is looking to get serious with their website. BlueHost is definitely NOT the way to go.
2.
Although the customer service was quite fast, it seemed to me, that the people there didn't know much more than I did. They couldn't fix any problems I had or they couldn't find the issue.
3. I didn't get 100% of my money back when canceled.
They didn't give me a full refund although on their landing page, they say clearly that there is a 100% money back guarantee. I got about $10 less, and when I contacted about my issue, they always tried to somehow change topic to make me buy their service again or make me leave. They were not helpful.
I ended up losing my money and I consider this a scam as they just took the money for nothing.
4. There were many features in BlueHost cpanel, yet most of them were completely useless and an average person would have nothing to do with them. All I needed was to install WordPress and from there, I only used what WordPress offered and nothing to do with BlueHost.
However, despite all the negative there were a few good things about BlueHost you cannot find elsewhere:
1. You get a Free domain when signing up with them, which is very great because you will save at least $10/year.
2. It's very cheap and the best host for a low budget.
Conclusion: If you are on a low-budget, BlueHost is the way to go, however if you want to build a serious site with no downtime and make sure everything is running how it's supposed to, then BlueHost is the worst choice you could make. I personally would not recommend BlueHost to anyone if it weren't for the free domain.

reviews.review_text:
From my point of view BlueHost is one of the best if you want wordpress platform with your hosting. After all it is recommended by wordpress themselves. But they give a lot of features which gives complete value for the money.Their customer support is quite good and resonably fast.But it could be better.I think this host is suitanle for anyone who wants to start a blog espacially a wordpress blog. They also have free domain name for one year . They have handled problems quite effectively.
Their uptime is also pretty good. At the present i think their servers are down for maintainence. I would summarize the above with following words
  " Blue host is close to perfect for customers who want to start a wordpress blog with dmain name and many other features.Price are also good.
Customer service is laos very good. For blog hosting i wwoukld give it a 4.5 star"

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Before I began my first real site, I had some experience with free hosting sites. Compared to them, BlueHost is an elite hosting. The features offered at BlueHost, are brilliant. $4.95 a month for an unlimited hosting with free domain, is something you rarely see.
It would probably be number 1 hosting, if it wasn't for these 2 things:
- Uptime isn't dependable - 3 months ago, my site was down for about 40 minutes. Every serious webmaster know that even less than 1 hour, can seriously hurt his online profits. This only happened once, and I received an apology on email, shortly after.
If anything, its good that they are aware of the downtime.
- Site design is too simple - Many ran away after they witnessed it. I tried to get a friend of mine to host at BlueHost like me, but it was futile. He believed that anyone with basic computer skills could design a site that way, so according to him - it was scam.
They need to make their design more professional. That way, people will trust them more. Since its so simple, its great for beginners and experts alike.
Support is friendly and replies fast. I recommend this host for people that want to start their own business. I host my shop there, and that downtime was the only thing I hate about them. In a nutshell, great hosting service.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Im an IT manager of a large transportation company in Reno, NV. For years we had a smaller local company host our 9 domains and things were okay. The issue was support.
The sys admin for that small hosting company only worked 4 hours a day. If I needed support during those off hours, I was out of luck and it badly reflected on our sites. Also, their hosting service cost us $180/mo!!!
No kidding! Ive since, recently, switched to BlueHost. As I cannot comment on uptime just yet, the rest of the service is Grade A+.
Support really does live up to its claim:  a voice on the line in less than 30 seconds. See if Your hosting service can do that.... We run three different WordPress sites and they load faster than the other host we had.
Also, we host SQL databases on two different servers at our facility and the redirects and A-records set on Bluehost work flawlessly. All in all, and for the money, Bluehost Rocks!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have had a terrible time with Bluehost. I have many accounts and sites with them and experience downtime regularly, even with the Pro accounts, which I upgraded to with the hope that the service would be better. Often the sites are slow - they hang for a period of time while trying to load.
I think it has to do with PHP processing, MySQL requests, or both, so if you use either, Do not use Bluehost. At other times the sites are completely unresponsive. I have a lot of my client's websites here and I've nearly lost clients due to the poor reliability.
I have to worry about it constantly. I would move all of my sites from Bluehost, but it would probably take me a week or more to do it and I just don't have that kind of time. They heavily promote the fact that you can put as many sites on one account as you want.
Why??!! Ever since they started that, performance and reliability have nose dived. I Do not recommend Bluehost.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: I love Bluehost since I had my domain for a couple of years now and so far I have no problems. I like the design of the domain panel and I got a really good price. I would recommend Bluehost.
