website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Well, I started venturing into this website tings by May 2008 and realized after a few months that I need a paid hosting to get started. Free ones won't do for my big ambitions. But I was not ready to spend out huge bucks.
So, after doing a lot of research when I was getting more and more confused I stumbled on to Bluehost. And believe me I am so happy I did. Cost- Though normally it costs 6.95$/month, I signed up through an offer from some site for 2 years at 3.95$/month.
Very cheap in my opinion. Flavors- Unlike other hosts, Bluehost only has a single offer and gives almost everything you can ask in a shared hosting in it. What I got at 3.95$/month would have cost me 10$ at other hosts for sure.
Features- You can host unlimited domains and get unlimited disc space and bandwidth. Surprised? No, they don't mean limited, its really unlimited.
Fair Usage Policy states that there is a limit on CPU usage at a time but bandwidth and disc space is really unlimited without any fineprints. You get all you need- Fanastico, Simplescripts, PHP, Perl, 50$ Adwords voucher, 25$ YSM and Miva each and more. Comes with the latest CPanel too.
The only little concern is that your MySQL is limited to 100 but who uses so much in a shared account anyway? Performance- Bluehost is fantastic in performance, Period. Never had any issues upto now.
Good page load speed, fast script installations. I never got any downtime. A++
Support- Just needed to contact support twice and they were very knowledgeable and prompt.
Answered my queries instantaneously and were infact eager to help. Got my identity confirmed for Adwords code in minutes. Value- When I get features and performance of 10$/month host at 3.95$ you know its a steal.
Even if I had bought it for 6.95$ it would have been a steal for that sum. Conclusion- If you are in need of a shared host with top notch performance, this is the one. Don't think about anything else.
You can search about its flaw. I guarantee you won't find any. P.S.- They also have a great affiliate system.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Bluehost is a powerful and economical hosting. It was very pleasant particularly the experience with this company, a leading worldwide as a Web hosting company is concerned. The price is excellent in relation to other companies market leaders such as HostGator or Banahosting.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
When I was looking to choose the best web hosting I started research to find out best hosting industry to host my site and read reviews on different websites to get familiar with it. After a long research I made my final decision to choose Bluehost.com and I registered my account with it. After registering the hosting plan on Bluehost.com I was directed to my client account area where everything was available to help me out.
I started using CPanel and installed CMS "WordPress" and it took only seconds to complete. The available tutorials inside the client area helped me a lot and I learnt almost everything regarding the Cpanel and few other things about hosting which I didn't know before. I am in love with Bluehost.com because it has saved my time by sending me an email to notify that the version of new WordPress has been released and there was a just one step to follow and which is to update the WordPress manually or let Bluehost.com update it whenever new version "WordPress release" I allowed Bluehost.com to update it automatically so I do not need to disturb myself to update WordPress.
The support provided by the team of Bluehost.com is excellent because my queries were answered very quickly. Features are also great and I have never faced any downtime issue. I would recommend it to everyone whoever is looking for best hosting company.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've been a Bluehost customer for the past 3 years at the Plus web hosting level. I build WordPress powered websites and simple Html/CSS/JavaScript sites. In that time I have never seen service go down long enough for me to notice it (so as far as I know, it never has!).
Bluehost offers a lot of great baked-in features such as: CloudFlare integration, easy one-click installs for a wide range of common apps such as Wordpress and Drupal via MojoMarketplace (previously known as SimpleScripts), easy creation of email accounts with help configuring you email client, easy setup of FTP accounts with help configuring your FTP client, easy setup of databases, a web-based file manager if you don't want to use an FTP client, phpMyAdmin to manage your databases, and countless other features I haven't used yet. I've only been in touch with Bluehost customer service once, and that was to ask a really obscure question about PHP security for an article I was writing. I half expected them to brush me off since the question wasn't really relevant to anything they were doing for me, but they didn't.
It took 2 or 3 minutes (which was totally ok based on how obscure my question was) and then came back with an intelligent answer and explanation. I was pleased. I did not shop around when I originally bought hosting from Bluehost, and a couple of times I've thought to myself: "I really should check out some other hosting providers". However, every time I do I come away unconvinced that there's anyone else that offers a better setup for my hosting needs at a better price.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I had a shared BlueHost account for many years. They seem to be the most valuable shared hosting provider out there with cPanel, which is a great way to manage websites on your own. One day, I received a notification from BlueHost out of the blue that I had violated their acceptable use policy and that my service was suspended.
I had no recourse due to being locked out of my shared account so I contact their live chat support that told me I was using their server as a storage host which is against their policy. The offending files that they thought I was hosting on the shared account was 2 cPanel backups that were in the root and were recently generated and soon to be downloaded. I explained that it was simply a backup of my site (by a utility and method that is provided by them) but they would not back down.
I sent an email to the very public CEO of the company who returned my email with a very rude comment about not reading the terms and conditions and being a bad customer. The bottom line is that, from my experience, their service is good, however their policies and support reps (including the CEO himself) do a very poor job of communicating their policies and understanding the ramifications of backing up your website and how it relates to their policies. If you cannot afford to have your website down due to false accusations of abuse then this provider is not for you.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: I am using Bluehost hosting service for more than 10 years for my business. reviews.review_text:

reviews.review_text: I used BlueHost always, I am a user for 10 years, the truth I have never had serious problems that would make me want to switch hosting. I recommend it 100%

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Vote for Bluehost ! BlueHost has been in business  since 2002. They have over 20,000 customers and hosting millions of domains.
They are huge and successful. Many web hosts have gone out of business and yet they are growing big and fast. They must have served their customers very well.
All their customer supports are US based. They are using the world #1 web hosting control panel – the CPanel. They provide an installer known as SimpleScripts that allows you to install more than 50 scripts easily, including all the popular scripts such as WordPress, Joomla, Drupal and Magento.
They offer Anytime money back guarantee. If you are unhappy with them, you can cancel your account and get the unused portion back. If you cancel before the first 30 days, you get a full refund.
Most web hosts rent a datacenter because it is very costly to own one. Bluehost actually build their own datacenter! They have full control and access to their servers which means problems can be solved faster.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been a Bluehost customer for about 12 years. They started out being all around terrific. The support staff was knowledgeable, service was great, no downtime issues.
The $5.95/month cost for three years of service was a bargain. However, I've noticed that, in the past three years, service response time has deteriorated considerably. The expected response time on chats is usually ridiculously underestimates how long the wait will be.
My latest renewal has bumped by three year rate all the way up to $10.99/month. I tried to reach them about it this morning, and after 30 minutes waiting on an expected "six minute" wait time, I was asked for my verification information to begin the chat. After 15 more minutes of waiting, I finally gave up. If you go with them, the website uptime and web performance is good, but these cost issues and service problems are a deal killer.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been a Bluehost customer for 12 years, and I am sad to say that I am now looking for a new web host. When I started with them, you could not find better value for the money or better support, and I had unlimited storage and bandwidth and a free domain, but they are horrible now. They are charging me twice as much as when I started with them, they have dropped my storage, and now I have to pay for my domain too.
On top of all that, their customer service is almost non-existent. I contacted them about 2 months ago about a billing problem. I attempted to get chat support, and had to wait in the queue.
It said the wait time would be 28 minutes each time, but then the time kept getting extended, and then when it was my turn I got dropped, so I finally called them. I was on the phone for about 2 Hours, and every time I got someone on the line, they would tell me that I had to be transferred to another department. I was transferred to the same departments over and over again, and they never did anything to help me.
When I finally asked to speak to a supervisor, they told me there wasn't one there. Altogether I wasted about 4 hours with no results.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost is so incredibly terrible that I've given up on my website until I can change hosting providers. I've had Bluehost for about 8 months,  and for the first 7 months I found them to be acceptable,  despite their difficult-to-negotiate website that pushes the sale of additional products so hard that it feels like you're walking down the Vegas Strip or through South Beach. But in the last two weeks I've had nothing but frustration with them.
Initially the problem that my site would occasionally be down,  and at other times would be frustratingly slow. Over the course of this past weekend,  it got FAR worse - my site was down more than it was up;  oftentimes I couldn't edit the site and anybody who tried to visit the site would get a "site not found" error message. A complaint ticket went unanswered for 2 days.
Today I received an e-mail saying that the problem was solved,  yet today it was worse than ever - again and again my editor would give me a "cannot connect to server" error message. Until I find a better provider, I'm only doing basic editing and sure as hell am not marketing my site - the last thing I want to have happen is for somebody to try to visit my site and have it yield an error message or take minutes to load. Bluehost is horrific - try them out at your peril.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost (VPs) suck. Twice in the past week my development server has gone down and all support did was "create tickets" on which there was no follow up. Of course as a web developer with sensitive deadlines (for lawyers and law firms no less) this was catastrophic.
The general sentiment is non-apologetic and you can't even get in touch with any higher ups, ever. When you've got a complaint, they literally direct you to "[email protected]" - who often diverts your queries right back down to lower level "support." I'm flabbergasted that this service is recommended by WordPress.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Bought a hosting package from bluehost only to find out the ip they gave me was blacklisted for spam. Contacted support and they told me to contact every email service provider and file to be removed. Could take months costing my company time and money.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost has been the most convenient way to host. Iv had three websites put up on bluehost and I love how they operate. Warnings before every maintenance and very fast support.
I will continue using bluehost and I recommend it to everyone out there. Cheers!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I am delighted with Bluehost. I am a small business owner, author, and co-founder of a non-profit. After a bad experience hiring a programmer who used Joomla I transferred my site to Bluehost.
Prior to hiring the programmer I had experiences with another provider and with GoDaddy (via Google). I was extremely unhappy with GoDaddy. At the time I could not figure out how to move my site to HostMonster despite many hours attempting to do so.
I eventually abandoned the URL because of my inability to get it to work on GoDaddy as I wanted it to and inability to move it. With HostMonster I was not receiving the help/guidance I needed. With Bluehost my calls are answered and I have been patiently provided with the assistance needed to learn how to manage my sites and get them to do what I want.
I have called many times and received great help from people who speak a language it is easy for me to understand-- English. I feel confident in my ability to get help when needed at Bluehost based on the help I have received so far. I've probably had 10 calls to them, some lasting more than an hour.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I'm with bluehost for a decade now. Thanks to them I could start my own hosting business. The best shared hosting experience i had.
I have given several referral business to bluehost and made my money through affiliate, Now after a decade, I started their dedicated hosting, boy this dedicated hosting really sucks. I subscribed for the best of the server, their premium package, and in four months or so, I'm fed up. wanted to pull out buy for some reasons, I'm waiting to finish one year, and that's it.
Goodbye to bluehost dedicated. never again. Every day there is downtime, every second there is downtime, on a average, if i show my report from two monitoring sites you will see the facts, it really really sucks.
they dont have a failover for dedicated hosting, i will alert all people reading this to stay away from bluehost dedicated until you read good review about them. if you are willing to take headaches and pay more you can choose bluehost dedicated. I see it as just another shared hosting, speed, and everything is as equal to shared hosting.
I have reports to prove it. Stay shared hosting with dedicated IP and its good, bluehost is meant to be shared hosting. They cannot be trusted for dedicated and VPS.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
The specs on my dedicated server were very appealing, and the price, $120/month for a full year was great. However, I was there for 1 year and the outages were severe. November 20th, 2013, multi hour outage
December 31st, 2013, multi hour outage
April 16th, 2014, 12+ hour outage.
Each and every outage, the website and control panel for BlueHost goes down. There is no way to figure out what is wrong with your server except going through Twitter and Facebook. Even then, the only responses I've had back are "We are aware of an issue and our admin team is engaged to resolve it as soon as possible.
No ETA at this time."
Nothing solid is ever told about what happened, or what they are planning to do about fixing it. Without the outages, the speed is decent. The server I had was on a gigabit line, but could never download faster than 5mbit on my Time Warner Cable's 100mbit plan.
They blamed it on Cogent. I am glad to cancel their service. Pay more for something reliable.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Support is easily found, yet incompetent at best. They actually managed to accidentally delete all of my websites- yes, proper Delete them. Thank god for backups.
It took them 3 days to get back to me and fix the issue, with no apology, only to say that someone must have clicked the wrong thing. Well, DUH. They lose service all the time, the downtime is shocking for such a huge multimillion dollar company.
As I'm writing this it's been down for over 4 hours without explanation- and that's for everyone, not just me. I have been toying with the idea of moving to another host for a long time but been avoiding it because of the hassle, but after today? The hassle is worth it.
Heed my warning, don't go with bluehost. Remember that just because SO many people are advertising it and trying to get you to buy it, that they are all affiliates so they don't care if Bluehost is crap or not, because they get paid when you sign up.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Bluehost rocks - every time I have called regarding a recent website migration, the staff has been extremely helpful! Not only a person answering the phone, but help too... unheard of in my experience with hosting companies. Person who helped me was John Boone

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
If you run any kind of serious business or host websites / e-mails for clients with serious businesses then Bluehost is the Last host you ever want to go with. Servers go down for days at a time every month, no matter if you're on a dedicated server or VPS. Their proxy servers for e-mails are constantly added to spam lists so multiple times during the day nobody can send any e-mails out.
I've been with a few hosting companies and this is one of the worst when it comes to reliability. As everyone mentioned, customer support is quick to answer but more often then not there is little they can do except saying "Sorry"
We've lost more than one customer thanks to their horrible reliability and up time. Hard to get any work done when nobody can send e-mails out for 2 days.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have used Bluehost for a few years and was totally happy. Recommended it to other people, too. But in the last couple of months, a very important feature has disappeared.
I have contacted support about it several times, and nothing ever gets resolved. Support has always been great and helpful. Now they are still courteous, but not so helpful.
Prior to a couple of months ago, I was able to go to Site Backup and Restore and download a zip file of my whole site plus the database. Then something happened, and I am unable to do that anymore. I even subscribed to BackupPro, thinking that if I paid (which I was OK with doing) I could get the cpanel backup again.
No, that didnt work either and I asked for my money to be refunded. I am getting errors when I go to download the zip file. I know they provide hosting for a minimum charge, but if a service is no longer going to be offered, all they have to do is say that.
I can't seem to get any kind of straight answer about backups, except that, as I was told on my last call, that backups are a courtesy service and don't Have to be provided. I have noticed that my site runs very slow. Before I even signed up, I told tech support I was going to be hosting a site that sells hi rez images.
They said not a problem, I would not come anywhere near the limits, so go for it, which I did. Today, I notice that they are doing CPU throttling. I am very disappointed in what has happened at Bluehost the past couple of months.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
We deal with several hosting companies since we build websites for clients but we aren't in the hosting business so we insist clients host their own sites. Have had many issues with configuring "standard" functionality like PHPmail & sendmail for example with some big-name hosting companies. No such problems with Bluehost- as a matter of fact, it's the company we recommend to our clients when they are looking for advice.
The support from Bluehost isn't the greatest but that's par for the course. The online chat support pretty normally has a 20 minute queue and then 5 minutes for them to "get" your issue. After that, once the catch on to the problem, they usually stick with you and have some good recommendations.
For $10 a month, you really can't expect much more than that. Speaking of $10 a month - it's very disappointing that the  low cost of entry (about $4 a month) expires after a year and raises significantly with no coupons available after the first year. For a small site, it's worth just getting a new $4 a month account and then moving everything over.
Seems like a lot of work for them and for the consumer. The strategy might be working but it makes most of my clients "shop" every year. I'd recommend Bluehost look at a retention strategy to build long time loyalty that will help then get long time referrals. Just a thought.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Thank you Sooooo muchh John Boone!!! You are a very dedicated helper. The service was outstanding and efficient it is a pleasure working with technician like you. My personal suggestions is that bluehost should give trophies with bonus to their employers like "John Boone".

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've been to Bluehost for 2- 3 years now but for the past months Bluehost servers became way too slow, I can't even access the control panel without flipping 5-10 pages on a magazine. Seriously I have to wait 30 - 60 seconds to load my site and/or even my cpanel. Customer service is not so helpful either.
I told them my site is loading too slow and it wasn't like that before. They gave me 10 lists to check to optimize the site (solve the problem), and I did all those and my site still in no progress. Until I check online if there are people suffering from the same dilemma I have, and found that there are actually lots of them!
So I figured out it's not my website but it's Bluehost server. Apparently the only solution to that is to bump to a Pro Plan, unfortunately I can't afford to pay $25/month ($300/year) for that so I'll have to say goodbye to Bluehost. It's been a really disappointing experience these past months. I cannot recommend this hosting to anyone (unless it doesn't bother you to wait 48 years to load Your Site).

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've always recommended Bluehost to my friends and family for their hosting needs. As a longtime customer, I can attest that any problems are resolved very quickly and accurately. A few weeks ago, I had inquired about why the hosted email service was slow.
Someone looked into it, and not the mail service is faster than ever. There have been times when my billing got messed up and they credited the amount immediately and gave me a domain name free for a year. Bluehost does, indeed, rock.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Disappointing downward trend on uptime. We have had an account with Bluehost for over ten years, and were initially very happy with them; we even set up several of our clients with accounts there (we design websites). We host Wordpress sites, primarily, and they have been pretty good in supporting it.
But in the last year or so, uptime/reliability has been dropping off - an hour here, a half-hour there, sometimes over an hour. In the last week, there have been two different outages, one affecting some accounts (including ours), but the other one seems to have taken out their entire site. We couldn't get through to support either by phone or online chat.
Bluehost used to be very good, with great value for the money, but the quality has been dropping, perhaps as they try to cut costs. We will probably not renew our accounts this time.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: I migrated from a. Net hosting to bluehost and things are key for me are knowledgeable and technical problem fixing in a very friendly way not someone that treats me like a piece of crap even when I ask question. Bluehost did that excellently even when they transferred me from one dept to another. God bless Bluehost :)

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost is always available and the tech. support goes above and beyond in helping me with any questions or issue I have. They are patient, speak fluent English, and are knowledgeable.
Bluehost, as a company and organization, has integrity. This is hard to find these days. I've recommended them to many people and all of them have been equally as happy with their service. Ted Mitchell

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Value for money hosting service, up-time of server 99.9% and support level excellent. I am using Drupal 7 and Magento Commerce sites and they running perfectly

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
When I read about Bluehost, a lot of the reviews about it, I didn't think it was anything special. Looking at their prices, for $6.95 per month for virtually unlimited hosting, I simply thought it was a lie. It wasn't.
When I signed up for Bluehost, and got activated, almost instantly, I was surprised at how quick the set up was. Just a few minutes later, after installing Wordpress to test out my new hosting, I was amazed at how fast the systems ran. Soon after, I purchased a dedicated IP, so I could run a piece of software on the server.
After about ten seconds after opening a live support chat, a friendly operator accepted my live support chat, and opened a port on the server for me, which took less than two minutes. Once or twice there was a little bit of downtime, but this was clearly stated on their site, as it was for maintenance purposes. It lasted slightly less than ten minutes.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
The good:
Bluehost is great for your first hosting experience. It is very easy to set up a site with them. Their prices are very cheap, and they don't bury you with tons of different hosting plans.
In fact there is just one! They offer most of the basics for getting Your Site up like Cpannel with Fantastico. The not so good:
Just because they plaster the words "unlimited" all over their front page, do not be fooled!
They cap almost everything to ensure you don't use too many resources. They cap how much CPU you can use, how many processes you use. They limit the emails you can send out to only 50.
They limit the number and size of files you can store on the server. And they will not let you store any files that are not related to your websites (ie. you cannot use Bluehost as online storage)
Their online support is not very good.
However the quickest way to get in contact with Bluehost is through the Live chat feature on their front page. Once connected, they handle basic questions very well, but ask a more complicated question that requires work on their part and suddenly you realize how competent their support staff is. Their email/ticket based support is a joke.
Don't expect to get an answer anytime soon using this method. In conclusion:
Bluehost is great if you have a small scale site that does not require many server resources and you don't require any special configuration on the server. Also, Bluehost is great if you are looking for a cheap hosting solution. Bluehost is not so great if you want good or even mediocre support, or if your site consumes even a fair amount of server CPU/resources.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've been with Bluehost over a year and if you have a website that relies on Mysql never go with them because your actual uptime will be less then 70%! My error logs are filled with Connecting to database, Can't connect to local MySQL server through socket '/var/lib/mysql/mysql.sock' (2). Without it having to do anything with your own database / website.
This happens Every week. Also they have a very strange limit on simultaneous downloads. I have a site with working hotlink protection and +/- 500 unique visitors a day and they Shut down my whole website without notice because according to them 1 file was being download to many times simultaneous.
After asking they couldn't tell me how many it was. Have had contact with support SO many times but error keeps coming back. Would NOT recommend Bluehost for any serious webmaster!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've been using them for going on 10 years and while I certainly don't use all of their features I cannot be happier with them. Their tech support is outstanding. Obviously they spend money on training their people.
They've been able to figure out all the issues I've had. And just recently they helped me configure a new email address for me that reflects my business. Huge step for me.
The hold times vary for support. If it's a busy time of day you might wait longer than you'd like but that's rarely happened for me.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Hold times are FAR too long.  45 to 60 min. I need them unblock my IP. Their security auto-bot thought that all my business activity was malicious again...
this is the 6th time in 2 years I've had to tell them. But my business hurts because of them,  so we are leaving... finally. after several years.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
BlueHost's support is one of the worst ever! I'm using webhosting services for more than 10 years and never had such a bad service in my life :(
Response time is more than 24 hours. Chat is not working most of the time.
Their tutorials are lacking and to cancel the subscription is a nightmare. Be careful!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I would like to tell about bluehost. I am hosting my website on bluehost vps since 1 year and the speed and uptime is very good. One thing that I don't like much is the pricing.
But all other features and everything is awesome. You should try bluehost if you are starting your blog.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
BlueHost is a nice hosting. It have all the best features and its easy to use. Support team is also good and listens to all issues.
It is affordable hosting for the micro niche site. The Uptime is good but the site do not claim that it provides 99.9 percent Uptime. Hope it Helps!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
BlueHost is fast and reliable. I Always get a person who knows what they are doing when I call. Only drawback, lack of assistance in website building.
You're on your own. All they'll tell you is to go to the nightmare site wordpress. I'd rather go to the dentist.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Poor support from sales and tech support regarding an add on service. "Advance Search"  $ 12.99 per month. Tech support could not tell me how the app works, keep sending me to sales, sales send me to billing, billing back to sales then to Solo SEO who does not answer phone. If I don't know how the add on service works or if it is working, then I need to find out

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
It is Very Good for new web sites
I am a overall pleased customer with Bluehost for a few years now. Let me list down the Pros and Cons, I experienced with Bluehost. Pros:
1.
cPanel
2. Adwords credit
3. They have exceeded their guaranteed uptime.
4.
Attractive Freebies
Cons:
1. Occasionally slow if your website grows bigger.
2. Online Support is not the best, I will recommend you to use their emails which has a better response with promptness

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've been with Bluehost for a bit over 7 years, and in the past have recommended them highly. It was easy to set up a site, the features were robust, I never had problems with downtime, and the customer service was friendly and helpful. For the past 5 years I've been running e-commerce on my plan.
The past year though has soured me on them. After having some problems, the support tech convinced me that they would be solved with upgraded service. So that was an extra $360.
Then after having a lot of downtime, a tech convinced me that paying another $90/year for CDN would make sure my site stayed up (this was less than a day before Black Friday, and my site had been down for something like 6 hours.) My site thankfully stayed up during that weekend, but since then I'll lose access at least once a week for a brief period of time, and fairly often for over an hour. Contacting tech support (even at 3am) means a minimum half hour wait, even when their chat says 10 minutes. After vague explanations of "there was a hardware issue" I'm just done.
I don't know what changed, but this isn't the same company I signed up with. The last tech I spoke with didn't even try to get me to stick around. It was just "sorry Your Site is down, try again later."
Just.
So. Done.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
We started off with BlueHost back in 2012. It was a great way to start our web site. Customer service was great, wait times were great, and response times were great.
We rarely had any issue with down time. I was always rating them high. As of today, everything is different.
When I try to Live Chat with an agent, my wait time is typically 30 minutes. After 30 minutes transpires, I have an addition 30 minutes to wait. I've resorted to chatting and calling at the same time.
Phone calls to support are not much better. Instead of 30 minutes, I wait 20-25 minutes for a tech support technician to assist me. Also, when we started using BlueHost, it didn't appear they outsourced.
Now they do, and it's quite the coincidence that since they've outsourced, customer service has only worsened. As for down time, our email goes down at least once each week. Sometimes, it's momentary; other times, it's for a few hours.
We've never been so frustrated before. If I can switch without issue to a better hosting site, I've been given the go-ahead to do so. Bluehost used to be good.
It's not so good anymore. If the transition may be made easily enough, we will switch. Otherwise, we are "stuck."
If you have a very small business with few employees that doesn't require a lot of email exchange, the price is within reasonable range.
However, if your business is more than 10 employees or has a high-volume email exchange, I would not recommend Bluehost. Do yourself a favor and shop around.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've been with Bluehost for 8 years. for the first few years, when i called in, my hold time was only a few minutes. I don't call in that much, maybe a few times a year...but now, hold times are typically an hour.
and now that i have some issues, ive spend 8 hours on hold in just 3 days. Bluehost needs to get their support call hold time down to under 10 minutes again before i would recommend them to anyone

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost is the web hosting company that is after your money. I am not a developer or any admin. I own small business and I had 3-4 static websites.
I initially had these websites on GoDaddy.com, HostGator.com and Misk.com. All of they worked good but to manage them better I decided to move everything on one new and good hosting... After reading good Bluehost reviews, I chose to go with Bluehost.
Within 1 month all of my websites got Malware. I get call from Sitelock saying we have been notified that your websites are infected by Malware so please contact us Asap. I called and they asked me to approx $125 for each domain.
I said no I will look into it. Next day Bluehost deactivated my account saying it is violating terms and conditions. I called Bluehost and asked about deactivation.
The Bluehost showed me the file that lists the file that are infected. I manually went through each file and deleted all extra files that were reported. Within 1 month I again got call from Sitelock saying ssame thing and the whole cycle repeated...
My websites are 12-15 pages static websites. They were live from last 4-5 years and nothing happened. Bluehost say we don't know what is wrong with your websites.
To fix it please contact our partner SiteLock. Because I didn’t want to pay sitelock and developer, I decided to move away from Bluehost and started downloading the files from Bluehost. Their FTP is so pathetic that is disconnects after 40-50% downloading.
Also if you are logged into control panel then you can open your webmail in the same browser as it uses the same link…
To all of the subscribers, please test Bluehost thoroughly before moving all the websites to Bluehost. They are money suckers and don’t have anything good…
Thanks,
Gary Singh

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've always run dedicated servers, so I haven't been on a shared hosting plan in awhile. My developer urged me to move over to Blue Host shared hosting. From day one, nothing but problems.
My website was down more than it was up. The site speed changes from 8 second loads all the way to 46 seconds all day long. I swear every technician has a canned excuse ready to go.
They told me to expect downtime on a shared host. They told me to move to cloud hosting and I'll always have a redundant site in case one server goes down. Total lies!
My website is down just as much if not as often and the second cloud host Never takes over. I've inquired multiple times why the cloud host never picks up when my primary host goes down. canned excuse: It's propagating.
Avoid this host like the plague. I for one, am happily jumping ship. Horrible customer service, long wait times on the phone and chat.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: I have been using bluehost for about 3 years and am less than pleased. It seems like about down almost 25% of the time. I always have trouble logging into my dashboard and email. I would NOT recommend BlueHost to anyone and in fact am in the process of changing to a more reliable hosting server.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
We signed with BlueHost March 2014. From then until now (07 May 2015) their server was down 4 times. The last time was 06 May 2015 for 26 hours and still goes on!
Their service give answers “by copy” whichguessgues is the same to all “poor clionts” og Blue Host. My company is losing lots of money and they don’t care neither offer any kind of compensation. Should you like to have a reliable server, keep BlueHost Blue Host.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
As a businessman, website is a must have one. After switching a lot of hosts, finally joined BlueHost. Everything was easy, in a matter of minutes all of my website is transferred to the new one.
I learned what you pay is what you get, but here in BlueHost you get a lot more than you imagine. The support is better within just 1 hour, I get reply regarding issues. #Rocks

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: used their services for over 5 years, but yesterday without warning, they turned my sites! Just shut down and given 14 days to copy the files. The fact that three of the company, with links from AdWords and other advertising for which I pay each day stopped working, they do not care

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Pretty terrible webhost. They lure you in with promo offers, but they Will raise prices over time. I was a customer for 5 years and finally took the plunge and left.
I am so much happier without them. About 50% of the time you want to log in to cpanel, you'll be greeted by errors. The sites themselves are up, but the cpanel access is spotty at best.
They have lots of flashy features no one really needs and charge more than the competition. Don't believe the hype of "unlimited" web hosting. You don't need it. Find a smaller, cheaper host that actually cares about you as a customer.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Incredibly disappointed in not only the uptime, but the customer service. I was told that when I upgraded to VPS hosting the down time would be minimal if at all. Once I paid for it I was told the down time could be 4-24 hours.
Currently have been on hold for 40 minutes with no real answers... Hoping to get some soon.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Hosting Offline from this morning, this is not 99% uptime! BTW bluehost is cheap, full of services and have a good support.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
First, the good part. The tools BlueHost offers work well and are easy to install and mange even with a little bit of knowledge. They offer a broad range of products with one click installs.
Now the part that isn't so nice. I have had nothing but trouble from the host. I made the mistake of paying for a year, I am seriously considering moving my site now instead of waiting for that year to expire.
I have a very small low traffic site with a single private locked out from the internet forum that  has 100 members who are writers who wish to keep their work they are posting private. No spiders or guests can see this forum. Half the time I watch it spin endlessly as it tries to load.
It's Simple Machines. It's optimized. And part of the time it loads very rapidly.
Then we have the fits and starts which lead to spinning endlessly trying to load. I just tried to return a PM to someone. Five minutes later, I am Still trying to return a PM.
I just checked on my Tablet, the site which is optimized for tablets isn't loading. If this was unusual, I wouldn't be upset. The server I am sharing crashed.
I'm not surprised. I told them repeatedly there was something wrong. It took them two days to fix it, then it crashed the very next day.
The answer I got was "Well, we didn't get it fixed". I know these things happen but it also crashed 3 days later after I tried to tell them it was about to go down again. My members were all getting server errors.
What was I told?  "It's your computer. You need to optimize Your Site blah blah blah."  If it was any more optimized it would be grease on a ladder. It's not me.
I've listened to 100 members screaming bloody murder because of problems. When I explained to Customer Service what is going on, they told me it was my computer. Really?
How do you explain the other 99 spread out from the Philippines, Australia, Germany, England, Canada, South America, Greece to name a few. They don't fly over ever day to use my computer to post. Not only do we play the "Will it load today or what?" game, we also get to play the "Is it even up?" game.
I'm tired.  4 months of this crap and I am tired. I'm not paying them another dime. I don't care about wonderful improvements.
I want the basics fixed so the site simply works. If I can't get to my site and if the members can't get on, BlueHost is useless. I am angry. I am furious at the way Customer Service has acted when it is their server that is causing the problem because 100 people all do not own the same settings.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
So a back in April 2013, my website was becoming to big to be on shared hosting so I decided to buy a dedicated server with bluehost. At the time bluehost looked great, and I bought their mid range server at $199/month, this price was great for me. Before August bluehost was good for me, however one thing that did bug me was their support for dedicated servers, they don’t have live chat support so you have to call up.
This may be OK if your in the USA, but I’m in the UK so it means I have to call their international support number first, then I have to be transferred to their dedicated server support team. This means I have experienced waits of up to 30 minutes to get some support. But to be fair the support I have received is good, it’s just accessing it that can be hard.
But on Friday august 2nd it all went horrible! I mean horrible! On august 1st I had launched my next large website, and within 24 hours it had gained over 3000 members and got over 50,000 visits, I expected this launch to get even bigger on August 2nd and I expected my new site to grow even more at a faster rate.
But… It didn’t. Why? Bluehost suffered a massive outage causing all my websites to go down.
My sites were up and down for well over 36 hours, disrupting over 150,000 people that tried to access my sites. It completely screwed over the launch of my new website and it screwed my established websites. After 24 hours of repetitive tweets on twitter from bluehost saying “it will be resolved soon” I thought enough was enough and I decided to look for a new dedicated server company.
It is now august 4th and I have a new server with liquid web and they specialize in dedicated servers so their support is amazing and I have already had my sites migrated from bluehost by their migration team. But also today a new problem has emerged. Due to my websites being down I have lost my google rankings and dropped from being #1 to past the second page!
My daily revenue has also decreased by over 50%! Meaning bluehost has totally caused my business to go down hill. Now I’m on a new server I hope I will regain my rankings and revenue, but for now I am very annoyed with bluehost. I’m at least glad that liquid web has a 100% up time guarantee.

The other two times I happened to catch. Their chat support is horrendous. Submit a question and wait 5 for them to answer.
Their phone support is a tad better - if you can get to someone who knows what they are talking about. 50/50 shot there. Anyway - I'm in the market for a new solution that is solid. I host about 13 (now 11) web sites as part of a managed services agreement.
Any advice of something with stellar uptime and support would be appreciated. Either way - I'm off of BlueHost within 10 days (I had been a client for over 5 years). I just cannot stake my business on their deteriorating support and uptime any longer.

I've been a BlueHost customer for approximately ten years. I'm not doing anything particularly demanding or complicated with my websites - just branding - but I use a lot of email; and to begin with BlueHost was great for me. The prices were reasonable, and the support - by ticket and occasionally phone - was excellent.
As the years have gone by, things have deteriorated. The services they have added have little relevance for me, and the support is, for all practical purposes - at least if you value your time, nonexistent. And they make changes with little or notice.
Also - and I know for a lot of users this would be  minor - they have made it impossible to arrange email rows in a way that makes sense for my use. Having the subject of the email in the first row makes no sense for someone like me who gets a lot of email because what matters is WHO is sending the email. Since they've discontinued ticket support, I have no way to address this apart from spending a large chunk of working time, which I'm not going to do since, going by other experiences, it's unlikely their response will be helpful.
Also, the prices have really ratcheted up. In fact, the inability to access ticket support and the rather breathtaking price jumps for established customers are making me start to explore other options.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Important Features of BlueHost:
•    Domains
The domain managers at BlueHost ensure the tracking, updating, transfer, purchase and administer all your domains in one place. It also offers a free.com domain which immensely helps make life easier for customers. There are certain accounts that support unlimited add-ons and parked domains, subdomains as well as domestic and sub-domestic domains.
When you trust BlueHost, you don’t need to face any problems related to your domain.  
•    Emails
It also enables you to create and manage multiple email accounts which also have certain advanced features. These features involve account filters and forwarding rules. In addition to this, it also helps in securing POP3 and Imap which help in supporting third-party clients’ compatibility.
They also allow spam protection and unique user control which secure your privacy and you become less prone to viruses, malware or hacks. 
•    Backups
The host offers automatic backups at regular daily, weekly or monthly intervals. This enables you to restore all your data just by making a few clicks. You can also backup your important files and specific folders by selecting those files. 
•    Resource Protection
The system identifies that your website needs additional resources so it reassigns them to isolated systems. This helps increase your website’s performance and also cancels the effect of risks associated with shared servers.  
•    Scalability
BlueHost realizes that you need to move on to more powerful options so it helps make upgrading to higher levels easily. 
•    Unlimited Support
Their management team offers unlimited support for your website available 24 hours a day and seven days a week which means you are never going to feel unattended.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Of the many hosting providers I use or have used in the past, BlueHost is at the bottom of my ranking. I had a website that ran Joomla 1.5. It was patched to the latest release of Joomla but there was a vulnerability and my site was compromised.
I detected the issue about the time that BlueHost detected it. I had already patched the site when BlueHost disabled my web site. Shortly thereafter, they sent an email stating that they had disabled my website and I had three days to backup and remove my site.
I tried to speak with them to explain what had happened, that it was a known general vulnerability in Joomla 1.5 that had been patched by Joomla, but they would not even entertain the discussion and kept repeating, "You have three days and your access will be blocked". I understand that hosting companies much be very careful about monitoring exploits especially on shared hosting plans. But I also think that they need to spend a bit of time to listen to the customer and make a realistic assessment whether the customer is doing something nefarious or was the victim of an exploit and is taking immediate steps to correct.
I found BlueHost to be very intolerant and unwilling to work through the issue. I am very happy with my new hosting provider. I've had a exploit issue with them but we worked together and solved it right away.
That's the kind of partnership I appreciate and is (or at least was) a level of service that BlueHost was unwilling to provide. BlueHost was obstinate, unhelpful and discourteous in my experience. I highly discourage anyone from using them.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo

I have been a BlueHost customer since 2007 but I will no longer host any Website with BlueHost. Customer Service is not; the company does not help customers. BlueHost no longer permits customers from submitting a trouble ticket; you are required to call (average wait time: +35 minutes) or use online chat (average wait time: +65 minutes).
Do you need to provide level 1 tech support with the text of a really long error message? Good luck. Worse, BlueHost has implemented an Nginx/reverse proxy to breaks the Joomla, WordPress, and Drupal CMSs because Nginx does not permit GET and Post calls to "static" content - these calls are commonly, routinely used by the CMS.
Cannot check for dead links - you receive a 502 - Bad Gateway error. Try to run Akeeba Backup - you get a cascading series of 405 - Forbidden Nginx 1.10.1 errors. Those cheap prices quoted here?
The Only "solution" provided by BlueHost customer "service" is for you, the customer, to upgrade your hosting service to VPS at a cost of $518.20. That's not service, it's "upselling."

Let's talk about shared hosting of Bluehost. Bluehost does not offer month-to-month shared hosting plan. Instead, this requires you to register for a yearly plan.
If you enroll in a two-year or three-year system, you get discounts. If you commit to staying put for three years, the service's $3.95 per month rate is attractive. Bluehost's hosting packages come with a 30-days money back guarantee, free domain.
