reviews.review_text:
So far, everything is going perfectly, and the truth, I have not had the need to get in touch with them because of bad service, or because of a fall of some of my websites. Once, I saw the need to get in touch with them, but it was because I had forgotten the access data, and I can say the service was the best; good attention and speed in it. Currently I have the hosting service $ 10, and best of all, is that I can host unlimited domains and websites do not fall in heavy traffic.
Until today and according to my experience, it is the best hosting I've hired, and I do not regret having done so. If you're looking for a good hosting that supports thousands of hits and good customer service, no doubt,

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Hello comrades have just 2 websites. I chose them because their advertising convinced me, support responds quickly to so far all goes well, the price is affordable and is a company with very good reputation and I feel safe with them. I too do very well with them.
I've been hosting for several years and always without problems. Recommended

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Let me just start out by saying that this company has the best support of any company I’ve ever had to call a support line for in my entire life. I one time was fiddling with files in an FTP client for my blog, and I clicked the wrong something and brought the whole site down. (I’m not particularly technical and what I was doing was over my head) I called BlueHost, and the gentleman on the other end was able to figure out what I did wrong and explain to me how to do it properly in the future. I never wait for more than a couple minutes when I have had to call them, and they have all sorts of guides and videos to help along the way in their help center.
Long story short on the support team over at Bluehost is I hope you mess something up and have to call them like I did. Bet you anything you’ll be recommending them after that. But be careful with some of the upsells they offer you are complete garbage.
For instance, the SEO package is absolutely useless. You should want to learn SEO because it is extremely valuable. Any paid SEO service through a hosting provider is a waste of money, though.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
It's been almost one year since I've been staying with Bluehost. Overall it's a great host, and here is a bit of personal thoughts:)
Pro:
- Cost effective, cheap pricing with flexible plans(Standard performance is good enough already)
- Unlimited bandwidth, though it's still long way to go for my small site to get decent traffic, it's surely a great plus.
- Pro&friendly staff
Cons:
- For the cheapest option, I would still suggest they could change to unlimited space
- Email storage a bit small, though it's good for my current site. I would need to upgrade later on.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Well, I'm sort of a picky person while being a customer:), but bluehost never let me know for the past two years. I have a blog style site with decent traffic, but even on a shared hosting plan, I could not feel obviously slowness, most page redirects complete within around 1-1.5 sec, though there is a bit of down time.(Mostly from their maintenance, upgrade...etc.)
The free site builder is easy to use, and I can get live support from 24/7, which is pretty impressive, as I know it's hard to cover the support from different areas due to big time zone. I've chatted with their staff a few times, my issues are usually resolved at professional manner.
These guys know what they are doing! There is also one thing which I suggest, that I wish they could provide more dedicated ips for shared plans, and probably restrict number of hosts for the same server. Generally, it's good host from personal point of perspective.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I am using bluehost since the day I started my digital journey. I've been blogging from past 5+ years and till now my experience with bluehost is quite good. I never looked for too much support, but yeah I prefer the uptime and security on everything.
I just need these two things to be perfect and rest I can manage. And that's what bluehost provides. Although it is not the cheapest host but it provides perfect low introductory packages for starters.
Keeping in mind the popularity, I would say it is not expensive. It fits in every category. whether you're some starter or advanced user, bluehost has got you covered.
The security system is quite awesome in bluehost. The tools it offers are famous for combating the security threats. You can prevent the spam with ease by using the spamassassin tool.
It supports cloudfare that helps to defend the Ddos attacks. Plus the hotlink protection prevents content stealing and also allows you to block IPs & secure web sessions. The integration of apps makes it more user friendly.
And on top of all these features, it provides 99% proven uptime. I am not saying this with my mind, I've personally tested it. The majority of hosts there claims to give 99% uptime but most of them failed to provide even 70%.
But bluehost server time is the best thing about it. It makes bluehost stands out. I personally like it the most.
Every thing has pros and cons. Some of the cons of bluehost includes the slow speeds(very rare), like others it is also not truly unlimited, expensive starter guide and the bad customer support. If we sum up the pros and cons then I would say that nobody is perfect.
So in finding the perfect, you'll lose your main point of digital journey. If talking about my personal views about bluehost, I would recommend it. Give it a shot and you'll not regret it.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been using BlueHost for a year know and can tell you that their service is the highest quality. I never had a single issue with speed and load time with my websites using BlueHost servers. The costumer service is very quick to answer any questions or problems you might have.
They can even
access your cpanel and assist you in any trouble might occur. I will recommend them to anyone who is looking for a reliable hosting service.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've been with Bluehost since they have Only shared hosting package, five years over but I still host with them, very good up time and excellent support. I use up time tracking from third party service to track my up time of my website but only 5 minutes downtime last year 2015. This is accept able 
Few months ago the traffic increase too much because I advertise my site on Reddit and site is slow down to access but Bluehost helped me optimizing the site and everything is fine.
With their Wordpress package I have Sitelock pro for free keeps my Wordpress site secure from spammers and script kiddies, also got an dedicated IP too. I height recommend everybody use Bluehost and I will continue host at Bluehost for sure. Note: I have an other site hosted at GoDaddy and I want tell you Bluehost is far better than GoDaddy, the renewal price at GoDaddy also expensive. Wish you success!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I had been a customer of Bluehost for many years. Not any longer. Yesterday I received an email from Bluehost stating they were migrating us to a new server.
Ok, sounds good, right?.  15 minutes later our entire email system is down. Unable to get through to their technical support. Not good for business.
Today I waiting for 40 minutes on their "On-line Chat"  While waiting I went into our bluehost panel - I am not an IT specialist. Luckily I was able to determine that the changeover included new incoming and outgoing server information. I was able to update the email accounts on my computer - without any help from tech support.
The Tech support was working with so many clients I had to wait 5 minutes +  for a response. So I call the tech support number. I am told that I should know that when they switch servers email setting need to be changed.
What? I'm not in IT and everything was working wonderfully until they decided to migrate during a work day. I am shocked!
I have never experienced such poor service. Everything was working well Until they decided to migrate to a different server. No emails letting customers know in advance, no helpful advice provided .
And apparently Bluehost has no superiors only tech support as the tech support person "Corey" hung up on me stating that he could put me through as they did not have a management department. Well that is certainly an interesting business model. All of our client folders are now missing, I am unable to delete any emails as a pop up states they're already deleted.
I have to go around to every computer station to update the incoming/outgoing servers. No apologies, no help, and what company updates during a work day! I don't rant but this is mind boggling. Anyone who can recommend a company that believes in customer service please advise.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
We've been using Bluehost since 2008 for our company website and it's been pretty much flawless and easy to use up until they made recent changes here in 2016. We are a Bluehost Pro customer. Bluehost now has issues that are effecting our business.
Please note that we've changed nothing on our end...
1. It's suddenly become very difficult to get logged in... takes several very slow attempts with error messages.
2.
All of our password protected directories had to be removed from our site because the password protection is suddenly gone even though the directory settings reflect the protection.
3. As of today, March 11, 2016... we cannot connect with support there!  1 minute posted wait time on chat goes for more than 30 minutes without response (now 5 days in a row).
4.
I can't imagine how frustrating this would be for someone who hosts multiple domains via Bluehost. Whatever changes Bluehost has made to modernize their services, need to be fixed or we will have no choice but to find another provider.  : (

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
This is the Wrost hosting company we have ever come across. They are seriously Down all the time and they just don't care. When you call them for support, hold time is between 30 mins to 1 hour!
This is just insane, and most of the time when you do finally get someone on the phone, they can't help you and all they will say is they are down and they have no guaranteed estimated time of when they will be back up. Anyone, I promise you, you will do yourself a favor by NOT signing up with Bluehost and go to another hosting company - ANY other company will have a better record than them. They are just down too often and have the worst support and they just don't care that their downtime affects their customers' business in a big way.
We will be cancelling our service with them. It has just cost us too much lost business and the frustration in dealing with them is also not worth it.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
This is my first experience with Bluehost and I'm very very disappointed. Recently none of my sites were accessible for the whole day a few times. I checked other people's sites on the same server with me and they were also not accessible.
Customer service is non-existent. If you open live chat, it says waiting time is 30 minutes and it stays just like that. And if you open a support ticket, you are very lucky if they reply you back.
My support section is full of unanswered tickets. And now I'm also getting a ERR_Empty_Response error for my Wordpress site. But I'm not opening a ticket, because I know they will not bother to reply back. Stay away from this company...

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I transferred over to Bluehost and I've had nothing but problems. When I call,  there are incredibly long hold times,  tech support diagnosis is rarely accurate the first time. Very frustrating service!
Sorry I spend the time and money to move over. There have been endless problems from the beginning.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I do not recommend BlueHost at all. We have been a customer of BlueHost since 2012 and only in the past few months we have had issues with them. The first issue took 15 separate calls in Sep and Oct 2015, countless repeated information for our website to be reactivated.
The lack of urgency from BH was appalling nor did they exhibit any empathy whatsoever. During one call I was transferred to 5 different people and had to relay the same information over and over again and even then the website was not reactivated after this call. All we needed at this time was how to submit a chargeback to BH.
Eventhough the website was up and running our company emails were not and still not. The second issue we had was getting a new email address associated with our BH account. This was definitely not an easy task as they require government issued ID, bank statement from when you made the original purchase with BH, photo of the credit card used.
The third problem was that BH's credit card company charged us twice for this year. When I asked the helpdesk via live chat if they could ask the credit card company to refund it, the agent suggested to speak to their credit card company and said that they have "reported the repayment and that this dispute was resolved." When I asked if they could provide their credit card company details so I can speak to them and get this sorted, I was told:" I don't know. I don't work for the credit card company." Astute observation.
Subsequently, I requested the agent to ask his team members for the information he replied: "It is not our requirement to provide contact info to a customer's credit card company." If you suggest I speak to your credit card company should you not provide their contact details to me? He did give one very helpful tip which was that the team who usually correspond with the credit card company are not in today and they are back in the office on Monday. Do yourself a favour and look for another hosting company if you are considering BlueHost.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Absolute worst uptime. I have been a customer with bluehost for almost 5 years, with three different hosting packages. Recently, within a year (2014-2015), after they started marketing a lot and adding in lots of packages, their server uptime is horrible.
I don't know whether they do it on purpose or not, whenever I ask, they say their admins are working on it and the site returns within an hour or two. Then, after a lot of these incidents, I ask them to change my hosted machine to something else since there has been lots of issues, they're like I need to upgrade the package to Pro package which is tripe the price I pay for a basic static page site. I don't think I need to change my plan to get what I was promised for, if you can't fix it then you shouldn't even sell that package in the first place.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I'm so incredibly disappointed in your customer service. I've wasted Three hours of my day and your company was still NOT able to assist me!!! You've taken money from my family, yet you can't give me any information.
I've sent you Twice my info to verify my identity, you validated you received and then tell me I have to wait Another four hours for you to Email me. It's unacceptable. Your "small business tip" on Facebook 2 days ago is to "welcome feedback from your customers.
Listen and adapt", yet you have all comments and ratings disabled on Facebook AND Google+. Aren't you talking out of both ends of your mouth? Just when I was about to have you host 2 more domains for me. I'm so disappointed in you, Bluehost!!!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I am the user of bluehost since last 1.5 years. I have been referred to their service by one of my friend telling me that their customer support and their uptime is great. At first, when I signed up, I saw the uptime is really good and the service they are providing is worth the money that you pay.
I started enhancing the website and tried to expand my website traffic through reddit and other traffic mediums. As soon as my traffic started increasing, I have noticed that uptime is decreasing slightly. I have contacted their customer support and I have to admit that their customer support is really fast from the day one until now.
They told me that increasing traffic is causing trouble on the bandwidth usage. The CPU usage of the shared hosting is also out of my understanding as it increases without any special plugin running on my wordpress installation. I tried to ask their customer support many times about it but every time I haven't been satisfied.
Their customer support is fast to respond but lack professionalism in satisfying what client needs or what problem client has. All in all, I would not greatly recommend bluehost but if your traffic is low, you can think of using them

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Ok You totally Rock because:
1) I am never on hold for very long (usually less than 1 minute)
2) I get a person who speaks clear English!!
3) Reps are Incredibly patient and stay with me on phone until problem is fixed
4) Related issue: They never seem to be in a hurry to "turn calls" or worry about some call quota.
5) All reps I have ever dealt with are very down to earth (never making me feel like the idiot I know that I am) or use technical language/bullshit.
6) They are willing to fix problems that Bluehost didn't create (like when I upgrade my Apple IOS, all my settings get reconfigured and I can never figure out how to get them back to where they should be).
7) I will definitely be a Life time Bluehost customer (I have Never "price shopped" or looked at other providers)

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Since joining last year I've had all my sites go down twice for about a 24 hour period. Currently I'm having issues with Database connection errors on multiple sites that they cannot explain. The errors come and go randomly. It's a decent service, but definitely does not get high ratings from me.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I just had my first experience with BlueHost tech support (with Jason) and all I can say is that I am blown away by the quality of the service I received. First, since I had purchased Blue Host services back in November, I needed to update my password and he talked me through that. Then I discovered that I needed to change the nameservers at GoDaddy where I had registered my URL to the Blue Host nameserver info.
Together we tried to find out how to do that in my GoDaddy account. Although the GoDaddy system was confusing on that, he gave me their phone number and told me what info I would have to fill in to make the change. Throughout our time together, Jason was very thorough, patient and helpful.
If you read the review I just did on Go Daddy, you will see that the guy from that tech support was rude and condescending. I AM So glad I Picked bluehost instead of Go Daddy for my web hosting. Thank you Jason from BlueHost - I look forward to future positive tech support from the company you so ably represent.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost - I have paid them for 3 years. After 40 days of my account, they deactivated it and said few of files have Malware attack. Then i cleaned up everything, support team has checked and they have reactivated account.
After a week or two, my account was again deactivated. Reason - all people who had Malware attack earlier. they have to pay $3.99 per month extra to bluehost and get a dedicated IP compulsory. Totally Wastage of Time.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
After being a customer of Bluehost for more than 5 years they actually told me today I would be better to go to a new company. They said "They are degrading their reseller program" The site performance has been really bad over the last few months. My complaints have fallen on deaf ears.
The best solution they told me was to rent one of their Vps's. Yesterday when I paged them about the simplescripts (Mojo) installer no longer working they told me they would inform me when and "if" it was to be fixed. This is when they told me they are degrading their reseller program.
Actually recomended I change to a new company because they know their service is so poor! To me to leave because they have a poor service! This from one of their techs! Do not use bluehost they are not A Honorable company

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
We have used bluehost for three years. Service interruptions have been common. Typical hold time for tech support is 15 minutes.
Once waited 45 minutes and gave up. Hold time for sales number is three seconds. Currently on hold trying to resolve yet another service interruption. They are costing us serious $.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost is one of the best host provider ever seen. I believe it's really very cheap and their support is really awesome. I think you all can choose this wonderful Bluehost services.
And I believe Bluehost always rocks for me. Bluehost provides the best support and their services are awesome. They will help you at anytime when you will need them. So, If you plan something very good, cool and awesome then you can refer to bluehost.com

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: BlueHost is awesome! I have been using them for 2 years and they always assisted with my concerns and were very helpful. I would recommend them to anyone looking to host a website especially, a Wordpress site.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I tried BlueHost as a result of other reviews on the Internet. I made a few pre-sales chat inquiries which were responded to within a minute. Excellent I thought.
I decided to dip my toes in the water and signed up for the mid level hosting package. Unfortunately, it was downhill from then on. I'm familiar with cPanel and thought I'd be able to jump right in, setting up WordPress with a new template etc.
but I wasn't getting the responses I had expected. To cut a long story short and after a couple of attempted Support chats and tickets, it turned out that the server supposed to be hosting my new site was down. Not a good first impression!
What bothered me was not just that the servers were down and stayed down for 24 plus hours (down even at the time of writing this review!) but also the service level of the tech support. Not only is the chat wait far longer than pre-sales but the staff are obviously so overwhelmed that you can get bumped off the chat session for no reason, simply to bolster their 'completed' sessions I suppose. One ticket response I had said "The server is down.
We have no ETA". Hmmm. I was a new customer, why not allocate another server?
I tried a number of different avenues to resolve the issues but there was a stonewall in each case. The feeling quickly grew that I couldn't trust BlueHost with my customers and decided to cancel the plan and the extras I had ordered through them. That was the easiest part!
If BlueHost could deliver on what they promise they would offer great value. However, from my experience, they obviously cannot.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
BlueHost sucks:
Due to the bad support my WP site never went live- I cancelled my service and they refunded the prorated charges minus 11.99 - the free domain they talk about is a catch : if you cancel your service prior to the end of the year, you will be charged for 11.99//// sure the domain is yours till end of contract but that is nothing close to the meaning of free domain. If I knew- I could have used my own existed domain name rather than using a new one. Interesting part is that before I purchase the service I did ask about all the fees that may be involved in canceling and everyone assured me that I lose the cost of hosting on the months I used it- and that's all.
When I complaint about the 11.99, they said it is written in the terms and condition I agreed on. That is correct::: there is nothing I can do about it. So be careful : don't trust BlueHost support when they tell you something.
read all of those 2000 pages of terms and conditions. As for support: every time I was getting live help, it took them a while to figure out what the problem is...but once they were ready to do something. I was receiving this: "sorry, I have to take the mandatory break now- next person will continue taking care of your problem....the next person had no idea about the issue and I had to start all over explaining....result was many hours explaining and no result.
Like a dead loop. Again: blue host sucks. I lost money- time- and really frustrated with their process. I am sure many many places are doing a much better job than bluehost.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: I am really sick of the uptime of my website. So I decided to use BlueHost, recommended by my friend. Switched to BlueHost, using it for 3 years without any problems. My website runs smoothly without any hassle.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Bluehost is awesome, They always have my websites up and running 24/7. Their support is also super quick at responding to our emails.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost has been my sole provider for more than 5 years. I have hosted mostly Joomla site and about two years ago added Wordpress sites. They have been really good with fielding most of my my support issues.
However, I have been experiencing a decline in technical support and customer service. This company is very disappointing and I would honestly try someone else before coming aboard. Look elsewhere, you get exactly what you pay for - cheap service and unprofessional, incompetent support.
To date I paid for an extra service for WP Optimization. The service is $50. They gladly took the money.
Sent me an email asking for login credentials and told me to sit back and wait for them to complete their job. The site screamed for about 36 hours before I started experiencing degrading performance. Then in 48 hours the site was back to its normal speed and 56 hours later is was slower than it was before optimization.
I called them and was told to email optimization department for assistance. I have for 10 days been waiting to hear back from them on a resolution to the performance issues. I have emailed them for the last three days each day asking for a reply or something.
I have received nothing from them. Did I mention they also broke my theme template during the process of optimization? Not only have a called tech support and been jerked around.
I have thoroughly resented being with this company as a result of declining and degrading customer service. Not to mention apps in their backend processes have automatically upgraded my sites and have broken them. I have lost respect and faith in this company.
I want to switch to another hosting company but I am going to be a lot more careful before I move. I don't want another Bluehost by a different name in my life. This is miserable to say the least.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I also had a bad experience with Bluehost. All over the net you will read that bluehost overloads their servers. That is why they offer cheap hosting.
My websites were down everyday. When I called them bluehost told me that they "throttle" my websites because it was using too many resources. However my websites only get 2000 visitors a month. I canceled with bluehost.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been using BlueHost for a year now and I am very happy with them. I think that their chat support is very good and they always help with answering any questions or concerns that I have. They offer really good features, uptime, and value for their price.
One of the main reasons I went with BlueHost was because of their many positive reviews. Another reason I went with BlueHost was because they were really kind and helpful with helping me set up my blog on Wordpress. I have been very happy with BlueHost and I intend to keep using BlueHost for the rest of my life.
I do not think that I would ever change my web host from BlueHost. Thanks BlueHost!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
It's been 13 months that we've been with BH, I can now say that technical customer service on individual issues is expedient and friendly, the price speaks for itself and the most important aspect, reliability (up time) is poor. We are on a virtual private server and have had 4 major (over 24 hrs) outages in 12 months. Not just our VPS, but they're system (even phones go down).
Once our site and back office are back up we will move. Our lost revenue and reputation is not worth their low monthly service fee. We got what we paid for.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Now here is A Company who knows its Business! (and value its customers!!!)
I've been working with Bluehost for very few years now. This hosting company should be a model for all others - they are well worth my time writing. Starting from their super kind and patience US based customer support, moving on to their 100% up time, knowledge, documented help, tons of features, including all essential backups, autoinstallers, etc.
Don't just take my word - give them a testdrive - put one of your domains on their servers and go crazy - in no time you'll blame yourselves for wasting your time and frustrations with all other hosts! Disclaimer - I'm not associated nor paid by BlueHost - I'm their customer and a very happy camper!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
In my honest opinion Blue Host is extremely good. I mainly like them because they're servers are faster than usual and they're downtime is very little. Like really, most sites have a lot of downtime due to multiple errors, but not Blue Host.
I also like them due to the fast support and overall quality of the site. Overall I would have to recommend Blue Host to anyone that likes quality and speed, Blue Host is by far one of the best hosting and server site I've came across, and definitely the fastest. So if you're having issues with your current host, I'd say you should go with Blue Host instead.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've been hosting with BlueHost for the last 5 years. I can't say enough about their customer service. Always timely and accurate.
This is, by far, the best hosting service I have used, and I'll continue to use them. Most recently, I've worked closely with their Spoke program coordinator to get my school accounts set up. Grant was extremely professional, patient, and informative.
They provide a fantastic service at very reasonable prices. I'm sold!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Having been with Bluehost for 5 years (2 pleasant years and 3 years of pain and suffering), I finally decided to pull the plug and cut my losses. And here is why:
1- Servers are down every couple of weeks for no reason. Support team gives no explanation.
Their response consistently in the past 3 years has been: "This is it. For this money, this is what you get. You don't like it?
Leave"
2- Their service is NOT unlimited. They have limits on everything: filesize, number of files you can store on server, number of Mysql databases, number of tables in each database, total number of tables. Everything is limited, and the worst part is that they are limited to make things impossible to work for you. 
3- The websites load extremely slow.
It takes 10 seconds to load a simple, well-optimized website. Their servers are overloaded and they just don't care.
4- Most of their servers are blacklisted or marked as spam. So your website is basically in a hole.
You can't send emails to people because it'll be rejected. We asked to be moved to another server twice, but results were the same. Stay away from these guys (and any company associated with Endurance International (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Endurance_International_Group). They are too big to care for you, and will happily rip you off and tell you to leave if you don't like it.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
We have been using their service for almost ten years! Their service is getting worse and worst. On last Sunday, they suspended our account without prior warning and sent to us an email that our account was suspended due to too many files.
Jesus! Our website is for business, not for personal use. They sent us email on Sunday, we can only read it when we come back to office on Monday.
We took immediate action on Monday and reduced the number of files and request for resuming our account but no response! They only replied to us 24 hours later saying that we also have problem in number of mySQL tables and therefore they cannot resume our account! God!
Why didn't they tell us two days ago that we also had such issue!!! We have reduced the number of mySQL tables and request for account reactivation. Again, no immediate response so far and our account has been down for almost 50 hours………………. please sign up with them if this is the service level that you are happy with………………..we will move out definitely…………….

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I had switched to BlueHost in 2011 from GoDaddy. My reason for moving was two-fold; GoDaddy was sluggish and not so WordPress friendly at the time and two, WordPress.org recommended them as the premier WordPress Hosting company. Summer of 2013 they started to slow down and then late summer/early fall they began to go down on a regular basis, HostGator as well.
As of this review, we are still experiencing issues with them and the immediate future does not look good. The support staff has been good in fielding questions, but the fact remains they keep going down, all the feel-good tweeting will not change the fact that my business is offline. I am now looking to move again, a task I dread as I have many sites at BH.
The lost revenue I have experienced in the past 4 months has left me with no other choice. Before switching to BlueHost, do some research on the current status. Perhaps one day, if they can correct their network issues, I may go back because I really did have a great experience up until these past 6 months or so.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Blueshost is in my experience a decent low cost solution. There are significant problems in upload speed and downstream speed things are not famous for the most basic plans. Bluehost in my experience at least in the most basic plans is only suitable for small hosting jobs like personal pages or pages with low bandwidth requirements.
Support wise it is average. Not the fastest and most dedicated support but acceptable. Feature wise its as good as any other player player on the market.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been a long time Bluehost customer. I'm running about 10 web sites, one of it is a web shop. Bluehost offers a lot of features, and the servers are running fast enough for my purposes.
The big problem is sending email. Since a few months, about 10% of my sent emails are either bounced (because the bluehost mail server is on a blacklist) or refused by the bluehost MTA (because of a 200 mail-per-hour limit). Of course I'm never sending more than 10 emails per day.
Support answers quickly, but isn't really helpful. The Bluehost mail services have become practically unusable for me. I can't recommend it for hosting a serious/critical web site.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Moved a high traffic website over to BlueHost, was told everything was setup and ready and was provided with the name servers to use for sites hosted. Everything worked fine for about a day, and then DNS errors. We lost several thousand visitors in one day.
Contacted BlueHost three times for support. Was told on the third time it was a problem caused by them and they had fixed it and DNS errors would resolve in about 4 hours. 8 hours later the domain was resolving but various DNS tools were still reporting several errors. This problem at BlueHost stopped the viral momentum of one of our pages costing thousands of future visitors. Never using BlueHost again.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I signed up with BlueHost in February 2013 because they were the recommended hosting solution for WordPress. I left GoDaddy because of the poor support and very poor uptime and slow speeds. BlueHost was great the first couple of months, but as summer came around I started to notice all of my sites getting slower, email was not so great and I was starting to get site timeouts.
I am a web designer/developer and had recommended bluehost to many of my clients. Well that was mistake, August 2nd and then again on August 9th of 2013, BlueHost went down - no website, no email, nothing. I lost money, my customers lost money and everyone is frustrated.
The downtime was a good 8 to 12 hours. The tech guys were great at responding but the answers were always the same canned responses. BlueHost was acquired by Endurance International Group in 2011.
BlueHost offers cheap hosting but you get what you pay for, EIG is notorious for overselling and packing their servers with users. The results are very slow sites and now major outages. HostGator and HostMonster also suffered the same fate; both are owned by EIG as well.
If your revenue generation is reliant upon your website(s) being up, take a look at hosting that is not on a shared network like RackSpace, Intermedia, and Site5. It will cost more but you won't suffer the same fate as the EIG customers do now. I would recommend BlueHost to those who want to host a personal site and do not care about speed and uptime, but it is not for the business user, small or large.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: I found very very long technical support Chat wait times minimum 15 and upto 60 mins every time I tried to have an issue. And their support phone service is not working either as I called from outside US, both numbers got disconnected after I reached them for a few mins.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I wish that a hosting provider run all time with no error database problem. bluehost support staff is quite good might they'll take more time than usual sometimes but provides accurate support as needs. they all (staff memb.) have to know what a random user wants and love.
bluehost is the name as self ..... simple clean and sharp. bluehost suits for every kinda of publishers.
but as an blogger i would to say that it as a technology bloggers. ya defiantly i'll recommend bluehost to my relatives which looking for a well hosting provider.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost is the most helpful hosting company I have ever had. The customer service wait time is minimal, and they are able to promptly and Expertly help with any issues I have. Most recently, a custom plugin was accidentally updated on our site, despite the designer's warnings that if the plugin is updated, it will "break the site".
One of our employees very innocently updated the plugins...which broke the whole site. I contacted the designer twice by phone and 4 times by email, with no response in 3 days. I called Bluehost and they fixed the problem in less than 10 minutes. This is not the only instance of them going above and beyond to help us with issues- issues that are not even their responsibility necessarily.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Certainly the best hosting company according to me. I have'nt worked with many hosting companies but in early stage i used to change my hosting from one company to another until i found this one. Their uptime amazes me.
Most of the hosting companies used to block the domains for 24 hrs for over usage., But Bluehost does'nt. Their customer support is also very good. Certainly the Hosting company of the era.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Well just easy to say, to avoid. Avoid. I wanted to change hosting company just because price was cheaper so I payed a hosting plan with bluehost.
It was weekend and office was closed, and the phone number I gave was the office one, since it was my company's host. So they deactivated my account, and told me to call from the office number and say the last 4 digits in the CC used to pay. And so I tried for 3 days, and I always listened that they could not access my domain and account and to call 30 minutes later.
Now my previous hosting expired and I have no host, so I tried to contact them to cancel my account since they have a refund account anytime, and now phone is not enough, I am forced to send a copy of CC and valid ID for a company. And so I payed my previous host company InMotion Hosting wich were as always great and still no refund from Bluehost.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I highly recommend BlueHost for personal and business enterprises either you are a computer guru or not, you can work with BlueHost. I am an IT Specialist for more than 7 years. Applying scripts are at ease with no problem but in fact as far as minor issues is concerned, it will not screw up your mindset, perfectly recommended!
Several features why I like Bluehost includes: Good hosting, control panel, 24/7 active on-line support, website builder, e-mail, and the security features. The professionalism of their support staffs are great! They were able to solved minor and major issues in a well-versed manner.
Highly recommended! Keep up the good work! God bless! Nash deligero
it Speciaist
Countrywide Consumers Cooperative

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: So far I have had Zero problems with BlueHost The e-mail works great unlike godaddy, and the Cpanel is easy to use with tons of features. The value is great one price gets you unlimited everything.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Late last year I moved all my webhosting from Godaddy to Bluehost mostly because I was disappointed in the speed of my Wordpress sites at Godaddy. In general, I have been very, very happy with my decision despite the work involved in migrating everything over. At a client's request I recently had to move a site I developed on Bluehost to Godaddy for hosting.
The interaction with the technical support team at Godaddy only served to confirm my brilliant decision to move to you. Their customer service gave me both wrong information with a demeaning attitude. They eventually told me that they could not help me because they do not support Wordpress issues.
They said I had to figure it out on my own. I am not a high maintenance web designer but, seriously, leaving a customer high and dry when they pay to host on your system? That said, I have never experienced this from Bluehost technical support.
They have always gone above and beyond what I would consider their role in supporting customers. The solutions they suggested have not always worked but they don't stop until they get it right and that the customer is satisfied. And they don't make me feel like an idiot.
I am a designer first and a back end programmer waaaaaaaay second, so I appreciate I little help on the technical end of things. And this is what I get from Bluehost. Keep up the great work! It does not go unrecognized.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
First, I want to compare them by price. While other hosting providers provides a cheaper offer at $4.99/month or same as it, compared by the number of features offered, Bluehost comes first at only $6.95/month at unlimited databases and emails. The same unlimited plan costs $14.99/month at Godaddy.
Bluehost is Cheaper! While every hosting provider has periods of downtime, I have noticed about the same down-time for both, whenever they have a maintenance going on. The sites powered by WordPress are loading noticeable faster on Bluehost.
Here, I refer mainly at the time the connection is made to database, before even the site is being loaded. At other providers, that waiting is longer by 1-3 seconds depending on the database size. I do not even want to mention the hosting provider FatCow and Godaddy  etc.
where this waiting time is 15-20 seconds! Bluehost is Faster! In case you want to have plug-ins or additional functionality running properly, DON’T sign up with any others providers!
I remember I had a very bad experience in the past, when a client of mine wanted a newsletter software installed on his Godaddy server. I managed to install it, but than, it would not send mass emails. Testing the same functionality on Bluehost, it worked with no problems.
Speaking with Godaddy technical support, they told me we need to upgrade the account and pay like $150/month, so we can have that feature supported! No thanks. Bluehost has more features configured and installed!
Another bitter experience with Godaddy, it was when we have lost information on a website we were developing, with no manual back-up at that time. After we figured out some problems with the content and that after few days, we found out that Godaddy only stores the back-ups for 1 day. If you need to go to an earlier date, their programmers need to go in there manually and restore it for you for the cost of $150.
Your mistake your pay! In exchange, on Bluehost they store the back-ups for 30 days so you don’t even have to worry about using your own back-up manager. Bluehost is more trusted!
Godaddy plays dirty! For some unexplained reason, on Godaddy, whenever we make a fresh install of WordPress we need to wait at least 30 minutes for the database and username to get created. In case you need to change the FTP password you need to wait another 30 minutes, waiting precious time just waiting when you have that deadline in few days.
I haven’t heard of such non-sens on other hosting providers including Bluehost. Bluehost saves developers time! Both companies respond in pretty quick to phone calls, however on Godaddy the waiting is higher due is a large company with more clients.
What I liked on Bluehost, is that sometimes they do things for you and they really want to help without charging you extra. On Godaddy, they always try to up-sell or have no clue about my problem. Bluehost support is more professional!
After all! Bluehost is the winner! I use Bluehost now and will be in future. I also recommend it to all my friends.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: bluehost totally rocks lately my dad bought a domain + web hosting from there. While I was making the site for my dad I faced some problem which their technical solved in seconds their service is truly extraordinary Bluehost has the best customer support and that's what makes it stand among its competitors. If anybody would ask me for a web host I would tell them bluehost. :D

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I was now for about 4 years hosting with bluehost. In this 4 years there was 3 times a termination of my account about different reasons. Ok, it may happen that something is going wrong, but why they have to terminate the whole account for some legal reason without to contact the customer that he can solve the problem?
Every time the account (15 Domains) where terminated on Friday or Saturday nights without an information in front. We cannot accept this, because as well we have paid customers on this servers and had some trouble with this lousy service of bluehost.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I can barely work facebook efficiently but after a couple chat sessions and some reference to youtube by tech support I've built a few sites. They don't read from a script on tech support, they go screen by screen and answer all your questions and tell you where to click. I'm probably a hard to deal with customer since I ask what every button down before I push it.
I prefer the chat support so I can print it and reference it later. When I mess something up a very calm tech resets my blunder. It's never a "let me talk to the head guy" situation, the tech on the line is always capable.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I am a small business owner and a Bluehost customer for the last 6 months. Earlier this month, I was on the phone with Bluehost to install an SLL certificate. While I was making the changes he recommended, my website started to degrade.
I lost the slideshow on my main page and my fonts started changing. I immediately informed the representative of the malfunction and asked him to uninstall anything that we had done to cause the change. He was able to restore the fonts, but not the slideshow.
Since that time, I have contacted Bluehost six times to restore the slide show to my website. Each time, they inform me that the website problems are not due to their changes. They say that I am on my own to fix it.
Since I don't have the technical expertise to do this myself, I have to pay a programmer hundreds of dollars to look into the problem and fix it. Beware to all small business owners with Bluehost websites! If you rely on Bluehost to guide you through any technical process on your website, be ready to be left holding the bag if something goes wrong.
My website has not functioned properly for 12 days now, and I will have to pay hundreds of dollars to fix it. Bluehost refuses to accept responsibility, and they refuse to give me the contact information for their corporate officers. They're hoping that if they ignore me, they won't have to take responsibility. As a small business owner, I could never get away with this kind of treatment of a customer.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: The better way to see if something it´s bad, good or excellent is when we get some troubleIo just need a response to an issue... I give 5 stars to BlueHost because with just a few minor issues and little questions, in years they always work efficient and with fast responses.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
This host provides many and advanced features as compared to other hosts in competition. The only thing is they have very low limit of sending email per hour approx 100. Also if they see spike in the traffic on your website they often warn you about high CPU and bandwidth usage regardless of unlimited hosting which they have promised.
So I think this host sucks. One should rather go for HostGator as it has less restrictions and the offer real unlimited hosting as compared to this host.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost sucks..my first experience. I bought shared hosting with price more than market price, everything was fine for two weeks. Installing applications, configuration all just like a breeze.
But when my ste started getting visitors. I started getting 1000 to 2000 visitors pr day, 20 to 30 online simultaneusly, thats where bluehost failed. They have special CPU throattling feature, which makes down a site with lot of traffic.
And my site was throttled for average 2 hours a day. My visitors started loosing and one fine morning, without any warning, Bluehost suspended my account just by saying my application has performance issues. Eventhough only on site has more traffic, I had 3 sites on the same account.
All got suspended and I moved to InMotion Hosting within 6 hours. After that my site was never down a single second. During days with Bluehost, site was down for 2 hours  day.
Eventhough I did not complete even one month, they rejected my claim for moneyback guarantee and refunded money for rest 11 months - the domain registration charges. Check the site monitor report here for yourself. http://sysojo.com/stats/11794
After suspended from Bluehost on April 7, 2011, I moved to InMotion hosting same day and you can see the site was never down for even a single second.
From March 19 to April 7, ste was down many times in day, the maximum being 4 hours in a day and minimum is 10 minutes. site url: http://www.kochituskers.in
So think yourself, if your webiste is hosted to attract visitors, Bluehost will suspend your account for traffic. Just for your hobby, if you have a webiste, Bluehost is good especially the simple scripts one click install
Vinod

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost Rocks!! Never faced any problems since i am hosted with them. They have always handeled my quries very professionally and quickly.
Their just one plan is very cheap and flexible for everyone looking out for hosting. Their User- Freindly Cpanel is very simple, powerful and easy to use and configure its like administration made easy. I loved the Fantastico Installer which install scripts very easily.
Bandwith is so much that you will never run out of it. I have used many hosting since years but  had some or the other problem every month. But i must say Bluehost is just like hosting heaven.
So don't just sit and think. Just go for it !!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
BlueHost is what I would call an All-Start website host. With a nice low fee, a great uptime, and the features of the major hosts; what more can you get from a website host? BlueHost may put you on a shared server but having a OS-48 BackBone server an almost 100% uptime, and a low amount of users on each shared server you almost forget your on a shared server after purchasing your account.
Support Wise, BlueHost has been known for having one of the biggest and fastest customer support times in the industry with their sister site HostMonster. For live support time I usually do not have to wait more than 10 minutes, phone wise the longest hold time I have received was three minutes. The way they handle your problems, issues, or concerns are one of a real host that will be here for years; they are no doubt the A+ on the hosting test for myself.
Problems are fixed at max within 24 hours and they usually have an answer for everything; no more hosting with lies. BlueHost and HostMonster are really for customers with a little more than higher knowledge of how to upload, update, and edit using FTP and the program cPanel. Accessing and editing Your Site is instant; no delay factors at all from purchasing to starting your website.
I just recommend you understand FTP and cPanel; this is not the host if your looking for a website editing program like FreeWeb's because you will not receive it. The only one problem I have received with BlueHost would have too be one server offline charted; and it was for 5 minutes, no biggie. BlueHost is a host I would no doubt reccomend to friends, family, enemies, anyone I come in contact with looking for a website host.
Not only are they affordable as stated above the features are just great. The only problem you may have is SSH/Shell Access is NOT instant; you will need to fax them your photo ID in order to activate this feature. On a scale of 1 to 10 to rate this host to rap up; I would rate it a 105 without hesitation.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: I have been using for Bluehost hosting from the last 4 Months and I just faced only 1 issue till now which gets solved by the support team in 1 hour. Uptime was Good. It is a Good option for starters as it is low price and offers free domain. Good value for the price and good support till now.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
No, no, and no. My site has been down for days. I tried to reach them by email, chat, and phone.
No response. I waited on the the phone for over 20 minutes before giving up. As for the chat, there's a countdown of "minutes" until the next representative is available.
I say "minutes" because I actually timed it and each "minute" is around 120 seconds. It started at "12", but 20 actual minutes later, when it got down to 2 minutes the timer reset itself up to 8.
30 day money guarantee? Yeah right.
That's not even an option! I tried contacting them through Paypal to get my money back. No response.
Eventually I had to escalate and let Paypal handle it. Still waiting for my money back. Save yourself a trouble and host elsewhere. I'm not even sure there are real people behind this "service".

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I talk about bluehost , an American company that offers several services, for which I hired the hosting for my .COM and .US domains cooltourspain
The price is $ 4.95 / month, with a total of 59.40 for a year. I have 3 email accounts and offer me a total of 250MB of webmail which is not much, but what I pay is sufiente . The interface is OK , because if you want to access the part of hosting you have to do from a tab and email from another .
Mail received are not saved in bluehost if I have it set to be saved in my gmail , but I do not like this option. In short , I think I 'll keep looking for other hosting companies to continue next year. regards

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: This is the worst hosting we have ever use, server always down and when you need help and support you have to wait over 30 mins , until someone answer your enquiries. But they will kick you out of the conversation when they can't solve the problem and never with an explanation. Never try to use this server ! This is the worst .

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost pre-sales took at max 1-3 minutes to get someone and they answered the questions quickly. Completed my purchase and had a simple question prior to the transfer. Hit the button for support.  30 minutes!
Waited 30 minutes night 1 and was still at 15 minutes. Night 2 waited for 37 minutes before someone connected in. Once they connected in, there was about 5 minutes between each message.
I would type. Wait 5 minutes. He would type another question.
I would answer. Wait 5 minutes. He would ask another question.
The absolute worst support I think I have seen. I then tried to cancel. I was stuck on the "you are being transferred we will be with you shortly current wait time 1 minute". Well, that has lasted 30 minutes and counting.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I am a developer with several clients on bluehost. For shared hosting,  and small websites,  they are ok. However,  we migrated one of our clients to VPS to handle more traffic,  get better response time, etc.
What a nightmare. Not a trouble free (as we were assured)  migration by any definition. No help from VPS if you need it .
you are just told it is your problem. My problem,  for sure,  was an angry client whose store did not work and who lost approximately $7000 in revenue for the 2 days that it took to get his store back up. Now I'm stuck with having to clear error logs daily to keep the allotted space free (or have the website crash)  Blue Host VPS support simply does not care.
We are looking for a new host... sooner rather than later.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
You get what you pay...Heard that saying? Well that's what applies here. I signed up for the VPS.
Shifted my main site and then saw that WooCommerce couldn't work anymore. I asked them that everything was fine when i was on A Small Orange why its no more working fine. To this they had an amazing answer.
Ask your web developer. Well sorry we are the web developers. We know what we are doing.
We said there is some security loophole. Please check. They won't listen.
Instead they lectured us about how stable and how BIG a hosting they are. Useless. Just run away from these bunch of unprofessionals.
A Small Orange is good hosting with few downtimes but at least they answer properly and listen to customers. These guys are useless. Whats the use of all features if you get such kind of useless support. Avoid them if you are a web developer!!!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
If you ever need to put up a business website, don't use Bluehost. Regardless of what "guru" directs you there thru an affiliate link (hint They're getting paid to promote Bluehost... the service isn't actually good).
Crappy customer service when it comes to billing/cancellations. They give you the run around. I was told that I couldn't be transferred to speak with a different rep or supervisor.
that I just need to "hang up and call again." And the hosting is sub-par. Your website is guaranteed to be down at least 5-6 times throughout the year (that's an issue when your income depends heavily on lead generation). In exchange for the $30 they claim they can't refund me for sites I haven't used in almost six months, I think they should lose out on more than that in potential clientele. Save yourself the headache.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost is one of the worst web hosting services out there. I won't say which web host I switched to so that this review is honest. Bluehost used to be fine, about five years ago, but over the past couple of years it has really gone down hill.
First, there have been a couple times I called in for support and they just couldn't help me. I described my problem, and after a few clarifying questions and getting through a few scripted answers from them, there was simply silence and "sorry, we can't help you." I ended up figuring out the problem on my own (Java security update). Mostly, the support had been great.
By far, the biggest problem is server down time. Sometimes, my website would take over 30 seconds to load if at all. My site would never load in under 15 seconds.
Accessing the Bluehost site was slow as molasses. Same situation, I click something and would have to wait a long time for it to load. For example, If I wanted to access Domain Manager or my emails, the wheel would continue spinning, sometimes indefinitely until the connection timed out.
Very frustrating. I've read that Bluehost has a policy of over selling their servers. I believe it.
My new host is Lightning fast, the way it should be. My site loads so quickly now I almost cry tears of joy. I didn't know it could be so good.
I've told all my business friends who use Bluehost and have the same slow load times to switch over to somewhere else. Wordpress Definitely should not be promoting Bluehost. I'm not sure if my experience with Bluehost is unique, it seems like a lot of people like it. But for me, it's been an absolute nightmare.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have used blue host for my web sites for 8+ years and always found their technical support and up time excellent. It has slipped in the last year or so. They have the most restrictive password procedure that I have ever experienced.
Its 50 times for restrictive than my bank. Their automatic response to reset your password often does not work at all. It has become such a hassle to deal with them that I am moving my websites to a new host as soon as I complete my research so I don't go from bad to worse. I would not recommend BlueHost to anyone.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've been a basic client for 2 years and service has been good value. Then when my web site started to get loads of connections I had to switch
to a VPS hosting, that costs 20 times more 90USD per month. What a bad switch!
In the last 4 months I've had 2 refunds due to my server's uptime
that's been outrageous! The server's been down for more than 48 hrs! OK, they give a refund, but with a 48hrs downtime with on line selling
services server, I've lost loads of sales.
So while looking at the terms and agreement, I've found out that
there is no uptime guarantee in terms of %, just goodwill! This is the aswer I got from bluehost:
We strive to keep it as high as we can on a server level, but offer no guarantee on it. If their striving is enough for you, go for it.
At the same time, if you're late 4 days for the monthly payment, they
just switch the server off! That is the only guarantee you can have!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have had BlueHost for many years but this year 2014 the quality of the service degraded rapidly. My site was loading extremely slow or came out with error on 7/24 (yesterday) and today the same issue. I could hardly login to wordpress or cpanel and they were super slow as well.
Cpanel runs from main BlueHost site so I don't understand why it can be slow as well. Just terrible experience. It is not the first time so I transferred all of my domains to SiteGround which was running super fast.
They are transferring my main domain today but I cannot even reach the BlueHost FTP so they might have a trouble copying files till servers speedup. BlueHost has nice TV and we commercials but that is about it. No more BlueHost!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Hello, I really suggest you warn people about how bad bluehost is and publish this review. Their website went down again last week for 24 hours and cost us over 5,000.00. Avoid this hosting company at all costs. HostGator, bluehost, and just host are all the same company

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Hi,
Today I am join to write a review of blue host. Now, one of the things I personally liked about blue host, was that there website design was clean and simple. That is what drove me over to there.
It may seem pricy, but in the long run, it beats iPage, with its price of $1.99/First Mo, then $9.99/Mo there on out. Where Bluehost's price work, $3.95/First Mo, then $6.99/Mo there on out. The website control panel, Cpanel, I think, is very neat and organized.
There is great live chat support, and I don't think I have had a signal downtime since I started using them last month. I think bluehost is definatly up there with the top 3 world wide web hosts. It is great for anybody who owns a small or medium website. Just be careful not to push its limits...

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Great uptime and support. I have not had a problem with data or bandwidth so far. Probably the best shared hosting out there with an easy to use control panel.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I can't believe there is a single legitimate positive review. I have had a half dozen sites down for more than 48 hours right now and that is after 3 unanswered tickets. I have had my sites down 9 times in the past 12 months......another time for multiple days.
On the one recent ticket I got an answer to, the person plugged in some cookie-cutter reply that had nothing at all to do with my problem. For service,  I would give Bluehost one star. If they make a claim of 99% uptime, I would say that they are being misleading.
When you make your living depending on a website, and the host doesn't seem to care about it being down, then it's time to move on. (which is what I am doing after a dozen years) The server that many of my sites are on seemed to be infested with malware. The CS people have a bad habit of blaming things on the customer. (hmmm... I made the server go down and I allowed the malware on the server?) There was a time when Bluehost was great.
The old CEO and founder really cared about customers. Today, I could not recommend them.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: BlueHost is one of my fave hosting when it comes to Blogging sites. Easy steps to follow and hassle free setup

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
BlueHost is one of the better hosting companies I have tried and here a couple of reasons why I think that. For the low price of 4.95 you can get unlimited domain hosting,  Storage, File Transfer,  and E-mail Accounts. This makes it great for a small business which needs plenty of all of those.
They say they have 24/7 support but for me it took a very long time to start chatting. You should note that the price 4.95 is only for the first term and after that the price is going to go up depending on if you want the Standard or Pro Plan. The Control Panel for your domain/hosting isn't that great and it is mediocre at best.
I would recommend this to my friends because the price is nice and because they have 1-Click Script Installs for Wordpress, Joomla,  Drupal and many more! In conclusion BlueHost is an excellent host.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
How fast is BlueHost support? I have been with BlueHost for few hours and they already suck! They say on their web site: "instant setup".
Took my wallet, paid the 120.2$ and waited to the magic to happen. Half a day later I got an email saying that my application is incomplete. They asked my scan my Credit Card and send it to them.
WTF? Done it. Late in the night seeing that I get no answer from them, I contact them to see what's going on.
'The next operator will be available in 15 minutes.' WTF?
Finally I get to speak with someone: 'Wrong department. Please hold while we transfer you'. Finally I get a real human to speak with.
They told me they lost my email (the one with the credit card). So I need to scan it again and send it over. 'We will contact you later'. It was already late Saturday in USA and they Dont offer support Sunday.
I was prepared to buy yet another hosting from a different company. As backup. In case BlueHost screw it.
After waiting another day, they slap me hard again:  they asked my ID also. So, yet another day for them to process the new document and YET another day to receive the answer: your application has been rejected, your charge will be refunded in 7-14 days! I got a better hosting company meanwhile. If you are in a hurry, stay away from BlueHost!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
i use bluehost in alberta canada
their so called unlimited domains has a file cap - so if you have 60 domains like i do and they are all running wordpress you will make out your file count. This was very misleading and unlimited means without limits. They have a 250000 file limit.
so - i was forced to upgrade to a vpn service for 24.95 per month and ever since my email has not been functioning well. I can hardly send out email from my local machine using thunderbird. I spoke with 6 different people in tech support and all but the last one was blaming my end and told me to dump my cache and do a bunch of things as the problem is on my end.
the 6th guy did a trace and telus my isp is blocking bluehost. turns out that bluehost has lots of spammers on it site and isps have been blocking their servers. they are now trying to get me up and running but have in no way offered any compensation for my time one the phone which is about 6 hours or a credit to my account. time for an another provider and time to say goodbye to bluehost

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
BlueHost has been a great service for 6 of the 8 years I used it. The last two years were just a nightmare, the service went downhill the websites had downtimes every couple of hours. I cancelled today my reseller account expecting to get a refund of over 150 USD, and guess what happened, I got a refund for $37 USD because they say I have to pay for the coupon that they provide for an SSL certificate.
If you cancel after 5 days, you will be charged the SSL certificate which is about 2/3 of the price of the whole year of a reseller account. This is what happened, from the chat.
[Initial Question] Provider: Bluehost - My Domain is: "redesignmx.com" I cancelled my reseller account today and got a refund of $37.20 only? when it had over 8 months left of service?
what???...
(19:35) [System] Customer has entered chat and is waiting for an agent.
(19:35) [ChatSnipedManually] {"staffId":"201"}
(19:36) [Dane C.] Can I have you verify the last 4 characters of your cPanel password for me?
(19:36) [Adolfo] 7A.7
(19:37) [Dane C.] Because you canceled early, you were charged for the SSL certificate that we gave you for free. That was $149.00, that is why your refund was decreased
(19:37) [Adolfo] Eh? but it was a coupon then it wasn't free O_o
(19:38) [Dane C.] We offered it to you for free, but when you cancel you have to pay for that coupon
(19:38) [Dane C.] Because it is not free if you cancel
(19:39) [Adolfo] And that way you want to keep an 8 year customer...
that's nonsense, actually funny.
(19:39) [Adolfo] I don't recall anywhere stating if I cancel it would be charged
(19:40) [Dane C.] The SSL can only be canceled within 5 days of purchase, so you are having to pay for your SSL since you are canceling early. We won't provide a coupon if you cancel the service early
(19:40) [Adolfo] Then cancel the SSL?
(19:41) [Adolfo] Since it was an offer from BH
(19:41) [Adolfo] I don't want an SSL certificate that costs over 140 USD
(19:41) [Dane C.] As I said, the SSL can only be canceled within the first 5 days of purchase
(19:41) [Adolfo] if I can get one for less than 50
(19:41) [Adolfo] but I didn't even purchased it, that's the point lmao
(19:43) [Adolfo] Anyway, can I ask if it even has wildcard?
(19:43) [Dane C.] You did actually, when you signed up for the reseller account
(19:43) [Adolfo] That way I might use it
(19:43) [Dane C.] It is the wildcard. And you can continue to use it
(19:43) [Adolfo] ok cool, atleast it's not all lost
(19:44) [Adolfo] thanks...
i gues..
(19:44) [Dane C.] No, you're welcome. Did you have any other questions, or is there anything else I can assist you with today?
(19:44) [ChatClosedByCustomer] {}
(19:44) [System] Chat closed by customer request. If you cancel you pay for what you were offered "for free", the whole amount.
I don't like being tricked, I feel robbed and I am seriously never coming back to BH and will spread this around the Internet. I lose, you lose.

Bluehost is one of the simplest hosting platforms available if you want to get Your Site up and running quick and easy.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost has been hosting my website since 2014, Mason Harris photography.com. Although I find the password generation system annoying, I was generally happy with the service. That was until this April when I decided to set up a new website - a secondary one as an extension to my wedding business.
I contacted their online chat, and set everything up and paid for them to host the second domain. Much to my regret I then asked if I could maybe combine both site hosting packages to save money. The help guy said yes, he could do that for me.
After some discussion it was agreed I would pay extra for them to handle this process as I am not very technical. I duly stumped up the cash. Weeks go and nothing happens.
My contact there says 'he is not sure what is happening but will check with the site migration team." After several more confusing and contradictory emails he said it was all fixed and the two sites (Mason Harris photography.com and pagan photos.com) were now combined under one hosting package. When I check Mason Harris photography.com however today (Saturday 21 May) the site is effectively crippled. Nothing is showing except some Html index code.
I have lost all content and WordPress templates. Nobody at Bluehost is able to help me as their site migration team doesn't work weekends despite their promise of seven day technical support. Earlier in the week I also was contacted by their marketing manager after I complained, who promised to put one of his top people onto it.
Not a word. So to recap. After giving Bluehost more business and being promised an easy 'streamlining' of two site hosting packages into one - and after paying them extra to take care of the technicalities for me - I have been left with a crippled website and no idea what is happening.
Even more worryingly, every person I speak to Has no record of my previous correspondence or payments. Based on my experience I would say their technical support is barely fit for purpose, and when they offer to make domain transfers easy, it's anything but the case.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
If you are searching for a hosted server vendor - this not the vendor you been looking for. Contacting technical support via live chat or phone is minimum of a 20 minutes wait on hold. Quality of technical support varies from fair to poor.
BlueHost has not been backing up my five website domains for over five weeks. After repeated chat sessions and calls the best information that I could get was "the tech are working on it". No ETA when it would be fixed.
More importantly I received no notification that the backups were stopped because of a BlueHost infrastructure failure. If you are seeking a solution that doesn't required constant monitoring of basic functions like backup then don't chose BlueHost. I'm now stuck with manually backing up five hosted servers everyday indefinitely or until our prepaid contract runs out. Ironic as this type of routine task was exactly what I expected to automate with a hosted server provider.
