website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I'm a developer by trade and have had hosting accounts with various providers for almost 20 years. I'll start with Customer Service which I believe to be an important factor with a hosting account. This is Bluehosts' weakest point.
There are a number of issues that contribute to this weakness. Not all their tech support technicians are knowledgeable  or qualified, you will likely have to make 2+ contacts before having your issue(s) resolved. You will be given wrong, different, and incorrect information until you reach someone that is knowledgeable.
Wait times are extremely long and the chat wait time calculator is essentially meaningless. Once you do get a tech they will likely be working with a number of other customers, which likely contributes to faulty information because you are dealing with a distracted tech. To add insult to injury, a large focus of their support will be an attempt to up-sell you to some other service that will supposedly resolve your issue.
In my opinion Bluehost customer service is utterly worthless. With respect to features, you get a reasonable amount of features for the money, but in this regard they are not really offering anything most everyone doesn't also offer. You will have to pay extra for useful features, particularly those dealing with Spam.
The price is fair, the $3.95 listed is not accurate. Monthly price is between $6.99 - $7.99 a month for standard hosting, which is on par with their competition. Again, drawback is you'll pay extra for additional features, so plan on paying about $10+ a month.
You get one free domain registration with your account which is a fairly standard feature. I would not recommend using Bluehost for Domain Name Registration as their pricing is high and there are plenty of other companies that provide this service for much less. With respect to uptime, I haven't noticed any issues here and this seems to be something their pretty good at.
Their strongest feature is their CPanel, which is very user friendly and pretty easy to navigate. For those that are not technically savvy this is a big plus. Back when Bluehost used to have good customer service I would recommend them to my customers regularly for this very reason.
In sum, their pricing is fair but given their horrible and almost useless customer service you will be better served somewhere else. I have hosting accounts with other providers which granted also have their issues but overall provide much better customer service and a bigger bang for the buck. Save yourself some frustration and stay away from these guys would be my advice.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been using bluehost for about 5 years and am glad to finally be getting rid of it. When I started out, the ease of use was beneficial, but their cPanel interface has always been pretty slow. In the last couple of weeks, this has been unbearable.
Further, when trying to re-route some domains to another hosting service last week, their interface kept timing out and mentioning service issues, even though their service status page listed no problems in the region and no problems on my server specifically. After an hour of hitting refresh and trying again and again, it eventually worked, but it almost cost me a client demo. Normally, bluehost's customer support is pretty good, but the above incident and their lack of information on service repairs and uptime has led me to give them a very negative rating.
If there is scheduled maintenance, I expect to be informed ahead of time. If there is unscheduled maintained, I expect to be informed of the issue and kept up to date on the status. Seeing a screen with "try again soon" from a serious hosting company is completely Unacceptable!
In short, bluehost has always been slow and it has been unbearable in the last month. They are unreliable and lie about service status. I will be switching away soon and encourage others to consider alternatives.

I was on with support for 15 hours that week trying to figure out the cause and work with them. I also submitted an urgent support ticket that never got a response. They blamed it on our Outlook and ect.
We moved hosts and the new host was able to diagnose our previous issues in under 5 minutes. the server we were sharing had been blacklisted and therefore we were getting the repercussions. The reason i dont entirely tank the rating for customer service is that many times they did answer my questions regarding how to do something fairly quickly, their chat is great and response [especially sales]

reviews.review_text: The support from BlueHost is extensive in it's existing forum based information and tutorials. I have never had to actively contact BlueHost as their existing information is excellent. The have both forum based information and video help. The technical expertise needed to use BlueHost are simple (depending on what you want to do). I sub host a domain on my account and installed a WordPress blog on this - the WordPress integration is excellent. No fuss and very simple! I would, without hesitations recommend BlueHost. Their administration panel is intuitively set out and their low monthly costs make it a great hosting solution.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I was a customer of HostGator before I go to bluehost, I really don't like its customer service and the uptime was very poor so, for my needs, and bad experiences with some other hostings, I finally take a  advice from one friend and I move to bluehost. In my experience with BlueHost, It is a good hosting service provider in my opinion because it has a very good prices for the services that they offer and I like their features like its tweaked cpanel that allow all kind of users manage it without know some of the technical issues, I like too the fast way to buy domains and add ons domains in the cpanel. Other good thing is the ftp speed.
Respect to the Uptime of my website, I think that it isn't in 99% but it's near to 97%. I don't know how the support service works cause I really haven't ever needed it. I think that in my country (Colombia) the charge of my websites hosted in bluehost are a little slow. Finally, I think that bluehost is up to average web hosting services and in my little expertise, I can say that they are very professionals  with their business and I recommend this to all people that need a basic and intermediate web hosting service that have a good uptime service and that they live near where the data centers of bluehost are located( I really don't know where:  P )  for  a good (but not cheap) cost.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
If you´re a wordpress website / blog owner then I´ve found BlueHost to be an excellent hosting option. Not only is it very cheap but it´s also ideal for people who wish to make use of the CloudFlare CDN service which you can get direct from the cPanel. I also like that BlueHost includSimple Scriptspts in the cPanel by default.
For those that don´t know, it´s a free 1-click script installer giving you a very easy way to install and manage over 300 top applications (e.g. WordPress, Joomla, phpBB, Gallery, etc). I haven´t had any issues with uptime or performance either, so would definitely recommend BlueHost to anyone who´s in the Wordpress sphere and looking for a reliable and cost effective hosting solution.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
BlueHost is what I call an amazing website host. With a low fee, a great uptime, and the features of the major hosting . BlueHost will put you on a shared server but having a OS-48 BackBone server an almost amazing uptime, and a less amount of users on every shared server you will forget your on a shared server after purchasing your account.
Support Wise, BlueHost has one of the biggest and fastest customer support times in the industry with their sister site HostMonster. For live support time I usually do not have to wait more than 5 minutes. they are no doubt no 1 on the hosting test for myself. Problems are fixed within 24 hours and they usually have an answer for everything.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've been a Blue Host user for past 6 months and had a very nice experience through. Previously I’ve been using WordPress.com hosting when a friend recommended me to migrate to BlueHost to enjoy more freedom and ultimate features. I subscribed to basic shared hosting plan and got a free domain name on joining as well.
The built-in site builder and Wordpress installation support really helped me to set up my website and migrate from wordpress.com to Bluehost. While migrating, I faced a little trouble but thanks to Support team they solved it in no time. I get full administration control to my website via cPanel which I had never experienced before.
The automatic backup feature makes me feel more protected against accidental data loss. Moreover, I can create unlimited business email IDs for me and team members and, I get all of these features for almost 3 dollars a month only. Uptime is really good; my site is always online, and the speed is awesome. I would highly recommend Blue Host for all of your online projects.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Well, let me talk about BlueHost from scratch. I was looking for a good hosting website then my friend recommended me to use BlueHost because he was already using his sites on this hosting platform and still his site are being hosted in Blue Host. I registered myself and bought shared hosting plan which was quite offered at affordable prices.
The Blue Host Company is doing great work and taking care of its customers. I became confused while updating my CMS which is "WordPress" because it was giving some kind of error and not allowing me to proceed further to update WordPress. What I did I send asked for help in by using its customer support option and within half an hour one of its customer support members replied me back and solved my issue.
So, its customer support is great which has impressed me because I got reply very fast. Till now I have not faced any downtime issue in my website so it’s up time is definitely awesome. I will recommend this best hosting to everyone.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: BlueHost customer support for WordPress hosting service is quite possibly the worst thing ever. When you contact them with an issue they act like you caused it and should know how to fix it because you are on their "VPS" hosting plan. They market the service to get you in and leave you hanging when an issue arises. Every time I contact them, I get transferred, hug up on and chats are dropped with no answer.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have just about pulled out all of my hair thanks to Blue Host and the customer service (or very lack of) that I have received. The issue I was experiencing was that I could receive emails but not send them. So I contacted Blue Host initially by Chat.
It was a very slow process. The 1 minute timer turned into 30 minutes of waiting - what's the point of a timer if it is not accurate. Then having eventually managed to chat to someone, it was painful waiting for their response to my questions.
Obviously they are dealing with multiple enquiries but never did I once feel that my issue was being taken seriously. I was promised by the 'technician' that my issue would be resolved in 2 hours, 4 hours later nothing. I contacted them again and was advised it would be overnight.
I contacted them the following morning and the issue was still not resolved. So I decided to telephone them (from the UK) and advised that the issue would take 24 hours. Yes you guessed it 24 hours later and nothing.
On speaking to the 'technician' again he advised that they did not have enough information and yet on my previous call I spent 30 minutes going through the issue with them. Bloody hopeless. So despite my business being effected for nearly 48 hours, they decided to look into the issue - they were doing me a favour by putting me to the front of the queue even though I had been informed that this would be resolved within a few hours - how bloody good of them!!!
Obviously unhappy with the service that I have been provided I wished to raise a complaint - guess what - no supervisors or managers available and apparently no complaints department. What a load of rubbish. As soon as I can I will be moving on - stay well clear - you have been warned,

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Through my experience of using BlueHost, i think that's it's one of the best hosting providers, but it has also some cons that could probably influence in its reputation. One of the best things i like about BlueHost is that their server is 99% reliable. That means that there are rarely some downtimes and when they are, they make sure to fix it asap!
I like also how easy they make things when you want to sign up for them: smooth & easy registration process, many apps integrations, official wordpress.org intergration... And of course let's not forget their low pricing! But as i've said earlier, there are some cons that they should Definitively consider in order to gain more trust.
One of the things i hate about them is that the site is very slow in loading! And their customer service isn't the best (they should definitively look for a better customer service). And if you're just starting in building your website, i suggest that you learn how to host and manipulate things in your hosting first (there are a lot of youtube videos teaching this) and then apply for their service because their tutorials and walk-through videos are So expensive! All in all, i think that BlueHost is really a good host for beginners and if they can work on their cons, they may be the top in hosting!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost is one of the best quality Hosting services provider. They having clients in very huge quantity and they are really surprised with there services. I have personally experienced with them, and i am fully satisfied with there services, up time is really Good which is  99.99% as they says.
Most important things in there technology which make it unique from other hosting providers. They have seven different packages for there clients as like Shared hosting, Cloud Hosting, Wordpress, Hosting, WooCommerece Hosting, VPS Hosting and Dedicate Hosting but even i use there shared hosting personally and its work best for my small blog even i will recommend it to every newbie, because of its up time and speed. One last but important thing i will definitely say, which is best of the best and i like bluehost for it that is there support.
Yes! There support is included in the one of the best support at a day right now, they giving response within no time..... And that is not hearing things which i write above. That all are real that's why i shift on bluehost .

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I took with them about 4 months and I can not say nothing but good things about the service they offer. At first I hesitated because it was not in Spain and the price + unlimited word , did not give me a good feeling about the truth. At the end choose to buy it where it could host as many domain names as would among other advantages.
After 4 months as I mentioned before, I am very very happy with the service they offer, both answering support tickets in perfect Spanish incredibly quickly and further provided with a solution in hand. As for the speed of the server ( SSD features ) it is very good (of course, if you have a little ... well optimized website you will be slower ) . my websites continue to grow and can prove the VPS to the company , sure I would be pleasantly surprised.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I took about 2 months working with whoistingthis and one of the things I have happy is the speed of response. Regardless of when you have come to help, they have not taken more than 10 minutes to help me. I recently had to make some massive changes in my server.
I was staying 2 domain and wanted to reorganize their locations, and add a third party to host the wordpress the first domain, so that this first change completely. I started using the tutorials that are magnificent in his excellent blog -100% recommended- but for some reason unknown to me, could not. So I opened it and ticket and I got in touch with them.
As I said, they went immediately to offer support and after explaining what he wanted to do, got down to work and they left me as I wanted. I was quite surprised because I got scared thinking they would not be able to do it and end up having to start everything from 0. Thanks to technical support.
So a pleasure! ray

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
It's the third hosting I've used for my agency website, which I truly believe to be the last one.:)
For the previous godaddy and a free hosting, I always have this or that kind of problem, like port is not enabled, website is down from time to time, my site could not be backup in time... etc. But this time, I have not a single problem, I have to say bluehost staff is quite professional and dedicated to the work, they have absolutely deep knowledge about hosting, optimization, migration...
etc, 9 out of 10 times my issue is resolved within the live chat, not even in ticket. I'm so glad I'm working with a reputated company that truly cares about their customer. I highly recommend anyone who are still on the fence about hosting options could take a look, you won't regret anyway!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
On completion of 4 long years with Bluehost, I feel myself bound to express my satisfaction in best possible words for them. Before moving on to Bluehost, I had few bad experiences with many big names in hosting industry. Then I decided to give Bluehost a try and in 4 years they have never disappointed me.
They have awesome and balanced hosting plans which can serve to all types of websites. I started with their shared hosting plan and enjoyed that more than premium plans of other hosting services. After feeling myself comfortable, I switched on to their  wordpress hosting which also went beyond expectations.
Now days I am using Bluehost Cloud and VPS plans, and experience is more than what is required or expected. One click CMS installation features. in-built cloudflare and many such features work flawlessly for the benefit of webmasters.
Uptime is 99.99% as what they advertise and I hardly get any down time for even busiest sessions on my websites. I am using Bluehost for all types of websites, ranging from personal blog to a busy eCommerce platform and havent faced any serious issue. In the end, few words about their support.
They are best in the business. Ready to solve any issue whenever asked and get back to the customer at the earliest possible with most suitable solution for websites. Will continue with them for as long as possible for sure.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I moved to Bluehost 2 years ago. I had been with 1and1 for 10+ years before that. I create and support websites and email services for numerous small businesses.
I left 1and1 due to lousy support and email problems. Bluehost has been amazing. Email works well,  spam filtering is built in if you enable it.
Websites load fast and have no artificial limitations (as with NODaddy). Chat support can take a few minutes to cue up,  but they resolve your issue first time. I wanted to give Bluehost a boost after an extremely frustrating experience (still ongoing BTW) with No Daddy.
My client signed up for No Daddy for 5 years with a managed wordpress site. Very simple. Getting stuff onto their servers (No Daddy) is Slow,  times out,  freezes, and disconnects.
Right now I have a goDaddy support ticket pending for over 24 hours because I (and NoDaddy support as well BTW) cannot upload a 500 KB plugin into wordpress. Either via WordPress or via FTP. Just freezes.
Amazing to me that No Daddy can stay in business. Go Bluehost!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
BlueHost has many pros and a couple of cons. First off, the hosting options are numerous but well organized. There is Shared hosting, managed WordPress hosting, dedicated hosting, VPS hosting and all of the usual types.
The uptime is pretty good, and I have only seen one instance where the site was down, and it went back up shortly. You can purchase domains on BlueHost. Transferring domains is always a complication with hosts, and BlueHost is not an exception.
If you have a domain elsewhere, you can change the settings to point to your BlueHost website. I believe the limit is 5 domains for the cheapest plan. The support at Bluehost is pretty good.
However the chat program they use is terrible. It is easy to forget that you are chatting with a support representative. The telephone support is okay, but not the best at helping users transfer domains.
We got a domain that was stuck, mid-transfer for about a week. However, it got fixed eventually. The cPanel for BlueHost works fine.
It has the usual things like creating FTP logins, managing emails, and anything else you can think of. BlueHost is a good host with the essential features necessary to create a great website. If I could afford it, I would be paying for a dedicated server at BlueHost to try out what it is like.
One major con with the shared hosting plan is that it is shared hosting. Because BlueHost is a popular host, the lowest price plan is the most used. This means that the servers for the shared hosting can be a bit boggy at times.
This is not really the fault of BlueHost, but there are literally over a thousand different sites on the server I am using. Some of the less popular hosts that offer shared hosting are much faster because the shared servers have less strain put on them. One thing I like about BlueHost it doesn't get too complicated.
There are many-many different plans, but everything is so organized and simplistic that anyone should be able to figure out how to set it up. If you have an issue, the support is available 24/7 to help you. BlueHost also has a bunch of (slightly pricey but quality) professional services.
There is Quick Start, which will help you get Your Site up and running, with 45 minute sessions of 80 dollars. Then, for 150 dollars, there is Site Transfer, in which they will migrate your websites from other hosts to BlueHost. The last is called Site Doctor, which is 250 dollars to fix problems such as hackers and malware to save your online presence.
These services are very professional, though I do not need the first one. When I need to migrate a website, I just FTP all of the content and export the MySQL databases, and then re-import them. When I encounter malware/redirects to malicious websites on my site, I fix the problem myself.
However it is nice to know that these services are available, if absolutely necessary. My final statement: BlueHost rocks, because it is a great web host that offers really cheap pricing and services that much better quality then some other hosts that I have encountered.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost was recommended to me by a close friend who has used their service for many years. I signed up to use the service and set up my first business website. I then proceeded to build my first business website.
I am a novice when it comes to websites, but I have 37 years of Information Systems experience in every area from Computer Operations to VP of Information Systems for a large corporation.  . After placing my website into production, I had some problems which I attributed to my own lack of experience. After I renewed my subscription for Bluehost website hosting recently, I received an email stating that my website had been suspended and would be deleted very soon if I didn't call them to rectify the situation.
I spent 2 hours on hold with their Customer Service. When a representative finally answered the phone, I asked what the problem was. They hadn't even told me in the email.
The representative was rude and condesending from the getgo. He told me that my website had been hacked and nothing could be done. They would be deleting the website immediately.
They wouldn't give me any other information unless I signed up for their Support Services. Indeed, quite interestingly, my website was deleted the next day. I was not given any guidance about what I did to cause this problem (if I even did), and what could be done in the future to insure that this would not happen to my Business website again.
In my lengthy career in IT, I have dealt with large and small companies. Some of these have been IBM, Unisys, and Digital Equipment (DEC). At times, I would get a rare support person that wasn't interested, but I always was able to report the problem and a representative from the company would get back to me with a response and what steps had been taken to rectify the situation.
Bluehost has no such structure in place. I  have never experienced a company that has such an immature disregard for their clients! When attempting to contact Bluehost to report the incident, I could not get anyone to return my calls, emails, or letters.
I was hung up on three times when making pointed requests to speak with any Management. Their business model obviously includes no regard for the Client. I now have to rebuild the company's website from scratch.
I was able to manually save the thousands of posts that were on the website. All other content was lost. I have had no response from the company regarding any help or even an apology.
I am amazed that they have any clients at all. I am recommending to all of my extensive Executive contacts in IT that they bypass this company. .

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost used to be fantastic. That is back before they sold out to a large corporation and they grew so big. Customer support is absolutely terrible,  not completely because of the techies,  but because how difficult it is to get customer support.
As just one example,  I have tried three separate times today to get through to them regarding a serious problem. The first time after starting at a wait time of 28 minutes which kept growing,  the call dropped after I waited for 15 minutes. The wait time on the next call was 45 minutes and I hung up.
Now,  I have been on hold for 15 minutes hoping to get through soon,  but who knows? This is typical and I dread having to call support at Bluehost. Plus,  they have had to hire so many new techies that the quality of the support has really suffered.
I have a few accounts at Bluehost and I am moving them all. They cannot support their user base. Period.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: I am currently hosting two domains with bluehost and I am happy with their vps hosting and due to the service of bluehost and traffic of my websites, I am going to move them to dedicated hosting. I have also tried shared hosting and it is also value for money. If you are new then you must at least try shared hosting of BlueHost.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I used BlueHost because my website developer recommended them, but I'm sorry I listened. I understand that they might have been a good company at one time, but they are far from that now. Pricing is decent, but I guess you get what you pay for.
The customer service, if you can call it that, is horrible. When trying to get ahold of tech support either by phone or by web, the wait time has never been less than 20min for me, and two times yesterday it was over 30 min. When finally connected all they could tell me is "they're working on the servers, and that's all I can tell you, I'm kept in the dark too." So I waited over 30 min for that explanation to my website being down twice, and when trying to get ahold of manager I had to wait another 30 min.
My website has been down for about 48hrs, only on sporadically during this time. Honestly I don't monitor my website uptime as often as I should, so I can only imagine how much it's been down. As most of you I assume, I spend thousands of dollars in advertising trying to drive people to my website to capture clients.
If the website is down when someone finally goes to the site, they're never going to come back, and that's costing me money! Each person that comes to my site is potentially "on avg." about $7,500. So having my website operational is critical. I recommend that you do more research and find a more reliable company.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've been using Bluehost for several years. As background, I'm an experienced IT professional with more than 20 years in the business, and I'm using a premium VPS service from these folks. I've had very bad problems with the availability of their servers, which they tend to blame on Worpdress or other issues.
When I can get into the root console, the problem is normally some script running on their side, or some misconfiguration on their side, rather than anything on the wordpress side of things. I also have the consistent experience of opening cases and having them tell me, "this is your server, we don't maintain this stuff," while at the same time being denied access to the directories/etc. I would need to fix the problems.
For instance, some of my email accounts are dkim signed, others are not. I opened a case to have them all dkim signed, to which they first responded, "what is dkim and why do you care," and then, "we don't handle this, it's your problem because you're on a VPS." The reality is, however, I don't have access to the mail server to change anything about it -- it's completely on their side of the wall. Another instance, I consistently receive errors in upgrade scripts for various python modules, the cpanel, etc. -- I receive emails notifying me that things can't be upgraded because specific directories or files can't be found, etc.
I can't access the directory the script is in, nor the missing directories, yet when I open a case, I receive a reply that Bluehost doesn't manage VPS servers almost instantly. If I can't manage it, and they won't manage it, then I guess it's just an unmanaged service. For the price I'm paying -- about $600 a year -- this seems more than a little insane.
Further, their support personnel hang up on you if they're done -- the line just goes dead, or the chat ends, even if you're in the middle of saying or typing something -- and they feel free to insult their customers. "Maybe you're just not smart enough to handle this sort of hosting solution," to quote one of their customer support folks directly. This is a horrible hosting company that charges you way more than their services are worth. Avoid.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
BlueHost sucks! Here's why. September 27th, 2015 I register a domain with Bluehost, 
September 28 and 29th, I start working on my new site using one of the default Wordpress templates that are already installed.
Sept 30th, 2015 I purchase, upload and activate a premium Wordpress theme onto my Bluehost server. Start working with the new theme. October 1st, early a.m.
I get on Bluehost wanting to work on my site and I get a message that my domain has been deactivated. I call the number provided, get someone on the phone, but she can't help because I'm in Germany and the department I need is not open at present. I'm already not impressed since I don't know why my domain would be deactivated.
October 1st, late in the day Germany time I get the department that is going to help me. A nice young woman tells me that for security reason they need to have me verify the account. She says she'll send me an email to reactivate my domain.
She says it should be reactivated within an hour of me verifying my account. Then I get this email:
"Thank you for attempting to reactivate and verify your account. To complete the verification process you will need to send in an image of the Front and the Back of the credit card charged for the hosting account.
Please Block out/cover the First 12 numbers on the front and the CVV2 code on the back. The name, expiration date and last four numbers need to be visible. Also, the credit card holder's ID (up-to-date/non-expired drivers license or passport).
You can block out sensitive information on the ID, we Need to see the Name and the Expiration date. You can send this information to [email protected]"
Get Real! Like I'm going to bother doing all of that to verify my account.
Forget it! I have accounts with NameCheap, HostGator and GoDaddy and never been asked to jump through so many hoops to verify and account. Total B.S.
So, I call Bluehost back, cancel my account, and will transfer the domain name over to GoDaddy after 60 days. This was my first experience with Bluehost. I followed a recommendation of a blogger.
It's also my last experience with Bluehost. When any company makes registering and verifying so complicated, especially in this day and age, they do not get my business.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: I like the control panel of bluehost, which is extremely good but the cost of bluehost is slightly more as compared to HostGator. The control panel of bluehost of is very easy to understand and access. Apart of control panel the support is extremely brilliant. All I want to say if you are thinking and first timer then must try bluehost hosting.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: I was with Bluehost shared hosting for years until they started outbound filtering of email which causes the mail forwarding set in cpanel to break. The effect of the change was that you would get some mail forwarded, but other mail would drop and you would never know. I had to move my hosting to another company since not receiving some emails is not something I could tolerate.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been a BlueHost client for more than 3 years. Service is ok but as usual sometime servers fail and maintenance just say you have to wait until it gets back to work. The point is that they have been charging me for a service that Does not work: Backup pro.
I found this painfull dicovery this week while trying to restore my databases and after several failures the assistance service just "confessed" that it does not work and it has been dismissed while the billing has not! It's not about the money, it's about something that looks more like a scam because backup is a major issue and now I have to go through a manual procedure that will take so much time than expected that will cost our company a lot!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I signed up with BlueHost because I needed a VPS for my existing site. I'm still learning and have never migrated a site before. I called prior to signing up and spoke to sales before hand and they told me that it would be no problem and that it would take me about five minutes to move my site to them.
After I signed up for a year's worth of hosting, I called back and spoke to technical support. I was told that they would not do it for me (which was fine), nor would they walk me through it (which was not what I expected). The rep said that it was a piece of cake and sent me instructions for a manual migration and away I went.
Unfortunately, these instructions were missing some pretty important steps that a newer person would have no way of knowing and were nearly impossible to follow. I know my ftp from my php, but I'm still a bit of a newbie and it was way over my head. Over the course of the day, I called customer service two times and got on their chat four times.
Twice I waited for over 15 minutes for a rep before giving up. Their chat service was incredibly slow. Each rep is helping multiple people and would go five minutes between responses to me.
This would turn a simple two easy question call into twenty minutes by the time I got someone and they got around to answering me. More than one person left me to figure it out on my own. It was an incredibly frustrating day and by the end, I just pointed everything back to my prior host and cancelled my service with BlueHost.
It was really obvious that Blue Host doesn't give two cents to keeping paying customers. If you really know your stuff and you don't need help from customer service, then BlueHost might be a great choice for you. However, if you're a bit newer and want to be able to rely on helpful answers from a helpful staff, don't waste your time.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I went with Bluehost because their online reputation seems stellar. But that was far from the reality. When I would call in I got a Huge variance of knowledge...
some of their team were exceptional,  but many others were clueless. It once took me 7 calls (average of 40 mins each) to finally find one guy that knew what he was talking about to implement a 5 minute fix. They won't support WHM questions or sub cPanel questions.
I kept hearing "we don't support that" over and over again. I suggest you avoid them.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I was a 4 year old GoDaddy client and decided to give BlueHost a try after experiencing frustration with GoDaddy. In the first week, a maintenance put our new account (and all of our tests sites) down. We only had a few WIP there as we were just testing.
We finally decided to transfer some sites and when it was time to take one of our largest client online, we had trouble with the domain. After multiple calls, an unanswered ticket and trying for 9 days (often with tech support on the phone), a technician finally resolved the issue by telling me that the ISPs in Quebec were probably not compatible with BlueHost.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I had bad experiences in the past with other hosting providers, so I was worried when I had to search another hosting provider for my website. I opted for Bluehost and I have to admit that after nearly 6 months, I’m satisfied for their service. Their shared plans have a good price/quality ratio and their support is always helpful, even if sometimes they are not so expert as one would hope.
Their cpanel is very easy to use for a person that is new to hosting and it is really an hosting provider you should chose for your website. Don’t go for cheaper hosting providers, you will end up with more troubles. When you buy a shared hosting plan you also get a free domain! So as you can see my overall experience with Bluehost is positive: of course they have still a lot of things that can be improved, but for the price paid their hosting services are great!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
We have used Bluehost for approximately one year and found them to be deplorable. We built 8 Word Press web sites set up for e-commerce on a VPS with 6gb RAM, 6 CPUs and a 60 Gb hd. Our websites are integrated with 163 twitter accounts, eBay and Amazon.
On Cyber Monday, Dec 1st, 2014, Bluehost crashed and literally rendered all our websites useless and a whole years worth of work for the Holiday shopping season was lost. Today is Dec 6th, 2014 and BlueHost is still down. They have offered no explanation except to say they are working on it.
Our losses so far this holiday season are in the tens of thousands. I would only recommend BlueHost to my competition. We can't even get at our data thru ftp to transfer to another host provider.
We have 263 emails addresses that are completely useless. Our staff cannot communicate to any of our established routines due to the Bluehost inability to provide a stable environment. BTW, iPage is a sister company to Bluehost sharing the same hardware. Beware !

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
The very first time I wanted to host my client's web content, I was very green in the web hosting business. Of course I had always hosted via third parties. It was my first time now.
I was spoilt for choice. I looked at a very long list of probable hosting providers, their prices, their offerings, the rebates, the discounts, the uptime guarantee and of course, availability (Support). Being in Africa (Kenya) made it even more difficult as we mostly use preloaded debit cards.
The fact that I chose BlueHost tells it all. My pre loaded debit card is accepted for payments at my preferred hosting provider. I have never been let down by BlueHost. I would endorse any company or individual that wants to host with them.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
The host is so freaking awesome, their support answer within 1 hour, They give away Free Domian name and gurantee 99,9 % uptime. They allows you to host anything like MyBB Forums Worpress and a lot of others. I Have hosted my site there over 2 years now soon 3, and never had a issue with them.
I highly recommend them to all webmasters out there
And the offer you
Free .com .org .net and more domians
Unlimited Discspace. Unlimited Bandwith
Unlimited Domians name
Unlimited Databases
on all their plans  starting on 4.95/month very cheap!!!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Perfect hosting company, I am using their hosting services since 2 years and still I never get any headache. Their support team is brilliant. At least I am not going to leave BlueHost at any cost.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: I have been using BlueHost for several years. Until the last 6 months, uptime was excellent. Now the site is down daily and the daily reply to notification is "server down, no eta".

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Since being purchased by EIG, Bluehost's uptime performance has not been very good. Two major downtimes of 24hrs or more, plus several smaller issues. Our email was completely down for two days and did not fully catch up for two weeks. My company and many of our clients have been with Bluehost for 10 years, but we will now be switching.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Shocking down times, shocking customer service, shocking services. Wordpress should stop promoting this brand as it has made me change both.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Our website has pages indexed on Google with its temporary URL - IP/~user/ The support team assured me prior to the migration that no temporary URLs would be indexed in Google unless there are actually links with that temporary URL. That being said, after my site migration my blog and forums were not working correctly for a couple of days. The support said this was because the DNS was not fully migrated yet.
Anyway, I had a feeling that this had nothing to do with the DNS, so I started digging in the settings of my forum and blog. I was shocked to find out that my settings both for the forum and blog were modified from $settings['homeurl'] = "http://www.mysite.cm/forums"; to $settings['homeurl'] = "http://IP/~user". I contacted the support and all they said was "We do not have any control of what goes into the search engine.
The person should never have assured you that it would or would not show up there. Now the search engine does update itself and that url will eventually disappear. If you want to get if off as soon as possible you will need to contact google about this." 
I was informed that no site and code changes would be done during the migration, and they even don't seem to admit it is their fault.
Because of that error my blog and forum pages got indexed and this exposed my site to duplicate content issues. I'm disappointed with BlueHost and I know this is not my last destination when it comes to hosting. Also, in the past I had changed my host 3 times.
All my previous hosting providers had handled my cPanel migration free or charge and without any issues. BlueHost migration was costly and unprofessional $99 and with many issues. There are more examples that show what a bad customer service they have.
For example, before the migration I asked if my Awstats can be moved too. I told them if they can't move my Awstats I will not sign up with BlueHost. So they assured me they will move it.
After the migration I was informed my site is moved. When I asked them if Awstats was also moved the person told me no. I was very upset and eailed them back.
Then another support person replied and apologized on behalf of the other guy who was not trained yet. I can give more and more examples like that. So far I'm not with the impression that these guys know their stuff. This is the worst customer service ever!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: around 5-6 months ago I was searching for a reliable host but I was not able to find 1 then my friend told me to try bluehost then I did I was shocked when reading bluehost features....once I was having a technical prob but their staff helped me instantly and my problem was resolved....bluehost is the most reliable host(for me)and I have told my friends about this awesome host......

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I resigned from Bluehost within 30 days and was expecting full refund, as they promise this on their site. It turns out that they refund one service (SiteLock) only when you resign within 5 days. Disappointed.
Well, I get they may be lose too many clients and found way to earn at least a bit from them....... When you resign after 30 days, they refund only a proportionate amount, and Only for the hosting. Any other features, i.e.
SiteBackup is not refundable at all. Personally I move to hosting where they give an easy and professional drag-and-drop page creator.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've been a Bluehost subscriber for several years. They've generally been a very good host. Recently, however, they have been experiencing significant down times.
My website and emails are up and down unpredictably. When I call tech support, they never know what's going on, and can't give me an accurate answer about when the problem(s) will be fixed. Earlier today, during my fourth call in 24 hours, they told me that a server part on the main power drive had been replaced, and that everything was fully functional. "This is the type of problem that only occurs once every 100 years.
Don't worry. You are good to go," the technician said. Surprise.
Two hours later, the system has crashed again. I have no email, and no website. My business is paralyzed.
On a whim, I contacted them as if I was a new customer and asked for their uptime statistic for the past six months. I was told that they don't have such a figure available. Gee, I wonder why not?! Buyer beware.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been working with BlueHost for a little bit over a month now, and I have been pleased with the service. Uptime is very good. It is the ideal web hosting for WordPress like me.
They offer cheap web hosting and free domain names with packages. However, the customer service is not very helpful. I had an inquiry about my account and they were very slow, not offering any kind of useful assistance, only providing me with information that I already had. I would probably refer my friends to BlueHost because of its value and quality, not the customer service.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I've been with bluehost for over five years. When this year ends I'll be moving all three of my accounts to someone else. The problem?
Support. The support is some of the worst I've ever experienced. After Simple Scripts became Mojo I was no longer able to install or delete site applications like Wordpress or Concrete5.
I literally cannot get bluehost to even address the problem, let alone attempt to solve it. I've submitted tickets, emailed them, tried live chat, etc. I still cannot install or uninstall applications like Drupal.
Also, know that the supposed yearly price (usually quoted as something like under $5 a month) will jump to about $10 a month after your first year. This would be acceptable if they provided service. Finally, there are times my very simple site will hang for 20 seconds or more the first time a user hits it. 20 seconds is way to long for a site that has no fancy stuff and is 90% text.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Bluehost is hands down the best professional web hosting. It's very cheap compared to it's features. it's got one click wordpress install and great uptime and features. Offers free domains and unlimited bandwidth!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Technically NOT savy... and they Nickel and dime you even when they admit the mistake was theirs. It was shocking that they didn't realize my account would be down for hours when they suggested that I hit the button to upgrade from a standard account to a PRO account.
Lost a lot of money that day. They said, "whoops," and offered a $20 credit, and said I'd need to downgrade to the Standard package to get the rest of my PRO money back ($220). I offered them reasonable solutions to keep my business (1 year free PRO, or just charge me for Standard).
They weren't interested. Frustrating to the point of making me move away for reasons of principle along.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have 3 sites hosted on bluehost at the moment. First I like to share that it is fully featured, you have every tool you need, and everything is easy to locate and use. I would also like to let you know that their support has been great.
Maybe sometimes I was connected to a person that didn't know what I exactly needed, but then again other members of support have not only guided me but work on a problem that was not simple at all and fix it. Up till now the best experience I had with any support team, was with BlueHost support, and I have contacted them more than a few times.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
>> What do you wish you'd known before becoming a customer? Looking back, there is nothing I wish I would have known before signing up with BlueHost. Since that time, however, I have discovered things about other hosts that would have reinforced my Bluehost choice at that time.
>> How have they handled your support queries?
With only two rare exceptions such as when a Support Tech who did not have an answer tried to blow me off by blaming a WordPress plugin for a problem that same plugin had first reported, the BlueHost Support Techs have always handled my queries as if I was a valued-and-respected customer.
>> What level of technical expertise do their customers need? I began with none at all, and I have often thanked the BlueHost Support Techs for their "WebSite 101" training for me!
>> How have BlueHost handled any problems? Promptly, efficiently and completely.
>> What kind of customer is this host suitable for?
One who needs occasional support at a server rather than expecting someone else to understand and to know how to resolve anything and everything beyond actual server function. For example: Some BlueHost Support Techs both can and will try to answers my occasional WordPress questions, but I always remember none of them are actually expected or required to do so.
>> Would you recommend BlueHost to friends? Most certainly!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost customer service is beyond bad. I was assigned a welcome account manager when I joined and I asked her some questions about transferring another site I own. Two weeks later I still didn't have a response.
I submitted a ticket and a really rude jerk writes back  talking down to me. He had not even taken the time to read my question. So I called them and another rep who answers makes me repeat the full story and actually tells me that the various departments don't communicate.
I have canceled my account. I would rather pay a little more for a better provider.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
When I originally joined bluehost, I did so because my last hosting provider was beyond horrible. Their plan at the time seemed reasonably priced, but I quickly learned that I was paying too much in many ways...
1. Around the time that I got my account, their servers were hacked where my site automatically rerouted somewhere else.
When I complained to them about this, the first denied any responsibility (it's Your server guys, it is Your responsibility to protect it). After fighting with them for a while, they told me the only way I could protect it was to get a dedicated IP address from them. This took my initial "relatively inexpensive" rate and pushed them into a much higher price bracket that I didn't expect.
2.
When I signed up, I was told that they would back up my account - when their server crashed, I asked them to restore my system and they refused to do so. At that point I started making weekly backups of my files when they started to threaten me that they would terminate my account if I continued to do so. If these clowns would have done their jobs, I would not have had to do that.
3.
In general, their online and phone support is beyond abysmal. Every time I contact them, I get some snarky jerk who acts like my questions are beneath him and tells me that he can't help me. It's Your server people and you don't even give full shell access so how do I fix my own problems?
Most recently I needed to install Mediawiki for my team and it didn't work. When I sent their support an e-Mail to help me solve it, they ignored me. I wrote back three times at which time they told me to simply reinstall PHP.
That did NOT solve the problem. I am still waiting for them to solve it now. Since I am extremely busy, I have avoided moving to another provider, but due to their continued rudeness and ineptness, I am going to drop them, tell my friends to drop them too (and believe me I have a lot) and hope they go out of business like they should.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
From my point of view every web hosting service offers great service. But bluehost makes the difference for me because not only it's free of ads and annoying pop ups its fast and convenient. It gives you awesome offers and the payments methods are smooth and easy.
I personally guarantee that with bluehost no one will be disappointed. Its epic I voucha as a customer

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have been running content sites since 2008 - over 5 years since. I have two bluehost accounts and one HostGator account. based on the last vigorous updates on google ranking algo.
am giving up content sites for SEO and moving to listbuilding. as a result i want to be left with one hosting account and retire the other 2. Question: Do I retain one bluehost account?
or do i retain the hostgator account and close the 2 bluehost accounts. I've already decided what which one I'll retain and I'd like to offer my experience with both companies. so you can use to decide.
incase you are comparing the two. Robustness & Reliability:
When bluehost goes down - it can do so for 15 minutes to two hours. This can suck if you are in the middle of a launch or a serious paid campaign.
This has happened severally for the last 5 years. incidentally one account can be down and the other is not. so it depends with the neighborhood you are set in.
Hostgator. I can't say it doesn't go down. but atleast I've never noticed.
I've been with them for the last 2 years. Technical support
with bluehost It's hard to find one support agent offering a comprehensive solution. with their live support you can be transferred multiple times across departments.
and each agent doesnot read previous input in the chat. they ask how can i help. so you start the story all over again.
Bluehost live chat takes a long time before an agent attends you. on 26th dec 2012 i waited nearly 27 minutes before i could get an agent to attend to me. who later told me that he can't help because the issue relates to billing and the dept.
will open in 4 hours time . which i find ridiculous for a company with international customers plus all the time difference e.t.c. Hostgator - the technical team know their stuff.
plus they are willing to even login and adjust some settings for you at no extra cost. compared to bluehost they tell you to hire a webmaster or follow the neatly designed tutorials and do it yourself. Email limit - i had a socialbookmarking plugin that was sending emails to ping.fm for distribution.
i used the plugin at bluehost and at hostgator on various websites; the plugin exceeded the set email limit per hour per account. bluehost responds by suspending my entire account. over 35 websites down .
hostgator responds by disabling cronjobs and informing me via email. the rest of the sites were still up and running.. (on this issue alone hostgator are more human/ understanding, bluehost i find them punitive implementing every letter on their TOS without warning / delay)
Billing:
if your account expires at midnight . it gets suspended same minute at bluehost.
with hostgator they allow upto 10 working days to sort your billing and just so you know during this period your services are up and running. with bluehost if you don't sort your billing your account is deleted Permanently after 10 business days. I had an incident where my credit card expired and the band delayed to renew it on time.
but i had tons of cash on paypal. but as you know you cant make a pre-approved payment with paypal even if you have a paypal balance. if your credit card is about to expire.
the only solution is to make a direct paypal transfer. so this happened to me when one of my bluehost account was about to expire. i requested that i send them paypal deposit to offset the renewal period.
they returned the money and said their system only works with paypal preapproved payments. so services will remain offline until i can sort the issue with getting a new creditcard. Those are the main issues i can recall.
my conclusion is. am staying with hostgator and i'll let the bluehost accounts expire naturally.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Blue host offers private servers and other great features.It is affordable and reliable.It offers many scripts like phbb,wordpress etc.Is consists of live chat and it offers support like 24/7(which is true)
Their services are awesome unlike many other hosting sites. Blue host is suitable for any kind of site(forums,merchandise,what not).In simple words---it is awesome.I left my other hosting service after looking at it.I would recommend blue host.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
BlueHost is absolutely one of my favorite hosting providers. I was looking for a suitable, affordable web hosting service for my Wordpress blog. Through Wordpress, I actually found  BlueHost and got a discount.
Their affordable solutions and great 'extras' (such as email accounts, free domain, $100 Google advertisement credit, unlimited space, etc.). Using BlueHost is extremely easy. Even if you are not especially tech savvy, you will be able to format a beautiful website.
You have control over everything with BlueHost. I am very happy to have been introduced to BlueHost. I have not had any problems in all of my time with my site.
Thanks to BlueHost's affordable and easy options, I now have a fast, efficient website that is now receiving more viewers than ever before. It is also always nicer and more professional to have a regular .com site than a .WordPress.com one. As I mentioned before, I have not had any problems, so I have not yet had to contact customer support service. (If I did, I'm sure that it would be great!) BlueHost is suitable for everyone, whether you are hosting a basic blog to a full blown ecommerce site.
I would definitely recommend BlueHost to anyone who is interested in web hosting, whether they are newcomers to the whole web design industry or professionals in the field. Many of my friends are already using BlueHost to power their sites because I told them just how awesome it really is. I am now currently using a WordPress hosted .wordpress.com blog site, because I am searching to find other web hosting services, & because I like to try new things.
But overall... BlueHost is Amazing!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have had my websites hacked multiple times while having them hosted on bluehost. They attack the .php files. As soon as I switched them over to somewhere else,  I stopped having problems.
I'd love to believe that it's something to do with my website or Wordpress but the fact that the only change I made was to switch the hosting company leads me to believe that the security holes are on BlueHost. I've had to spend a lot of money getting rid of the code and I'm moving all my sites away from here as a result. Other than that the customer service was fine.
They weren't able to provide me with any resolution or any type of concrete steps to take to fix the malicious code problem. That's the sad truth.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Pros: BlueHost Provides sufficient features, freebies and has exceeded their guaranteed uptime. Cons: Their support isn't the best, but who's is. I'm not sure whether it's outsourced or not, but either way i recommend using their email system, because you get much more prompt & helpful responses.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Hi, One of my reseller account with Bluehost is hacked ( as bluehost guys said). All the files in the server deleted. 30 websites and emails destroyed. Bluehost guys said it is not their responsibility to restore the accounts.
Some support guys said they are working on it. After 48 hours I took a new reseller account from another hosting and uploaded all the backups with me. All emails recreated again.
It was a nightmare. They never help you in restoring the backup even if we are ready to pay for it.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Never BlueHost again. Support is worst. in 4 years 3 termination of the hosting service mainly on weekends or public holidays without informing and for no reason and nothing, after a call it came up without a problem.
I cannot recommend this company anymore. There are much other hosters which are more customer friendly.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I too decided to give Bluehost a try upon reading such great reviews. I'm sure my experience may be different than others,  but my website has  been slow to access,  and sometimes just down. Server status is updated often but after a while it gets tiring to see "Our technician is working on it"  I've had the service for 2 months now and the normal routine seems to be slow or down.
I have opened tickets and get generic responses.."we usually know before you do," blah blah blah but the site is still down. Perhaps I was unlucky to get one of the problematic databases,  but I still paid for a year of this. Next year I will try a different company. I'm so glad this website is just personal and isn't a place where I earn an income.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Hosting is not suitable for any serious project. Database size is hidden limited to 200 MB (greater than 1 GB database restarts every hour, and after a 1.5 GB suddenly begins to disappear.) Number of files in account is hidden limited to 50 000, so you can't store database in files. It happens that the server does not respond to pings for an hour. I am extremely unsatisfied with the hosting and regret that I bought it for 2 years.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I have used Bluehost for 2 years by now and I have hosted 15 domains on my host. This host has cpanel with some cool features like automate backups and installing wordpress and joomla automatically : they even update your CMS with the latest stable version automatically. So if you want to setup a wordpress blog with no technical knowledge this host suites your needs.
By now I have almost 3gig files on my host and all things seems well. In my 2 years experience I had 3 times host down experience but it was up after about 30 minute (Once they noticed me by email about it). I think their unlimited storage and bandwidth is a real one.
But actually I think my host speed is low, as I asked some of my friends to test some of my scripts in their hosts. As I am a programmer and familiar with cpanel I had not any special problem with my host, also they have good "Help Center" with video tutorials for most features. They also have famous encryption services that you can install in your host automatically. I have recommended 2 of my friends to use Blue host and In fact I think they offer very affordable service.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost was recommended to me so I went to the site, I filled up my "cart" with what I wanted, and because it didn't have a final summary page, I accidentally signed up. No biggie,  I figured I'd call them right up and cancel. They convinced me to keep it for up to 30 days and get a full refund if I still wanted to cancel.
So I tried it out,  I never actually published anything as I was experimenting with the development tools  (the website still existed elsewhere). So I ended up cancelling well within the 30 days to ensure it wouldn't go too late. It was a decent product but I wasn't ready to make the complete switch.
I was planning on going back to them when I would be ready though. A month or two later,  I realized I hadn't been refunded the money,  so I called them up. As it turns out,  the account hadn't been cancelled either.
Apparently,  even if you call them up,  they still send you an email that Requires A Response before they cancel the account. Because the email looked more like a confirmation email,  I didn't think I had to respond to it and thus they didn't do anything. So when I called them up,  they said they had no way of knowing that I didn't publish my site and refused to give me the full refund that was originally promised.
They have lost me as a customer as a result. I will not deal with a business that assumes the customer is lying. I would have rated them as 1's but I really have no idea how they rate on the other things like uptime, etc.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I picked BlueHost as our hosting solution after reading about their positive reviews. This has been a nightmare. In less than 48 hours since I bought the domain, the site has been offline multiple times.
The first time it went offline, I got an email from the verification department that the site was deactivated because they didn't have my full name on the account. So I instantly sent them all the documents they requested (government ID, CC) but their customer service couldn't be any worse. They couldn't even tell me if they had received the email or not, even after 30 minutes of sending the said email.
They hung up on me few times citing some glitch and told me that I'm not the only one sending emails. I couldn't get one straight answer from any of the reps at their verification department. Ultimately I got hold of their technical support team, who were polite and reasonable enough to understand customer urgency and resolved the issue immediately.
My take: Bluehost were probably once a company known for their service. But now they have expanded too much to care for individual customers. Stay away if you can.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
BlueHost Rocks! We were having trouble getting onto the Weebly site via BlueHost. It was very frustrating.
I emailed BlueHost and let them know about the problem. They responded in about 15 minutes. They recommended that I use either Foxfire or Google Chrome instead of Explorer.
I made the switch to Google Chrome and it worked. YAY!!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
1) There was an on-line work order system -
2) There was an immediate response to my work order
3)  The response fixed my problem
What more can you ask?

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Nice Youtube videos on Wordpress
responsive email support
(chat support doesn't work, though)
site easy to set up and manage

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
BlueHost is great because the customer support is great, its affordable, the up time is great, and over all is reasonably fast for what your paying for. Bluehost isn't so great if you need to do a lot of querying and processing. While I will grant that most of the time everything I do has decent load times, but every now and then it will spike (Probably because my server is being shared with other users.) which ultimately results in a long load time every now and then.
It happens enough to make me consider switching hosts. Overall they are an amazing choice for smaller websites.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
I was registered with them for 24 hours where I got No service, No support, their LiveChat was always down and the communication with the support/ sales/ account verification was terrible... I could not transfer my domain since such an important department does not work 24/7... Their verification process is one you have never seen on a shared hosting service...there are other ways to do that...they, ask you to scan your credit card both sides and send it to them....so much trouble for a domain transfer when there is a key!!!!!
go figure... The price they advertise on their home page is false since it is only valid for a 36 month registration.... I advise they take some classes for support, management and honesty!!!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: Bluehost has regular downtime with no explanations, apologise or reasons. Their customer service is severely lacking. The live help has you in a queque which never goes anywhere. They might be cheap, but they are definitely not worth the hassle if you want a reputable site and need it to be live.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Saved the day. Now after two bad experiences with hosting providers I have a company that not only gets hosting but Fully understands customer needs! They have a superb hybrid process that includes not only Internet Business but phone service and communications the way it should be handled.
I can only thank you BlueHost for saving me from the depths of destruction with other providers. I should have listened to my CTO and moved all of our work over six months ago......I've learned and I'm thankful for your support, people and services!

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
here is a little story (true one) We were getting hosting from a local hosting company. Our website was down. We were in emergency situation since I lost my all email of for 2 days with previous hosting provider.
We three people at company started searching our new hosting provider. I read many reviews and ranking of JustHost. Surprisingly We all three people came to same conclusion.
This is amazing we are practically using it. In emergency it really saved us we quickly had website easy it is easy and fast now our website opens quickly as we have done many tests. I recommend justhost to everyone.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: BlueHost staff are great because they handle the problems efficiently, kindly and promptly. And that's the reason I chose them as my favorite host provider.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Switched from Yahoo hosting to Bluehost years ago as my hosting needs became more demanding. Was and still is the best or among the best in terms of price per month and the number of features you get for the price. I now have 3 separate accounts, hosting over 15 sites and am very happy.
Have only ever had to call customer support once and it was handled more than satisfactorily. Anyone who is brand new to hosting may require a bit of guidance when starting out with thier Bluehost account, but anyone with basic Cpanel experience up to professionals should be able to accomplish everything they need with Bluehost. Have and continue to reccomend this to friends.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text: BlueHost is great, great in value, great in services, great in support.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
BlueHost is a great quality site hosting, with a great value low rate for low-income person with great services and support. BlueHost support usually you do not have to wait more than 10 minutes, the smartphone longest wait time I've done. The way they handle problems and solutions is very professional,
I highly recommend it

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Out of all the hosting providers I have used, Bluehost has actually been one of my favorites despite the many negative reviews I've read to the contrary. Whether I am 'lucky' or not, I'll say a few things about their service that may be helpful to those hosting with them. First, they are really accommodating with multiple add-on domain issues and cron problems, also issues with mod-security on linux apache installs.
They were helpful when I was first playing around and learning about how to set up add-on domains. Clearly when you have a lot of wordpress installs on the same shared hosting, it eats up your 'inode' limits that the host sets for your account (inodes being not the size of your files, but a system that the hosting company uses to basically limit your file usage ... by counting how many bits of 'data' you end up using).
So in my case I was playing around with various configurations like php.ini files and htaccess. Since I was still learning basic site administration, I was really learning through trial and error. Whenever I've run into issues and get stuck (lol always backup your data!), I usually get a quick response from them and they'll confirm with me if an issue was on their end or mine.
Also if I was able to change something vs. not change something on my shared hosting server. Basically if a newbie or intermediate site admin is looking for a reliable place to administer their own Html or wordpress sites, Bluehost definitely has great value in my experience and even now they continue to do so.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
OK...so we decided to set up a reseller account with Bluehost, in order to be able to sell Wordpress to our clients, based on Bluehost's promises of 99.9% uptime. That was Wednesday of last week. Today is Monday.
I'm now shutting down the account because it was down 6 times in the last 72 hours, including a 30-minute outage at 10 AM today. I gave Bluehost 2 stars in support because they are US-based, and seemed to be trying to be honest in telling me that my experience was unfortunate and unacceptable, but nevertheless couldn't really help. Quoting now in response to my ticket: "We apologize for the issues that have occurred on the server recently.
We respond to server issues as they occur. However as we are a shared hosting environment with multiple accounts per server, it is impossible to provide a 100% uptime of our individual servers. Server spikes, poorly written code, malicious attacks and many, many other factors can affect performance on a server.
As services stop responding in a timely manner our admins investigate the server, to determine the cause, and when needed deactivate accounts that are abusing services, or causing them to fail. We apologize for the inconvenience this may have caused you, however the only real way to provide 100% uptime for any web server is to host a domain on a redundant array of servers. We do not provide this type of service, and most providers charge several hundred dollars a month for such services.
With the low prices we charge, we are not able to offer redundant  servers."
OK: so I understand now. Multiple outages are expected to occur as Bluehost isn't capable of operating on its shoestring budget to provide anything better. Why are you in business!??!?
Nice support guys though. Deeply apologetic. They deserve to work for a better company.

reviews.review_text: I had a good experience with Bluehost overall but ultimately was unhappy because they auto-renewed my hosting at a much higher rate than I originally paid.
