In terms of Help/Support, they really make you feel like you are the only one being dealt with, and it shows in the output as well, in my time with them, I think I have to contact them 4-6 times, and my query was answered/solved within minutes (Maximum time I experienced was 3 minutes)
In terms of value, the simple script installer comes with Loads of scripts (some free, some premium), and I dont think I will be able to even use 10% of them in my lifetime, from e-commerce, e-eduation, blogging, forums, you can find Anything there (constantly updated), Thanks for simple scripts (against Fantastico, as their scripts takes ages to upgrade).
recently they introduced a proprietry CPU Status, which to many is a pain in the neck, but to me, something really essential, as you'll know if your website scripts needs working, you can see your CPU log, as well, on other hand, its shared service, so someone else's script putting loading on CPU (without them knowing about it) wont kill Your Site's performance. concluding, if you are looking for decent host for small to medium hosting requirements in long run, Bluehost/hostmonster is the one to go for Period. once your requirement increases in terms of files, performance, you can always look for dedicated/Virtual options. in the end, things that I would like them to have, was options of Virtual or dedicated hostings, its a bit downside, all they do is shared hosting.

website_name: Who Is Hosting This small logo
reviews.review_text:
Bluehost is one of the most reliable and affordable solutions on the global market. Their features are suitable for both professionals and newbies. The Cpanel administration is running very effectively, almost any updates/requests/changes are applying immediately.
No need for waiting on cron jobs. Its almost like you have a VPS, but without the hassle of maintaining and updating the envoriment. The only bad thing about BH is the CPU throttling.
Its a holistic thing which only BH's engineers know deeply, and it is poorly documented and monitored. You have no control on you CPU usage, you can't manage your cycle times or limits. For an avarage user this means unbalanced response times and site load times.
After you run out of your CPU throttling limit, Your Site becomes slower and slower. And there's no upgrade option, only if you move to a VPS of an other provider. So in a few words: if you have a site with not too much traffic, this provider is highly recommended, but if you need real performance, you must move on to preferably some cloud based solution.

reviews.review_text: I was contacted by a Dr. Michael Brown of Gilbert, Arizona. He saw my profile on a friend's laptop. I was scammed in the past and knew by the irregular writing, poor grammar and questions I was being asked that this indeed was a scam.

reviews.review_text: Turns out the domain name that I paid Hostgator for was already registered with GoDaddy! When I contacted support they took an age and then told me:"What I will advise now to actually be able to edit the website is to contact the current registrar of the domain name(GoDaddy) and have the nameservers point to your hostgator nameservers, also you can migrate the domain name from godaddy to hostgator if you want to be everything in once place."I replied saying that it was their error and as such they should do this to rectify my situation. They replied:"Unfortunately that is out of our capabilities as we do not control the domain name and we can't really point the domain to our nameservers for domain names that is from a different registrar."So presumably they knew I would not be able to do this either. I have demanded a refund and will use someone else - I am absolutely disgusted by the level of service received & ABSOLUTELY WILL NOT USE NOR RECOMMEND hostgator

reviews.review_text:
Tried to set up a simple WordPress site via this Cloud package and in all honesty I’m surprised at how much hard work it was.
        All of the automated emails seem to be for the old system as they don’t tie up with what actual happens in the customer portal. It also didn’t link the fact that I’d registered a domain at the same time so there were other emails about that.
        It then turns out that you can’t change the URL in the WordPress settings so you are stuck with http:// version, no www. Not a major issue in many ways but not mentioned anywhere and a bit of an odd restriction.
        Talked to the support team, one of whom advised me to uninstall WordPress and start over, the other of whom said it was all the same and it didn’t matter and insisted on calling me “bud”.
        Can’t tell you what the actual hosting is like unfortunately because I gave up and moved elsewhere.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I bought a trial version of ExpressVPN (EVPN) a year ago before taking a job outside the US. During the short trial period EVPN seemed to be work fine. But once I got overseas, the proverbial crap hit the fan. When EVPN worked, my machines were very slow. And the connection would fail every few minutes. Even though I never connected the VPN kill-switch, when the VPN was down and struggling to connect, I couldnt connect to the Internet at all. It was so consistently bad that Internet use became unpredictable. I actually had to return to the US after only 6 months BECAUSE I couldnt do my work. Others who were using EVPN throughout the country were experiencing the same problem. 

Now Im back in the States and EVPN still throughout the day fails. Its typical for me to look at its icon in my system tray and see its NOT connected, obviating the very protection Im paying for. And its worse on my mobile phone. Its CONSTANTLY down. And when its active, my phone is so slow I cant load even just a webpage. 

Worst of all, the company doesnt care about these experiences. When you contact customer support, you get the same insipid trouble shooting instructions. If you try to tell them youve tried the steps before without any improvement, theyll tell you you havent. Then when you send them the files showing that youve already done what theyve instructed, the communication will go dead. 

And Ive tried EVERY server, but Netflix eventually denies them all despite EVPNs claim you can use them with Netflix. I have trouble using EVPN with other sites, too, like Craigslist. 

How does this company keep turning up as the #1 VPN provider? Either their competitors are even worse or EVPN pays review companies for biased assessments.

reviews.review_title: “Used up 1-100% of CPU (doing what?) in background”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
Service itself was as advertised, however:
I detected over 100% CPU usage (from overclocking) by programme "expressvpnd". Of course I made sure that I was disconnected and I tried rebooting. The very high usage of CPU persisted (it was intermittent, but remained), and at all times appeared in my top 10 programmes running. I uninstalled, and the problem went away. Today I tried reinstalling (with a new download of their website) to see if the problem was with the original install: The problem returned.

This is completely unacceptable, and highly suspicious. Want to protect your privacy? maybe first check that ExpressVPN isn't a form of spyware itself - or perhaps using customers' CPUs to mine cryptocurrencies. Who knows, but it's not worth the risk, the money, nor the massive cost on CPU.

I was using the linux 64 version, on Ubuntu 16.04, Dell Inspiron 15z 5579, i7-8550U.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I registered in Nov./17 for a monthly plan, $12.95 using Paypal, thinking I will try it, and if not satisfied, I will cancel before the 30 day free period ends.  I actually cancelled 4 DAYS later because speed was extremely slow when connected to ExpressVPN. I followed the instructions on their site exactly "How to Cancel Your ExpressVPN Subscription".  It tells you to select "Turn automatic renewal OFF and cancel my service on the expiration date" in your account settings. Also says "Your subscription will be canceled and you will not be billed at the end of your subscription cycle."  I immediately received an email from my Paypal saying "ExpressVPN has suspended your automatic payments!" *****And this is where the SCAM begins!*****
1 month later (or 34 days after I initially registered) I contacted ExpressVPN live chat to ask why they had not refunded my $12.95 back to my PayPal account?

Chat response: (taken from actual chat log)
Visitor: I paid $12.95 for 30 day trial...cancelled before the 30 day end but...didn't receive my refund?? 
Gene: We have not received any request from you to cancel the subscription and receive a refund. No records on your account is saying that you requested a refund or a cancel.
Visitor: the date I cancelled was Nov 29th 
Visitor: 4 DAYS AFTER INITIAL REGISTRATION

I decided to forward to them the email I received from my PayPal stating that "ExpressVPN has suspended your automatic payments" so CLEARLY they were aware of my cancellation! Just not going to admit it!

Chat response:
Gene: I have the info on my end saying you cancelled the pre-approved payments. 
Visitor: I followed your instructions exactly on your wesite "how to cancel your subscription" 
Visitor: i signed into my expressvpn account... 
Visitor: located "automatic renewal section" 
Visitor: manage settings... 
Gene: Check the email you forwarded again. It says " ExpressVPN has suspended your automatic payments" 
Visitor: and as per your website instructions..."turn automatic renewal OFF and cancel my service " 
Gene: Meaning we did not revoked or cancelled the subscription but we turned off the automatic renewal only since you disabled your "Paypal's Pre-Approved Payments" 
Visitor: YES !!! AGAIN ...for the 5th time...why would express vpn suspend my subscription 4days after registering?? 
Visitor: why??? why??? why??? 
Visitor: if I didnt cancel??

He told me unfortunately I was beyond the 30 day money back guarantee, and added "You cancelled from your mode of payment but not with us." (even though I used their own website!)
Fortunately for me, $12.95 is a small amount of money BUT multiplied by thousands of other fish like myself who bit on their hook, can be a lot for them!

reviews.review_title: “If VPN's were turds, this would be the size of a dinosaur turd”

reviews.review_text: This supposed "unblockable" vpn is always blocked.  Don't let them fool you.  I've been in China for two years and this one is no better than the rest for getting past "The Great Firewall" of China.   Personally, I've had better luck with a free vpn that always (ALWAYS) works.  And when this one actually worked, it was no faster than any other vpn. These guys are only after your money.  Pure and simple.  And their customer support is non-existent once they have you signed up.  And never, repeat N-E-V-E-R sign up for a 30 day free trial for anything.  Especially these crooks.  Run fast.  Run far.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
i have had it up to my neck with these people, so to save myself time, here is the final email i wrote these people, and it isn't good. never buy expressvpn services, and certainly never use a union pay card if you are ever crazy enough to chance it.

so, its been a week and i have gotten no reply. just to review, i bought a month of your vpn service with a union pay card. i already had an account with you all, but you wouldnt let me change the card i had on file to union pay, so i had to open a whole new account with a new email. i went through the whole payment process only to find out after i paid that you did not have my email on file. i then spent hours talking to service reps online and waited two weeks for you all to figure out what the problem was. i sent you a bank statement proving i paid for service. i told you multiple times that the vpn worked on my phone and all i wanted was my activation code so i could use it on my lap top. well...enough is enough. i gave you a whole week to get back to me, and nothing. i guess either i or my money is meaningless to you. no one would have appreciated the run around i got, so true to my word i am writing a review of my experience this past month with you all, and it wont be good. i would demand my money back however you cant find the card i paid with, even after i showed you the statement! so now i have to go to union pay to stop all future auto debits. thank for the so-so service and the nightmareish fiasco you call customer service. 

benjamin mould

website_name: Forex Brokers
reviews.review_text: When you trade in Binance, it "rounds off" the amounts you can trade. The leftover fractions stay behind, and recovering this dust is almost impossible. One way to do it would be again to deposit the coin in question and to juggle the amount deposited and the price, taking the fee into account, so as to leave nothing, or next to nothing, after a new transaction. Using BNB will reduce your fees, but it will not take care of this problem. Those bits add up, especially if you want to experiment with the odd exotic coin. I've learned my lesson and I'm staying away.

Cons:  Honestly, nothing. There are cheaper options out there but I always seem to find a discount when it's time to renew. 

Overall:  Privacy, protection, and peace of mind. It's so easy to use and is almost a required but if software for anyone connected to the internet.

reviews.review_title: Great product, a little expensive but worth it
website_name: Capterra Logo
reviews.review_text:
Pros:  NordVPN does not collect logs or other user data, which is especially important in terms of keeping data safe. The connections are secure. They inform you how to connect (and they have a variety of connection options), so it is very user-friendly, even to those who may not have used a vpn in the past. There are tons of servers to connect to, and you have a lot of power in choosing what, where, and how you connect, which is a huge plus and not a feature on other VPNs.

Cons:  Obviously internet speed will slow, and some connections seem to be slower than others. This can be fixed by switching connections, but it would be nice if more had faster speeds. They do consistently add servers, however. It is costly, but in the world of VPNs you get what you pay for so it is worth it here. 

Overall:  A great VPN that can be used anywhere with public WIFI, and at home. The added security is definitely worth the price, as security is much needed in today's world.

reviews.review_title: As far as I am concerned, this is the best VPN software available.
website_name: Capterra Logo
reviews.review_text:

Military grade encryption, a slew of VPN options (Onion, Onion over VPN, etc), and an incredibly large number of servers! I am always able to quickly connect to a fast server whether it be on my phone, computer, raspberry pi, etc).

Cons:  If you don't run Nord VPN on startup, it can take a little bit longer than I would expect to load and connect to a server (only on PC) but really, that's just due to my personal preference on limiting startup applications to only the essentials.

website_name: Capterra Logo
reviews.review_text:
Pros:  NordVPN offers several features to give a good user experience. First off, they do not keep logs and do not collect user data. Which is often a primary usability constraint, combined with the secure connection. 
NordVPN offers a wide range of connectivity options. Through their own applications but also through the widely used openvpn protocol. And for all their connectivity options there are extensive walkthroughs available on how to set up the connection.

Cons:  The use of the VPN will induce a reduction in internet speed. Even though this is inevitable with the use of a VPN and the accompanying encryption. Sometimes switching to a different server will improve the internet speed.
Maybe a con could be that the help articles are only available in English.

Overall:  It provides a safe environment for all your activities over the internet, even at locations where you cannot completely trust the internet connection itself, no matter if it is on your laptop or your smartphone. This gives a safe feeling and relieves you from working.

website_name: Capterra Logo

reviews.review_title: Safety & Security using open wifi access points
website_name: Capterra Logo

Cons:  Connecting to the VPN does slow your internet access down, getting around 100 MBps at home, and 45MBps when running through US VPN. For me, the items that I would use the VPN for are not big data consumers, like Banking and some work related access. Don't really see a need to access out of the country currently, I have heard of some people being able to access different content on Netflix, but not something I do. When watching Netflix or Hulu I'm not connecting to the VPN

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
So I agree to a 3 month subscription for $59.95.  I get double billed on Pay Pal.  Now if it was a so-called 'pre-authorized' payment-you know the kind the hapless customer knows nothing about-then it should have been charged in three months rather than right away.  It also came through as a payment rather than pre-authorized payment.  So I ask Zoosk what is this about?  What is the second payment even for?  No reply.  There is literally no customer service there.  Moreover, there was no official email for the second $59 payment.  So what is it for?  It's like a ghost payment with real money.  Then they force members to pay for stuff such as unlocking matches.  So someone likes you on their silly carousel and you like them and you learn the information is locked.  You have to pay coins which conveniently you can buy.  Then you learn the woman has no interest in you whatsoever.  If you want to pay for lies & deception Zoosk is the place to be.  Only Badoo is skankier.

FOLLOW UP:  5 weeks later I finally receive a refund.  It was difficult to contact Zoosk and I think it's set up that way intentionally.  For the second time I asked them 'what is the second payment of $59 for?'  They had no real answer for this as it had never appeared on my Zoosk account nor did I receive an official email for the second bill.  So all they could say is some lame statement like it was my fault that I double clicked at Paypal which is crap.  If I was mistakenly double-billed would they not have noticed earlier than 5 weeks?  I had asked this same question much earlier but received no reply.

reviews.review_text: I did re-join Zoosk for 1 month to see if it continued with the same deception as I found in the past,... yes, it's just as bad now as it ever was. Deceptive views of my profile by women that I was interested in. Because I see that they look at my profile very often I can only think they have an interest and they express it by looking. And I would do the same. This time I had a membership that would allow them to reply to my messages for free(in case they did not have the ability to respond). You would think if someone views your profile a lot that if you wrote to them they would reply, well they did not or if they did it seemed to be a brief note like "I'm packing to go out of town "and I never hear from them again. Some I wrote a brief message to many times, and got nothing from them, although they continued to view my profile. I spoke with someone at Zoosk (possibly in India) and asked about these "views" and he said if someone happens to pass by my profile it counts as a view, something like that. That is so deceiving. I think these little liberal zoosk employees sit there misguiding you so you will spend money. Although it is some what addicting, I will never spend $ with this company again. I'll hang out in the grocery store. Haw!

reviews.review_text:
I was told that for my trip in China I need to use a VPN to access all the foreign websites for my project, I stayed in mainland China and found that ExpressVPN provided me access to all the foreign websites that are blocked in China. I used its Hong Kong, Japan, and Los Angeles servers for better connection speed and minimum ping time. I found a bit expensive but since no other less pricey VPN works in China so I had no option. Overall my experience is good with ExpressVPN. The core features which I gathered from the website of ExpressVPN are;

The Points I liked:
Unlimited Bandwidth with Ultra Speed
Endless Server Switches
99.99% Uptime
Provides all VPN protocols OpenVPN (TCP, UDP), L2TP-IPsec, SSTP, and PPTP
High-End Security with OpenVPN 256-bits
Zero log keeping policy of internet activities
136+ servers in 87+ countries
Amazing Referral Program which brings 30 days of free service on every sign-up
30-Days Money Back Guarantee
3 Simultaneous-login Option

The Point I dislike:
No Free Trial Offer
A little Pricey

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I currently have a year plan at expressvpn and I'll tell you a little about my experience with them.
I primarily went with expressvpn because it was on a very nice sale (33~ euros for a year) and it had OK reviews. The features that I wanted in a VPN service was: proper privacy, simultaneous use on multiple devices, nice Windows interface with low system resource usage, Android app, torrenting allowed and can't remember anything more.
What I like about expressvpn the most is that's it's pretty speedy and it has servers all around the world. The Windows client supports the usual VPN protocols including OpenVPN which is great.
What I dislike about expressvpn is that it loses connection fairly often and because the official Windows client doesn't have a kill-switch featurethis is a privacy risk. The Windows client does it's job well, but it does have some annoying bugs (easy fixable though). And most of the time my upload speed is extremely low while connected to a VPN server, I'm not sure what the problem is but I'm thinking that the built-in NAT firewall is causing this.
http://www.expressvpnreviewz.com/

website_name: HostAdvice
reviews.review_text:
I have a BS in Marketing, so I am only so smart. I rely on written direction to correctly accomplish a technical task. GoDaddy had none. Sure, there were lots of story on thigs you could use but no actual direct instructions. Othe...Read More                                    
                                r websites send you all info regarding FTP, username & password, nameserver etc. GoDaddy? Nothing. OK, I'm going to try and press through. I have websites at GoDaddy no problem. OK, I can attach the name, but no way to know their exact nameserver is for the site.
OK, now I have a front page on the reseller site. Can't change a thing. No FTP address to get new files up. This is a problem, right? So, I need to call support for this right? OK, listen to this.
GoDaddy has a support number on their website, a single number. Now when you call that number it may or not be the number you need to talk to. I called the number and they had to send me to the reseller support dept.. OK, that was fine the day before. Yesterday, I called the same number, somebody picked up the phone and hung up. OK, maybe I made a mistake I'll try again. I call the number again and a Chinese sounding guy picks up the phone and says wrongs number. OK I am a fast learner calling this number is not going to get me anywhere. So, I search and find an email address.
I email them and I write as precisely as I can, the problems and issues I have so that at least they would know what to address. I get an email back telling me I should call this number. No attempt to address the issues in the email. OK, this is the way it goes. So, I call the new number and it tells me the voice mail box has not been setup. WTF?
Like I said I am a fast learned and now me and GoDaddy and the Reseller BS are done. Finished. I feel like a dope because I am thinking they are all top notch.
Why this is important, #1 if you enter the URL I attached to the site you get a blank space. Now there is a website, it is up and running, so what's the URL to get to it? Don't ask me I have no idea and I own it.
I went through and jacked up the prices just for fun knowing most people not paying anything like that. Here is the thing, suppose some business buys up on a jacked-up price site and accessories, and then it craps out on them, and then they get support like I got. Who is going to get sued? Me, that's who, so I went back and globally reset all the prices, because I have zero control on anything dealing with that reseller site. I paid and have no idea how to administrate or operate it. I've already determined it is a loss, but I'm going to try and get refund, but I have no optimism on that.
So, if my story helps anybody contemplating being an entrepreneur with a GoDaddy reseller site, please, think twice. I wish I had known about this place before I signed up. I had no idea how decrepit this part of GoDaddy’s service was, or I would never have given them my money.
The domain I attacher to this site is my business brand and it isn't working so I do not know the url of the site. I have only seen it from inside the control panel.Less

reviews.review_title: Website Builder and Go Central - WORST for photo heavy websites!!!
website_name: HostAdvice
reviews.review_text:
I have always liked GoDaddy and have been a customer for many years. HOWEVER, their web building products, Website Builder and Go Central have the absolute WORST photo browsers/apps for maintaining photos on your site that could p...Read More                                    
                                ossibly exist. I have written them many times (never got an answer) and called their tech support many many times and my comments and suggestions seem to fall on deaf ears. If you have a site where you use very few photos and also change them infrequently, this might not be an issue. But if you DO like to have lots of images and switch them out frequently - STAY AWAY from these products!!!

After this last time of trying to take off 20 photos and switch to new ones and it taking me almost an hour to delete the old photos, I have really had ENOUGH. With sites like Facebook allowing you to quickly upload, delete, switch around, move photos into albums and find them quickly - including photos that are actually text (pdfs) and SEE what they say - I do not and will not ever understand a web building service that does not allow these basic functions!! NO albums, so if you have say, 100+ photos, it is impossible to organize them.

Not only that, but to find a photo that has been uploaded, say, to move it to another place on your site or delete it, scrolling down through the Photo Browser keeps popping the browser up to the top - MANY MANY times until you are finally able to scroll down far enough. Once you have scrolled down, then you can only access ONE photo. If you want another from the former photos, you can not choose more than one, so you have to repeat this whole scrolling thing, where the browser brings you back to the top many times, before you can finally access the photo that was maybe next to the one you just selected or moved. No batch selecting.

You also can not view the Browser photos in anything but a very small thumbnail. So if say, you have a number of pdfs with the same general format and that are in text, you are unable to differentiate one from the other. In my case, I have pedigrees of my cats that in thumbnail format all look the same. It is impossible to choose one, based on the text content. So I find myself uploading the same pdf images over and over again - simply because I can not SEE them, they are too small to read.

Then again, you are unable to keep any images in folders, such as certain products or categories (T-shirts, cotton shirts or whatever have you).

Working with images within the Website Builder or Go Central is practically impossible and VERY VERY frustrating!! Even more frustrating is GoDaddy's complete disregard for listening to customers on these issues - and these services are EXPENSIVE!!! I'm sure I am not the only customer who deals with a lot of images on their site!! And if computers themselves can offer easy ways to find files and images and social media like Facebook can offer easy ways to organize, upload and delete files and images - WHY NOT GODADDY??? But they seem to not care and not want to listen.

Well, they are going to lose a long time customer when my contracts are nearing their end this next time - I have three sites with them and I doubt I will renew..Less

                                eeded help about FTP server, etc. First thing he said was "did you buy a product without knowing how you use it?" and he didn't even ask my customer number/name. I tried to explain that I wanted to know, but he repeated saying "if you want to know about FTP, that's not our job". Finally I could know where I can find the site IP, he laughed! He said, "funny, your mistake was such a simple thing".Funny!?? As he was so rude, I asked his full name and to connect to his supervisor. But He said he doen't have them! I'll
call them tomorrow if I can make a claim about him. I hope they can fire this person.Less

website_name: HostAdvice
reviews.review_text:
We tried to build our own Word Press site through GoDaddy interface. Should be simple, we are bright educated people. Started calling with technical and web interface problems. They fix technical, although new problems cropped up....Read More                                    
                                 Always said regarding web, we don't know how to design on Word Press, not what we do. Keep trying to solve problem, call them to figure out work arounds, no help. Finally, fed up after friend who is computer programmer states he can only fix Word Press so far in code. Try another theme, still problems. Call billing for refund, but by now fell out of 30 days by 5 days. No refund from billing, so I asked to speak to Supervisor in Billing and I got Chris. Chris says no refund and starts asking me why I didn't do this, do that all these ideas of what I should have tried. Of course, technical support offered none of these ideas when I was within the 30 days and calling about the problems. Chris states while they do have situations where they give refunds outside of 30 days he will not give it here because that would be like trying to return a car because you don't know how to drive. So rude, condescending and unacceptable. I told him in good faith we had called and called and tech support offered nothing as to work arounds or even other ways to work that could have helped us. I stated again and again that the service did not work, the layout was faulty and it was not a straightforward user error in our case. After placing me on hold for 45 minutes because I felt they were being unfair as we were very close to the 30 days and they had a record that we had been calling in beforehand about the problem (he did check in a few times to see if I had anything new to add) he ended up hanging up on me. Still feel they should refund here even though I was hung up on.Less

website_name: HostAdvice
reviews.review_text: I've had a VPS with them for a while now, yet after the first few months things slowly went downhill. Their support is very limited and they've become less and less reliable. Not a good company to use a VPS with if you're a business owner.

website_name: HostAdvice
reviews.review_text:
I have been with Godaddy for last three years. First two years I hosted one website. They allocated 512MB RAM for that account which was somewhat OK for my mid traffic portfolio website. But developers cannot work on the staged su...Read More                                    
                                bdomain because sometimes the IO processes exceeds and the other time "the server closed the connection" error. I talked with their support team and they said to upgrade the resources level to get more power. I said, fine, let's see.

Now after two years I upgraded my hosting plan to delux and still get the same 512 RAM which is not even enough for 100 - 200 visitors per day. I kind of debated with them for what's the logic in up-gradation if I get the same resource level. But the executive (girl) was quite dumb and could not justify and ended up saying that they have the same resource level setup for all the plans. Frankly speaking they charge almost the same amount as the hosting fee (one year) for resource level up-gradation which is not logical and feasible. The only benefit they show case is the number of emails they provide with each plans. Not every body require 500 emails, I mean what am I supposed to do with 500 and 1000 emails if I do not get bandwidth / physical memory upgraded with the respective plans.

The most vague thing is they never talk about resources prior to sales. Huh! I will certainly move to other good hosts out there where I get value for money.Less

reviews.review_title: Stay away or kiss your $$ good-bye
website_name: HostAdvice
reviews.review_text:
There's nothing worse than a company that refuses to return your money when they can't deliver what they promise. It's bad enough that their assurance that a particular domain configuration was possible on their system turned out ...Read More                                    
                                to be untrue. It's bad, but hey, it happens sometimes.

But then to refuse to return the customer's money? No excuse. it left a large credit sitting in my account that I am supposed to use up somehow.

Worse than that, when I tried to transfer that customer credit to another account, they refused outright. The reason? Simple: "We can't." I see. And why is that? "Because we can't." Yes, I heard that the first time. What's the reason you can't? "We can't do that. I don't know how to say it any clearer, Sir. We just can't." Yes, I've heard you say that 3 times already, but I haven't yet heard a reason why. "There's no way to do that on our system."

Got it, folks? To steal a phrase from an old TV show, apparently when you try to do something at GoDaddy, Computer Say "No." You might as well kiss your money goodbye...Less

After only a few weeks, I found my perfect match and we couldn't be happier.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: This is how they trick you into sending them money. I thought I was pretty savvy about these things, but I fell for it so don't make the same mistake. It's listed on Google Play as a free app. It's not really free because the free version is actually useless. All you can do is send "likes". So, I saw someone who looked nice and I clicked the "like" button. Immediately I got a response back that said: "Thanks! I noticed that you noticed me :) Now lets talk." I got my hopes up thinking that I was actually communicating with a real person so I joined. No such luck, it wasn't sent by a human being, it was just an automated response that gets sent out every time you send a "like". I contacted Zoosk and they confirmed this. They took advantage of the fact that I wanted to meet someone, and swindled a few bucks out of me. Pretty low down. If they're willing to do that, it makes you wonder what else on the site is fake.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I have always had a bad and very difficult experience for all the three times that I have tried Zoosk. It has always been so difficult to unsubscribe when nearing the end of my chosen paid subscription. Zoosk deliberately prevents you from unsubscribing so you'll try to arrange for a refund but they first try to convince you to stay and their responses are never in a timely manner. My last very unfortunate experience was when I signed up through my Facebook account. I paid for a month but the now duplicate account was useless and won't let me receive or send messages and I tried to get a refund but the responses would always take a long time coming and so by the next monthly cycle, another $40 was withdrawn even after I had unsubscribed. Zoosk is Not user friendly and I agree with many reviews that Zoosk is a Scam proficient in only robbing people and hiking their subscriptions up to scheme more money from unsuspecting users. I should have listened to my mates and stayed away. Now I will also help spread the word to stay away from Zoosk.

reviews.review_title: “Many deceptive features used to keep people online.”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
These don't show up until you try to leave the site. I unsubscribed but they wouldn't take my profile down so I kept receiving messages from men who THOUGHT I was an active member. When I deleted my profile summary and wrote in that I was no longer active, the administrator denied the change!! They want paying members to think there's a larger pool than there is.
According to their site information, you can only hide your profile if you merely pause your profile but KEEP paying. Wow, what a scam. You can't respond to anyone to warm them unless you put a profile picture back up! Whaaaa....?
Amazingly unprincipled and a cynical exploitation of people looking to connect.
It does explain why there are so many single photo profiles though. They're trying to get off the site!
Yuk. I won't go back to Zoosk.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I had 4 charges made to my debit card totaling $175.00 from Zoosk/San Francisco. I had never heard of Zoosk. I get a text every time money comes out of my account. There were 2 texts back to back with charges from Zoosk, one for $99.95. I immediately called my bank. I was advised to "freeze" my card. Before i could do this 2 more charges had been made. My bank closed that account and issued me a new card. I looked up Zoosk to find out who the hell they were. Seems it's some online dating service in San Francisco. I spoke with them as soon as they opened. They tried to give me the run around making it seem like it was my fault someone had used my card information. When I asked about the account used to make charges with my card they wouldn't give me any information. They promised to block the card so it couldn't be used again. So now I have to wait 5-10 business days to have the money put back into my account. The reps at Zoosk said the email address used to create the account looked suspicious, but yet they charged my account anyway. I spoke with 3 different people and got 3 different stories. After reading reviews on several different sites it seems I'm not the only one this has happened to.

reviews.review_text:
From my perspective, Zoosk has a good number of people who are great people. Because of this, I had actually found someone, got married, and have a beautiful baby girl. We cannot be happier and I feel that after so many years, my life is complete. 

For those of you trying this site out, it took me a couple of years off and on again to find that special person for me. If you really want to think about it, the amount of money the average person spends on things without a second thought a month adds up to more than what you would spend on this site. So, you must ask yourself, is it worth it to find that one person you cannot live without for the rest of your life; a best friend, a support, a lover?

Plus, the experience is much cheaper than any other site. Just do not give up hope and try to be positive throughout your time on this site, or any other site, or even in real life meetings. After all, positivity is what attracts people the most. 

My one regret is not having access to my transcript of my original correspondence with my wife. That would be something to add to our collection of memories. I just wish someone from Zoosk could help me with that.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
Zoosk overall is a great website to find connections and potentially find someone for you... if you have the money for it. I found this website to be overall a tease that mostly said, "Here this person is perfect for you... but you need to subscribe to message him" or "This person messaged you. Subscribe to see what he said." And subscribing wouldn't be a problem if they didn't overcharge. Such a simple website shouldn't cost an automatic payment of over 70 dollars for 6 months of use. Not offering a monthly payment was also frustrating. 
The only people I could talk to on this "free" website happened to be premium members. Luckily, I found someone amazing out of all the premium members. We happened to connect offline and the relationship is going spectacular so far! 
This website has a lot of potential to be and offer a lot more than it does. My recommendation would be to have a literal "free" monthly subscription, and perhaps offer a monthly payment for the 6 month payment plan. It should also offer at least one day a week or month or a holiday special where you can actually view messages and connect with others for free. Perhaps a video chat feature could even be added. Above all, Zoosk is a safe and easy to use dating app. I hope that through out the years some lenience and more awesome features could be added to it.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I joined for 6 months around the end of July 2017.  I was flooded with views for the 1st 10 to 14 days. Almost 500 of them. If I deleted any, they came back. Funny how the views and the notifications are not in sync with each other. I also get notifications of views, but they disappear when I click on them, and a different view profile shows up.
Funny how there is no search function to view or contact a member by typing in a user name. That is a giveaway that the whole system is controlled. 
You want me to spend another $10/month so that NON PAYING MEMBERS can read my messages? YOU ARE OUTTA YOUR @#$%&*@#$ MIND!!!!! Think about the logic here! Buy gifts? NOBODY CARES ABOUT THOSE!!!!
My contact wall is beyond crowded. More than half of them I've never made contact with. All it takes is a view and any response, or a maybe both ways on carousel to wind up there.
The "Smart Pick" is pretty stupid! Not even close to what I'm looking for. How can you be positive or negative with a micro thumbnail picture that is hard to see, and notice that no user name is given.

Now for the positive. 
I have had some responses to messages, ranging from they are already dating someone to back and forth chats eventually resulting in phone conversations with real live women. Although I haven't met my match yet, I have 2 lady FRIENDS that I didn't have before, and whom I can call anytime. They are "buddies". No romantic inclinations, but we think alike and get along, and there is nothing wrong with having good friends. One is local, and one is not.
The Carousel matches have been mostly pretty accurate except for distance. Just how am I going to cultivate a relationship hundreds of miles away, although closer distances that are reasonable do show up. 50/50 on that one.
I get many views from older women looking for a "Boy Toy". It seems that Zoosk generates quite a few views that really never took place, anywhere from 2 minutes to a few hours ago from launching the app, but not always showing in the notifications. More age appropriate women seem to be much less common.

All in all, credibility is an issue. Zoosk generates things to create an illusion of activity.
Yes there are real live good people there. You have to put in the time in order to gain anything worthwhile, but there are no guarantees. I'll do my remaining 5 months and decide whether to continue or not. Anything significant, I'll try to update this review.

reviews.review_title: “It works but the pricing policy is a scam”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I read a lot of reviews here about fake profils on Zoosk.  Yes, I have been contacted by many "girls" who's profile picture includes a phone number with the message "Text me".  I always reported them and blocked them and had no problem.

I met a lady who was contacted in an attempt to steal money from here.  She was a little naive and almost got caught.  So be aware.

Aside that, I met a lot of real ladies, in person, that I got to know through Zoosk.  I just terminated my subscription with Zoosk, because I have met a really nice lady and I hope for the best for both of us.  So it can work.

The problem I have with Zoosk is pricing and what you get for it.

First, they lie about their prices.  I wanted to take a one-month subscription, which was announced at 30$ (or something).  After I completed the whole subscription process, I was told that subscription price was 30$ (or something) PLUS a 25$ activation fee.  So a one-month subscription does not cost 30$, it costs 55$.  As I said, they lie.

Second, even at that price, you don't get access to all the site's functionalities.  For example, I noticed that lots of members could not contact me.  It's then that I realized that I had to pay an extra 10$ if I wanted to chat with all members...  And there are other functionalities for which you have to pay extra money.

Also, they have the ever very annoying policu of automatic membership renewal (without your explicit consent).  Be aware of that as well.

So, Zoosk works (it has worked for me), but they lie about prices.

reviews.review_title: “Riddled with scammers and fake profiles and more money grabs”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
The scammers post a photo with a telephone number and the words "text me" added with text in the image.  The service does little or nothing to police them.  Also, mark the date your 30 days comes up or you'll get billed again.  
One would think a paid subscription would grant you full access to everything available on the site.  But Zoosk manages to create numerous ways to dupe you out of even more money.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I joined Zoosk for one month.  I thought that the profiles I was reading and the photos that I was viewing were real--sadly MANY are not!  There are fake profiles of people who are not zoosk members and trying to steer you off the website with text and e-mail addresses--Zoosk does nothing to control these.  Men and Women who have departed from the Zoosk website (myself included) continue to have their profiles and photos displayed as if they were still members.  I viewed over 2,000 female profiles and responded to well over 200--I received less than 10 responses.  The most "views" and contacts I received were after I left the site--they do this to try and get you to renew your subscription.  They also use some random profile generator called "carousel" to send you candidates--however, YOU have no controls to the parameters they set and you get proposed matches that are from left field and totally unuseful!  This site is a terrible waste of time for someone who is serious about finding someone. They also use another technique of sending your candidate flowers, candy teddy bears or other icons--this is just stupid but people fall for it and pay the additional money.  This is the worst $29.99 that I have ever spent in my life!  Please DO NOT be foolish. One last measurement is that MANY Women and Men use photos that are 20 years old some even older, along with this many send pictures of pets or scenic views--Really don't care what your dog, cat or horse look like.  If I could renew my subscription for free, I would pass.

reviews.review_title: “Lots of options thrown at you, but hard to get to people”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
They have this roulette thing.  And every time you get to it, even if that's NOT what you're clicking on, now you have this really annoying task of having to go through 100 (I think) women and you're being asked whether you want to meet them.  Yes/No/Maybe.  And you're not allowed to see more pics or read anything about them which makes it really hard to make a decision.  Plus so many.

I get emails like so-and-so wants to meet you.  Great!  Let's see who she is, read her profile, and respond.  Nope.  Now I'm in that STUPID roulette thing.  Oh it shows me that woman first.  But now it wants me to judge another 99. Some of them which keep repeating.

And then when I'm done with one of these roulette things, it shows me one person. What about all of the others I said yes or maybe too.

I HATE this interface.  And there's no member lookup either.  They can say "Sally" is interested in you or Sally wants to meet you.  How can I look up Sally?

I can't confirm, but I've heard all kinds of stories about being hard to cancel.  And I am going to cancel when the month I signed up for is up.  I hope it goes well.  Until then, I'll see what happens.

reviews.review_title: “Fake messages and sneaky extra charges and fake profiles.”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I thought it was a free dating site, and sure you can join and spend an hour putting in all your personal details for free but to contact someone costs. First there is a subscription $30 per month, then a $25 joining fee, then a further $20+ per month so that others can contact you back etc, Then more charges to buy coins! (There are other better constructed sites like pof and OKCupid that really are free)
After all that there are insufficient search filters and it takes an extra click and wait to refresh to see profile details so it takes ages to sort through the unsuitable people who are too tall, too short, wrong religion etc.
There are insufficient options or guidelines for body type so effectively Slim = anything from Skinny to Average, Average = Overweight and curvy could mean anything from slim wasted with curves to obese.
Two days after joining I tried to pause my subscription which is a very complex process and doesn't actually pause your subscription, so it will still expire at the same time even if you are unable to use it and it is difficult to find how to stop the auto renewals, one auto renewal for the sub's and another for the additional features. You have to find and stop both or you will keep getting charged every month.
Positive reviews are probably by staff or paid reviewers.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I've been on zoosk as a free member for a few months. I kept getting messages that my profile was being "viewed" by the same woman once or twice a day for a week. I figured that she also has a free account so she couldn't message me - but it seemed  she was checking me out. I decided to see if she was on facebook so I could contact her there. I found her on facebook (same pic).  So I made a facebook friend request. Well, she not only declined my friend request but also blocked me. Oops. LOL. Obviously, she wasn't interested. Evidently, zoosk posts fake "views" from people whom you have viewed so that you will become a paying member and be able to contact them. Shame on you zoosk. Now this woman probably thinks I'm some kind of stalker for tracking her down on facebook. Omy.

reviews.review_text:
Zoosk offers basic usability features at a high up-charge. There is no real "matchmaking" part of the software (I went through my Smartpicks every day for over a month and it never refined.) It is tough to tell if people still use the website (no one deactivates their profile), and there is no filter for non-paying members, so your message may never reach them. Almost no one fills out hobbies or writes a profile. The default filter shows people hundreds of miles away. If you want to pay $30+ a month so you don't affiliate yourself with Tinder, then this may be the site for you, otherwise I would steer clear. 
Pros: Not Tinder, No Scammers (in my experience)
Cons: Price, Few Active Members, Incomplete Profiles, No Real Matchmaking System, General Usability,

reviews.review_text:
I purchased a Zoosk subscription. First I thought It was 10 dollars a month. Then I checked my bank account and they took the entire fee out at once, which in my case was fine, but for someone on a tight budget that might not have worked out so well!
Most of the men on there looked like alcoholics and to top it all off I tried to block or report a few of the unwanted members "winks" ect. but they kept coming through.  To top it all off. I deactivated my account so I could take a brake, much like facebook..and Zoosk told me on the site my subscription was good until November, so I went back on a week later and the site said once you deactivate your account you lose your subscription as well!! So they took my money and didn't render services. So I emailed their customer service and never even got a reply.  This company is horrible. Don't do it. Just go to the bar you'll have better luck!

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: We would have never ran into each other any other way. I'm glad we both reached out! Zoosk had quality choices unlike other dating websites where I feel like I waste a lot of my time and never talk to anyone I'm interested in. Well worth the time and money.

reviews.review_text:
It's true I did meet someone through this app and we are engaged to be married this year.  After only 1 month of subscription I discovered I was just destined to meet this person and it has almost nothing to do with this app.

I wrote about 5 emails that were never answered and customer support just to upload my success story felt like pulling teeth to give them free advertisment with representatives that were completely rude and you could tell they flat or don't care about the customer, job, or their own company.

All the positive reviews should be counted as spam as their are similar experiences to mine confirming I'm not alone.

Be an adult, know who you are, what you want and what you're looking for. If you're willing to settle, that's who you are and probably why you are single.

Anne Frank's  " ideal date " is going out and getting some ice cream and after that 
to go to a book store and get some books.  
   Anne Frank likes the bible " .  <<<<

Zoosk is an awful bunch , very. Coarse and spiteful.

reviews.review_text: After trying several other sites without any great success, I decided to try Zoosk. However, after a little while I was able to give the carousel the boot and dive into the pool of potential dates using the chat function. I soon discovered it was a good idea to push for a date during the first encounter, since the chance of getting another chat going was slim. If you're looking for a site that force feeds you options and potential dates, I would look elsewhere. If you know what you're looking for in a potential date and don't mind a little work and persistence, then give this try.

reviews.review_title: “Zoosk is a thief by continued charges after cancelation”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I met my husband on Zoosk.  After committing to each other, we both cancelled our Zoosk subscriptions. We were BOTH charged again. (Actually I was charged twice, once for $97 and again for $37.) When my husband complained, Zoosk said they have a 'no refund policy' and agreed to refund HALF of what they stole! I missed the first charge of $97 one month after I CANCELED, because I was just out of the hospital and in long recovery, but another 6 months later, they hit me again for $37. I knew my account was canceled because I got a verification of the cancellation. Their explanation was I had a second account that piggybacked the cancelled account. They agreed to cancel that account and refund only HALF of the $37 fee. I disputed with my bank who got the full $37 refunded. Unfortunately the $97 fee was never recovered because it happened more than 60 days ago. 

When I initially paid for a 6-month subscription with Zoosk, I was unable to sign back into the account. I called them and they told me they could not help me and to just set up another account. They said I would not be double charged. So the first account I was unable to get into is the 'piggybacked' account they took on theirselves to reactivate and charge me for 6 months later!

reviews.review_title: “Fake bait profiles, website frustrating useless, no refund,”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
The absolute worst of the many online dating services.I signed up after spotting, during their free trial, someone of interest in a nearby city because I had to join to email this person.

Once they had my money (almost $80), that person in the nearby city did not appear anymore. Zoosk said that they couldn't control that. It was blatant misrepresentation and criminal deceit. Within the hour, I complained about the lies and got only response that I could cancel my account, but no refund.

Since I was trapped I decided to see if the service had any merits, but the website is useless. Searches ignore the settings preferences that I set. There is no way to keep a list of any profile of interest except by actually contacting that person instantly. A simple way of being able to save profiles without contact is a no-brainer in my opinion.

They have some sort of carousel BS that helps them match you. It is a farce. I received plenty of contacts from interested women, but even if I have deleted them they continue to appear in my contacted folder. They are immune from the law being based in Canada.

I am going to spend every chance I get reporting and warning people about Zoosk. I have belonged to other services. This is the worst.

Way past bordering on criminal misrepresentation.BEWARE

I liked: Very little.

Additionally I didn't like: Automatic billing of cc and no refund on day 1 of service complaint.  I also 99% believe they sold my cell phone number to telemarketers.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Like most others, I was suckered into paying for a subscription so I could read my messages. I was quickly matched with an extremely high amount of men, and I had just as many men interested in me and requesting to chat with me. I began chatting with several different men. The first man I became interested in lived 373 miles away. After chatting on Zoosk for a while, he asked to chat with me via phone. I provided him with my number. We chatted via phone/text and he soon invited me to visit him. He paid for me to come to see him and we had a great time and really connected. I thought he was a wonderful man. I stayed for 5 days and we set up another trip, this time to come and stay for 10 days. In the meantime, he became ill and was hospitalized. I still talked to him everyday and when things were bad, I communicated with his daughter. He was in the hospital and rehab a total of 3 weeks and my trip was coming up in a week. He was anxious to see me. I talked to him on a Wednesday, and didn't hear from him the next day or the following day. When I tried to contact him, his phone would ring, I would leave messages, send texts - no response. Finally - a 3-line text saying "I'm sorry I've been so difficult lately. I really need to get my health straightened out. We'll see what happens at that point." That was it. I never heard from him again. He never officially "broke up" with me, he never officially cancelled the trip, etc. I was just left to wonder what happened. I did a little background searching on him and found out he had lied to me. He said he was married and divorced twice. He left out the third marriage and divorce I found on his county website. He also committed tax fraud on five years of his returns. The lawsuit against him was dropped when he filed Chapter 11 (Corporate reorganization) bankruptcy. I cautiously moved on to another man who was nice and a little bit closer (90 miles). Same scenario, chatted on Zoosk, moved on to talking/texting on phone. He asked to come to see me. We set up the date and time and talked the day before. He was to call me when he was on the road, but said the call should come around 12:30 p.m. That time came and went. At 1:30 p.m., I called him - two rings and it went to voicemail. He finally called me to say (in his fake shaky voice) that he was sick and had been trying to work up the courage to call and tell me he wasn't coming. In the meantime, I had spruced up my house, gone to the store to get some snacks, and got ready. Total time spent - approximately 4 hours. I told him that it wasn't a problem and we could reschedule some other time if he wanted. Still, the whole thing left a sour taste in my mouth since he had known the entire day that he wasn't going to come to see me and could have cancelled before I went to all the trouble of preparing for his visit. He contacted me the next day and asked to reschedule the date. We set it up for the next week, and every time I communicated with him thereafter, I asked if the date was still on, and every time he replied "yes." The night before the date he sent me a text saying that he had looked at a couple of places to eat and said his plan was to be on the road by 2 p.m., to arrive at 3:30 p.m. He said he would call me before Noon. Noon came and went. At 12:10 p.m., I called him. Same thing happened as the previous time - phone went to voicemail after 2 rings. I texted him - no response. At 12:30 p.m., I called again - same thing. At 1 p.m. I sent him a text and said that it was over an hour past the time he said he was going to call and that if he was planning on being on the road in an hour, that I would think he would be up and about and would have long since contacted me. Finally, about 15 minutes later, I received a text from him saying, "no matter what I say you are probably not going to believe me..." He went on to say that his days and nights had been mixed up for a few days and that when I called him the first time he had only been asleep for 3 hours and there was no way he could drive down to see me on 3 hours of sleep. I asked him why he hadn't simply called me when he went to bed at 9 a.m. to say he was just going to sleep and would not be able to come down. He had no answer for me. Luckily, this time I had done no preparation, not even getting ready as my gut instinct was he was going to do this again. I went on to learn that although his profile said he was "divorced," he was not actually "divorced," rather "separated." I told him that Zoosk had the option of putting "separated" as a status and asked why he didn't do that. He said it was because his divorce was going to be final "soon," and that he had been "separated" for 7 years; also, because women would just go right past him if he put "separated" as his marital status. So - another man who lied! In every conversation that I had with him, this man referred to the woman he was married to as "my wife." He never once referred to her as his "ex," or "soon to be ex," etc. It was why I questioned him about being married, and he told me he was "separated." I don't believe for one minute that this man was in the process of a divorce. Someone who had been separated for 7 years would not continually talk about his wife using the term, "my wife." I asked the man to never contact me again and blocked him on Zoosk and on my Facebook page. Unfortunately, I can't completely block him from my phone, but so far, he has not tried to contact me. I am now, again very cautiously, dating a man from Zoosk who only lives a few miles from me and has been a gentleman in every way. He is kind and gentle and I hold out some hope for this relationship. I went into such details about my first two experiences on Zoosk because I want to warn women to be very, very careful on this website. Even though we may feel safe with verified photos, phone numbers, email addresses and FB pages, these things definitely do NOT mean that a man is being honest. I wish that I could post the names of these men so that other women could be forewarned, but I know that is defamation of character, and so I can't do it. Hopefully my experiences will be enough that women will do a little background checking on the men they are going to date BEFORE they date them, rather than the way I did it - which was after the fact. Sorry for the long story, but if it helps just one person, then it was well worth the read!

"Views" in Zoosk are quite useless - every time someone sees even your photo, like at when starting the program/app or simply reviewing the "Views" without accessing the profile of the person, this automatically generates a view. website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I have been blessed to have had to opportunity to chat with some interesting women from various backgrounds and belief systems on this site. My experience was mostly good. I have come to realize that people are people; regardless of how you meet. Be prepared to share important information about you as early as possible; because, the other person has a right to know. If the chemistry is not right at the beginning, let the other person know how you truly feel. It is is not meant to be, it won't. I have met great women on this site that, even though we did not get very far in our conversations, I still adore and fond of. My advisce: 1) Those who treat online dating such as Zoosk as a recreation,  rather than a chance to be creative in "selling your positives" often feel depleted fast and lose the chance to meet really great people. 2) Physical beauty is only an introduction; allow your positives to make people want to share your presence. 3) You can date anonymously and still find happiness without hurting the other person. reviews.review_title: “I HAVE TRAVELED FROM THE FUTURE TO ALERT YOU ABOUT ZOOSK.”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I HAVE TRAVELED FROM THE FUTURE TO ALERT YOU ABOUT ZOOSK. 

If you're reading this review, you may be wondering to yourself if it's worth it to make a financial commitment to Zoosk. I was in your exact place onCE time. I wondered to myself... How could a popular website like Zoosk yield such poor reviews online? Are people simply butt-hurt because they couldn't get a date?

When you sign up for Zoosk, the platform seems friendly and promising. Your first red flag will appear when you realize you can't read messages from other users without paying for a subscription.... But you want to, oh so badly. 

So you get suckered into that subscription, but before you even finish your purchase, Zoosk offers you more features for more money! And you're thinking to yourself... Well why am I paying for a monthly subscription if I don't even get all these other features included in there?

Then comes the last slap in the face when you get to the final check out page, and realize that they have a $25 "one time subscription fee"... WTF is this? A gym membership? 

But the greed doesn't stop there. Just about anything you want to do on this website costs more money. And you start to realize that it's likely that your matches are not even getting your messages, because they may not even have a Premium Subscription. So Zoosk is actually using your messages to honeypot other users into paying for a subscription, while you're left feeling demotivated because you are not getting a reply back from anyone. 

Right at this point, Zoosk delivers one last kick to the nuts. They automatically renew your monthly subscription without notifying you. What is the point of signing up for a one-month subscription vs a 12 month subscription if the former option gets automatically renewed without your knowledge. 

If you're like me, you are finally so fed up by their scammer approach with online dating, that you decide to de-activate your account. At least you get to feel some joy when you click through their desperate click-bait attempts to keep you as a paying member. reviews.review_title: “This site has 1 purpose - to force you to upgrade, and upgrade.”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
My 1st personal add was in a newspaper 23 years ago where I met my wife.  I am a widower.  I passed on her add twice, she answered my add.  I proposed at the end of our 1st date.  Never regretted it for 1 single second.  They do work.

But you will only get out of it what you put into your profile.  The more you put into your profile, the more careful you have to be.   The sites have one purpose, separate you from your money.  If you get a full subscription with all the frills, your experience will probably be a good one.  If you try to use a "bargain" subscription, everything is geared to get you to upgrade.  Be aware going in.

I have proof on the mercenary methods of Zoosk.  Here is what just happened to me.  They will sell you "coins" which you can use to buy "gifts, services, and upgrades".  I had a balance in "coins" that would pay for "read receipts" (has a message been read or not).  You can use "coins" to buy a single "read receipt" for 35 "coins" or $14.95 in "coins" for the upgrade.  My first time on Zoosk, I had bought the $14.95 upgrade.  This was my 2nd time on Zoosk and I had not bought the upgrade.  According to the support tech, they were "upgrading their services" and because I had bought the upgrade my first time on Zoosk, I could use "coins" to buy anything else on the site EXCEPT the upgrade that I wanted.  The only way I could get a read receipt was to pay cash for the $14.95 upgrade.  It took me ten minutes of rephrasing the statement before the tech agreed that I was correct.  My number of stars just went from 3 to 1.  I expect to be treated fairly (yes I know that is a dream).  This type of treatment REALLY gets me angry.

I have to be honest.  I have discovered that most of the original problems I had with Zoosk were because I did not update my e-mail forwarder when my IP host moved me to a new server so I did not receive the contact e-mails Zoosk did send me.  I have had others agree with me that if you try a bargain subscription,   then everything revolved around upgrading.  You have no positive way to know if someone you have tried to contact knows you exists (this was my fault).  The help is circular.  The "support" people restate the obvious.  After going around in circles, it became quite obvious that the entire site was designed to prevent contact and to force you to spend more money.  I must give them credit for policing their site.  I get far fewer "ladies of the night" and scammers than I did on Match.com.

I would like to extend a strong caution to the women.  From the stories I hear, the scammers and men cheating on their wives is much worse for you.  BE CAREFUL.  There are good men out there (like me) but the people working the scams and hookers are extremely sophisticated and, I believe, are doing psychological profiling to target individuals.  I put a lot into my profile and it makes me an easy target.  I have had 2 hookers admit that they had been coached on how to approach me.  But if you are like me, this is the only way of meeting anyone, JUST BE EXTREMELY CAREFUL.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
First of all you have to create  a profile THEN you are asked to pay (reasonable and can pay monthly rather than be commited to 3 or more months). But, AFTER you pay you are told that if you want anyone to read and reply to your messages you have to pay extra!

That's just for starters. There is NO real matching going on. i got sent "matches" that were far outside of the region I stipulated. The vast majority of the male "profiles" I was offered contained only a photo (some so ridiculously NOT the age on the profile), star sign, and basic info (education, smoking, etc) NO comments about who they were or what they were looking for. Just voyeurs and scammers. 

When preparing a profile Zoosk offers various musicans, celebrities, and sports teams as the way for you to display your "interests". Really??!! Hopefully people have interests beyond that.

There is no way to know whether the people you are looking at have even visited the site in years as it is possible to unsubscribe and fail to remove your profile. If you fail to figure out how to unsubscribe, they will continue to take your money every month.

Every few days the site sent me a notice that it had found some "great new singles" they thought I'd be interested in. EVERY time it was the SAME people.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: The site is terrible and very misleading.  Luckily for me I only paid for one month!  I suggest anyone who ever decides to join a dating site only pay for one month even if it seems to save you more by purchasing many months.  Each site has different processes.   For example, on ZOOSK, they will tell you you have messages.  You cannot see them until you pay to be a member.  Only to find out you don't really have actual messages instead you have "winks"...totally misleading.  Furthermore, most of those winks are from people that are not paid members therefore they cannot respond to you even if you send them a message.  So only paid members can contact each other.  Most woman are not paid members!  Keep that in mind, that's a very critical point.  Most attractive woman feel silly paying to be members of a site, because they have men hit on them all the time in the real world.  Also, you are limited in how many messages you can send a day!  WOW, never heard this before!  Well I get a lot of messages as I am a relatively good looking guy.  But yet I cannot even respond to them all!  And then to top it off they nickle and dime you for everything!  You can always pay more to send more messages, then they sell virtual credits.  It is absolutely a terrible site.  I cannot even believe they have been in business this long without more complaints.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
First of all, the fee is ridiculous. There are two plans and the 6 month one is the lesser of evils. If you go for three, but, stay longer, you'll be paying twice the amount of the 6 month plan. Unless I've misunderstood.

Secondly, the most this site allows, is searching. Clicking on either of two icons is also enabled, but, only through searches.

Third, I used my real name. I did receive notifications of an email sent by a woman, which happened twice. The idea was to look me up on social media, I never received either friend invites or PM's from either, so, chances are they didn't really send me an email. I'm not even sure why my actual name was even allowed.

Fourth, every profile edit requires approval. If these sites would just charge ten to fifteen dollars/month, who cares what anybody says. As long as they don't cause any kind of harm, obviously.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: IT worked for me.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
The simplicity of sifting through the large membership one pic at a time made it easy to establish physical attraction before either profile was read. This saves a lot of time wasted while waiting for a reply. They see your pic, say "yes" to meeting you, and then you can both look at the profile while you decide how to approach them, or IF you want to approach them. In my case, she had read my profile and contacted me. This eliminated the possibility that my first message went unread. She immediately replied and we had instant chemistry. The only reason I didn't give more stars is because you can't look at the profile before saying "yes" to "meeting" them online. You can't look at all their pics first either. The "yes" for both of you is based on one pic. It's not that the method is bad because it does what's intended. It gets you both talking to potential dates that are attractive to you. You can see the profile after you've both said "yes," before your first message anyway, so the best thing about it is that it saves ALOT of sifting looking for someone that wants to talk to you. In this regard, Zoosk is the best dating site I've found for that, but DO read the profiles first or you're going to fail to 1) Capture their attention by noting something in common between you, compose an opening message that gets them talking about something in their profile, or have anything interesting to say. 2) They might not be in your area. In my case I was prepared to go anywhere to find compatibility. That's what they make planes for isn't it? I was lucky enough she was in my area.
No more bullet points! Do your Carousel homework every day and start talking to them. Zoosk will do just what a dating site is supposed to do, but it can't accomplish it without two human beings that are attracted to each other interacting.

reviews.review_title: “A total and complete waste of money and time. Run by scammers.”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Zoosk is a complete ripoff. This is the last site anyone should consider for on-line dating. I cannot emphasize this enough. Stay away from these scammers. I was forced to give them one star simply because a "zero" was not offered.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: My Zoosk account was compromised.  I call their customer support and was asked some questions.  They confirmed it was compromised and blocked my account.  They told me I could start another account with a new email address and use  different credit card for payment.  They did not address the fact that my account was hacked or that my personal information was compromised  I was asked to contact the local authorities and their legal team will be cooperative once they received a legal document.  They had no concern or care about what transpired.  Stay away!  This is not the first time this happened.  I read many reviews with very similar stories.
