website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I have been on Zoosk for almost 6 months and I won't lie,it has been an emotional roller coaster ride. You meet as many people as you decide you may have an interest in and hope then to find some with common interests. I learned you can't just trust everyone immediately and to proceed with more caution. I made three solid connections and did get my heart bruised by a couple. When I was ready to quit,I started talking to someone that I didn't see a connection but I was wrong. We have a great time and are getting closer everyday. He doesn't live near me but we feel that shouldn't be an obstacle at this point. We are planning to meet soon and will see how that goes. My point is that this process,on line dating,isn't easy and takes time. Write a good profile and be open to who you talk to because you never know,the right one may be waiting for you. Patience,you need patience and if you really do want to meet someone,perseverance is a must as well. It may not happen in the time frame you were hoping for but don't have any expectations and be open to talking to different people and I bet you"ll find someone special like I have.Anything is possible......patience.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: In the words of my fellow online dating survivors "DO NOT LEND YOUR CREDIT CARD OR BANK INFO TO THIS ILLEGAL BUSINESS SCHEME". Most of the profiles are scammers and fakes! An example of  just one of the misleading and fraudulent things you can expect on a regular basis are profiles with 1 picture and no description harassing you, chat requesting you, carousel-ing you, then sending you messages of how "they can'take talk here" and to "give them your email so they can send pics". This site needs to be discredited and shut down permantly! I signed up for a 6 month subscription, which ends on 10/6/15. My credit card and debit cards have be cancelled and new ones reissued to prevent an automated renewal that cannot be destroyed any other way. Run and don't look back.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I paid for a 6 month sub. Half way through I realized some of the girls I was trying to chat up weren't subscribers. Of course, Zoosk offers to take more of your money so that even non-subscribers can reply. So I do that and still so few replies. Then I looked more in depth at the accounts. More than half were inactive for more than 30 days, but still showing up in the front of the search queues. I also looked at the pictures and "usernames" to find out many were stock photos from the web and auto-generated names. In 6 months I got 3 dates. Total waste of time and money!

They stock their site with expired and fake accounts to make it look like they have a wide user base and lure you into paying them for access. Their customer service is terrible too. Twice I deactivated my account and each time they ended my paid subscription early!

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Easy to use website!  Met my perfect match on my first date.  Its so easy to break the ice on-line and ask those questions you normally wouldn't because its awkward in person.  I am thrilled to have finally found my missing puzzle piece!!

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
Zoosk is the worst dating site ever.  They make it so easy for people to sign on (literally took 5 minutes) but when you try to cancel/leave them they make it extremely difficult. When I called their 800# they said I have to go through "ITunes" to cancel your subscription. I found out ITunes is partner with Zoosk!  I downloaded ITunes Stores on my phone and my PC and tried it numerous times with no success on the cancellation of my subscription, not sure what else to do to prevent them from continuously billing my credit card without having to cancel my credit card!!   
Please do NOT use ZOOSK!!

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
Yet another dating site that survives by, in my opinion, ripping off it's "Subscribers". Like some members express interest but NEVER bother or cannot be bothered to respond or respond in slow, meaningless ways.

Like Diane, 65 in Hamilton who wrote to me saying she could not tell me what it would mean to her if she could talk to me. Like a fool, I paid for a subscription, replied to her and she did NOTHING!!!!

Was Diane a PLANT by Zoosk to deceive me into paying a subscription fee for nothing? I think she was! All in all I had several messages from women expressing interest in one way or the other and oddly enough, once I was a paid subscriber they no longer could be bothered to reply. In my opinion there can be only one reason for this nonsense!

One last thing, like Ashley Madison, there is this B/S Zoosk Policy not to let you to read messages from others THAT YOU ALREADY PAID FOR!!! THIS, IN MY OPINION IS A COMPLETE AND TOTAL RIPOFF!

I posted most of the above which is fair comment on my Zoosk Profile. They of course changed my profile be removing what was fair comments in spite of the fact there was no vulgar language used anywhere.

Apparently they clearly do not want their "Subscribers" to know the truth about how they operate.

They are in my opinion nothing more than snakes in the grass feeding off the loneliness of those who pay their bills and wages.

PS: There should be a way not to award theses scumbags any stars.

reviews.review_title: “Here is the REAL problem with Zoosk.”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
First off, I do believe Zoosk is a legitimate site.  Although I haven't gone out with any women, I have chatted with a few.  Nothing has led me to believe that any of them were bogus profiles.

Zoosk boats millions of members.  But the REAL problem is in the number of abandoned profiles.  I did a search within 50 miles of my location and Zoosk returned 269 different profiles.  Pretty darn good, eh??  NO!  Of those profiles, only 34 appeared to be active.  The rest?  Who knows, but they haven't been attended to nor ever deleted.  That means that nearly 87% of the profiles on Zoosk are a total waste of time as the users are long gone.

A couple of examples:

Some profiles start out saying "I am 49 years old and.....".  Yet, Zoosk states their age as 54.

Some photographs have the digital date stamps on them.  Many I saw were 4-6 years old.  One profile I saw had photos with digital date stamps of 2004 and 2005!  So what you see is not what you'd be getting!

As a result, you'll need a shovel to dig your way through the deadwood.  Even at 34 seemingly active profiles, a small few may remain once you pass by the Angus-sized beheffers.  And good luck getting any of the good ones to reply.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Update 9-1-16:  Another Thing I noticed.

The Zoozk "Boost" feature is an extra cost option which highlights your profile in several different fashions allowing you to receive many new views in a very short period of time (typically 1 hour).  However, you need to be online to activate (pay) it.  This would mark you as either "Currently online" or "Recently Online" in case you log off before your boost runs out.

It appears that if Zoosk isn't getting enough paying members to fill their boost, they just choose profiles at random.  Again, you are being directed to dead profiles.  Once you click onto a profile, it is not marked with either the "Currently Online" or "Recently Online" tags indicating the member never authorized or paid for the boost.

reviews.review_title: “Exploitative, manipulative and not worth the money!”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I joined this site previously when it was a Facebook app. It was average then.
Some years later I had occasion to use it again, but things have changed.
I would agree with other reviewers that by the way the search is set up, it makes it look like you are interested in people when you have had no option but to look at their profile as it is onscreen when you open the app.
There is no facility to suspend or take down your profile if you want a break, which to me is unfair. If I am paying for a service, I want to be able to have control of my own destiny, not be forced to be "on show" when I don't want to be.
At one point i  deleted all of my profile and put up a message saying I was taking a short break from it , this was not approved by the administrators! Why not?, surely I should be allowed to put any message up I like as long as it isn't offensive or inappropriate? Apparently not!
You get messages saying someone has accepted your chat request when all you have done is view their profile and I know for a fact that the software is manipulated or set to make it look like people have looked at you when they have not. 
I actually feel exploited on this site, which is not a nice feeling.
I will be trying to get a refund, but I have little hope of that.
Not impressed overall, and if I could give it no stars for a rating, I would!

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: For me, this was money well spent.  I'm Looking forward to seeing where this goes. I was really a little overwhelmed with all the attention I was getting. I got to chat a lot.  Most were very nice chats.  One date I considered spelled out what he wanted.  Some girls are into drive bys,  I wasn't and the date didn't go any farther.  I appreciated the honesty.  I am a person who's happiest in a relationship.  I realized this about myself going into the site.  For God's sake be honest with yourself about what you want and those that think your worth the time will gladly meet the bar you set.  You might have to sort through a few profiles/men but not all of them are just looking for a one night stand.  This type of site gave me opportunities to meet or chat with a lot of men.  It takes the guess work out of who is avaiable or even interested in going out with you. It should keep you occupied and certainly entertained.  This doesn't mean you won't be naughty if your into that which I can be but I am selective about who sees that side of me. I would recommend Steve Harvey's "Act like a lady, Think like a man" to understand the power a woman holds in relationships before moving forward. Good Luck Ladies,  it is worth the effort. I did meet a very nice guy.  We live together now and he is everthing I wanted and then some.  It does happen...even to me.

reviews.review_title: “Too many inactive, or probably fake profiles”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I was amazed at how many "views" I was getting.  One woman I messaged, as a result,  said she had NEVER viewed me.  That indicates to me that there may be false "views".

I sent several messages which went unanswered.  It appears that we are never told if the other party is a paid subscriber, so they can view our messages and chat with us, despite the fact we're prompted with "Mary Jo is on line now!" or "Denise has sent you a chat request".  

One woman I was conversing with (she seemed to good to be true), had a profile which had facts easily verifiable on Google, etc.  Nothing matched up.  She also said she'd gone to school at the Univ. of So. Cal. I used to work that neighborhood, so I asked her about her favorite eating spot, there.  Her angry reaction was way overboard which indicated to me she lied about going to USC or she was fake, altogether.  

Perhaps it works well when BOTH parties are real.  It seems that Zoosk keeps encouraging us to spend just a little more $$$, every so often to improve our chances, yet the apple is always out of reach.  I guess it boils down to I'm not that clever of a guy, so as I'm unable to discern the real from the fake, I'm going to save my money from now on and look elsewhere.

UPDATE (08/23/16):  I returned, after six weeks, to Zoosk.  It used to be you could apply "coins" (you amassed through the carousel game) to find out if the member you sent a message to had opened it.  Now, they want an additional (almost) $10 a month to tell you.  Just to see where things were I sent no less than 40 messages to local women, just saying hello and/or complimenting them on their profiles/photos.  I got, perhaps, two responses - indicating once again, that these profiles are either outdated (one woman had replaced her profile picture with a photo from her WEDDING), unavailable, or for non-existent people.

Additionally, I had notifications that, "Two women want to meet you."  It would cost 30 coins each to "unlock the contact", despite the fact these women had been easily accessible just in the days prior to this notification.  I hit the "yes" button and reached out to them both.  Four and five days without any feedback or contact, respectively, despite the fact I'd been told they wanted to communicate.

FINAL UPDATE: With about 13 days to go, until my subscription expired, I went ahead and left.  I had NEVER heard from the two "matches" which I "paid" 30 coins each to make contact with.  I sent out almost 100 messages to see what kind of returns I'd get.  Less than 10% with only one local.  I had two more notices saying "So-and-so is on line and wants to chat"  I reached out to them both.  They both denied wanting to chat with me.  Perhaps they were chatting with others and "wants to chat" applies to that other party but not me, okay, then why tell me?

Perhaps the bottom line is this...I'm not handsome, desirable, mature or clever.  Perhaps I am all those things.  More likely I'm somewhere in the middle.  I am tired of spending money, WHILE BEING ASKED FOR MORE, to get very little in the way of results.  Best of luck to those who have had success, on Zoosk.  I did not.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
After reading the reviews of the "number 1 rated dating site", I'm like f##k this! I have not signed up yet, but don't feel I should, but I'm all about bad decisions, so I probably will. 

First sign of BS, they kept editing my profile and referring to some rule of no profanity, identification, etc. When all I was trying to say was that I had not signed up yet and could not respond YET. 

Second bad sign, writing customer support gets, ZERO response. You actually have to call India, or wherever else they have outsourced these jobs to, to find out, they do NOT allow you to state the status of your profile or subscription status. Funny, they won't say that in writing...

Third bad sign, the guy I'm most interested in signing up for, when I Google that username, tons of listings on POF come up in OTHER COUNTRIES, sounds pretty legit so far.

So I may still give this a shot, but keep all of this great advice in mind, because from what I'm hearing from almost ALL OF YOU, is that this site basically is a scam.

I'm pretty sure the only real dudes are guys who are fat old perverts who like every other site, want naked pics the second they introduce themselves. That is modern dating now, correct? Just want to make sure I understand the pathetic state things are in now.

Oh, I almost forgot, nicktheitalian (or something like that), who I saw online probably TEN years ago, still has the same vague picture from 10 YEARS AGO, and pretty much the exact same username, from somewhere else. All I remember specifically is this was one of my first "catfish" experiences, before it had a word. Fortunately, my brain has spared me the gory details.

Well I'm not new to online fiascos, so once I join, I will update this review with some good battle stories, hopefully not wounds.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: This site was very overwhelming for a girl who hadn't dated in more than 10 years - - but I quickly learned to be up front about what I was looking for and thankfully - very quickly, the man of my dreams found me. I also had profiles on Christian Mingle and eHarmony and while I appreciate the insight the creators of these sites have put out there, sadly, there just weren't many people using those sites in my area. reviews.review_text: I have nothing but praise for the site, a lot of the people i met, not so much. I started to notice, that even though I stated I wasnt looking for a hookup, Many of the women I met were in too big of a hurry to rush things along, they didnt want to "know" me, just hook up. A little tuning of my requests and wants and needs, I started meeting women i really like, and connect with. Now, the woman I made my first face to face date with, is the one I am giving all of my attention to, My future feels better and with my lady, brighter than ever!

reviews.review_text: I'm not so sure that you will be able to use this review as this sort of experience would probably only happen to men over the age of 60 who, I suspect, are outnumbered by eligible women by at least 3 to 1. After a very slow start, I ended up in the 4th week with one lady that I've met with on four occasions and five others that I may or may not want to meet up with eventually. I had been married to my late wife for 44 years and out of the dating scene for about 46. This may sound strange but I find the process of having to choose from this selection of very nice ladies to be rather difficult and distressing as I take no pleasure in hurting the feelings of anyone. I can't say yet if I will ultimately end up in a lifetime relationship with one of these fine ladies or if none will work out and I may be back in another month or two. I certainly have my hands, and heart, full at this time and am completely unaccustomed to, and almost overwhelmed by, this experience. Zoosk certainly delivered the goods for this poor devil!

reviews.review_text: Ive tried many different site to connect to friends, date or have something casual. To begin out of dozens of sites, if you are a free member, this site is sub-garbage. You are rarely seen by other members and if any happen to message you, you cant even read the message. Dont worry, there is more bullcrap than that. They are nazi's when it comes to your profile. Everything from your about me to your username. And they feel just fine with editing out any parts they dont like (saying negative things about the site, kik, snapchat, anything not pc) another thing is they will spam your email 10 times a day. When you unsubscribe it lowers to about 3 times a day even though it should be zero. I have read many reviews on different sites talking about how not only does premium suck balls, but also, just like the emails, when you cancel, they dont seem to care. They charge you anyways. Over 40 reviews on a less mainstream site gave it 1 star and said similar things. Knowing this site being more mainstream, most or all of the positive reviews are likely employees of zoosk being paid to reel you into a scam. I recommend meetme for friends, badoo or okcupid for hookups, and pof or tinder for dates. All 5 of those are free and i think most or all are on android and iphone app store.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
Although I have had issues with Zoosk, it was more over the women I contacted rather than a short comming of Zoosk, From my limited but wasteful experience at "other" sites, Zoosk delivered without the scammers, mysterious email from people, etc.

The issue I had with many women had to do more with either 1. no responses, 2. insultingly - where the presummption of innocents is waived to insure that lady didn't fall into the same trap as previous relationships. 3. Tire Kickers - ladies that are fielding the possiblities but not certain how they would fit it into their life. 4. professional dater - she'll meet for a few dates but the word GF never seems to apply. 5. Genuine Article

Relationships are not easy. They require an investment on both parts just to see how it will work. You can't make that determination in a photo, a profile or winking.

For all of us, we can easily make a list of the pitfalls that have undermined past relationships. We must learn from the past and put it behind. Unless we are interested in something fast, easy or non committed, the profile needs to portray this. It should also portray a vend diagram that illustrates how much of a relation the person wants.

I have found, after trying to chat with many women, successfully chatting with a handful, talking live with a fraction of those and finally meeting yet a fraction of that, only to find I was talking with someone who only wants to meet for an occassional date, a movie, dinner or drinks, or dancing. She won't use the word exclusive at any point because, she's playing the field. There is nothing wrong with that, except that it sets up a false reason to meet. This needs should be a clear goal in the ideal date. Because "ideal date" tends to suggest fairtale yet this person likely has a lineup of fairytales stacked. She'll have a tight schedule and will typically not be available during the obviously dating windows. 

Knowing this in advance is important. Knowing also where the person wants to go with the relationship. His/Her time line. How committed are they to finding a relationship and what are they willing to invest of themselves

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I was very skeptical about finding another boyfriend this time around.  I am 54 years old, not looking to impress anyone with my stocky physique. I just really want someone to hold for the rest of my life.  
I played the carousel and landed on Mike.  He sounded down to earth, so I winked. He asked for a chat.  I agreed and we started our conversation that lasted for 2 hours.  He asked me out to dinner and I agreed. When we met, he looked so much cuter in real life than in his photo.  I was hooked. 
We ate dinner and said our goodbyes. I felt really good about our first date.  He called me that next day and said that he really thought that I was sweet and wanted to date me. I felt the same way. 
So, I am leaving ZOOSK for my last relationship I will hopefully ever have.
Guys, if you are thinking about joining ZOOSK, get the feature that allows you to talk to non subscribers without them having to join ZOOSK.  That is the only way that I was able to tell if I really liked this guy. The free chat is the key to finding the right woman. Trust me!! I found him because he was able to talk to me and it didn't cost me a penny.
Well, good luck to all the future ZOOSKERS out there and may all your dreams come true!!!

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Had a free membership actually thought about wasting my money on a paid one.  Very few men in my area.  Most men younger than my age looked worn out and expected to attract VS model material. Decided to stop wasting my time and deleted my profile.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I have tried other sites and liked Zoosk best because I got a lot of matches in my area. I did meet a few people who I will now be friends with, and others who are potential relationship-matches. If they don't work out, I will re-activate my membership since Zoosk is so easy to use and keep in touch with my matches.  Thanks for a good experience!

reviews.review_title: “It worked! Ultimately, that's how to evaluate a product: does it do its job? Zoosk did for me.”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I ended up finding someone awesome through Zoosk, and we are happily together! I wasn't thinking I'd find a perfect match online, to be honest. Very glad I did!

Overall, there are a couple of things that Zoosk could improve:

-The "Carousel" function tends to repeat the same people; sometimes it's a string of the same 5 or 6 people that keep coming up; that's a little frustrating.

-The gifts seemed a little silly. 

-Winks seem to actually be a turn-off, both to guys and gals. Just remove them. 

-Better bot-screening would be cool; there are definitely some bots on here. 

      Those are picayune details, given the overall success I had with Zoosk. The end goal is to meet someone you can have a relationship with, and that's precisely where Zoosk succeeded.

reviews.review_title: “About a big a joke as their virtual gifts.”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I kept getting contacted by women who wanted to meet me, even ones from other states. I would pay "coins" to respond and send them messages. Only one woman ever returned a message and we had nothing in common.Too many, I think, use the "Carousel" only to get free coins and have no interest in that person. The virtual gifts are so juvenile. I can't believe anyone would be impressed by a cartoon rose or Teddy Bear. LOL. One month was all I needed to see this site was a joke. I even left coins on the table. I had one day left when I cancelled and in the last 24 hours got plenty of interest. Hmmmmm.

reviews.review_title: “This is a great forum with ease of use and wonderful women.”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I would highly recommend this to anyone willing to try online dating site.  It is user-friendly, classy, and facilitates meeting someone in a simple, safe, appropriate manner.  I met a wonderful young lady who seemed hand-picked by my creator and put into my life--I just had to make myself available here.  I have waited a long time but this gal is worth it and the timing is perfect--I am flying 1000 miles to meet her, though we are already talking about our life ahead and what things I will bring when relocating to her--never felt something so real for someone, and we haven't enough met yet!  If you care to follow our story, call me anytime and keep doing what you are doing here at zoosk--from the bottom of my heart, and hers, THANK YOU!!

reviews.review_title: “Zoosk sets a standard other sites can't touch”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Yeah, you pay for zoosk, but it isn't much at all. And the truth is, I've tried other free sites before, but because they're free, you don't find many matches of quality, or I should say, people who are genuinely looking for a relationship. It's not very likely you'll find someone paying for a membership who only wants to play around and never meet up, or who just wants to chat with someone. I met a WONDERFUL lady on Zoosk, and I genuinely believe this is the start of something beautiful! Thank you Zoosk, from the heart, for all you've done.

reviews.review_title: “A Problem With Online Dating in General”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
This is a criticism of online dating, in general, although my experience was with Zoosk. 
 I thought I had met the right person on Zoosk.  But after a year, it fell apart.  There was little motivation on his part to try to work on the relationship.  And before I knew it, he was back on Zoosk, looking for another woman.  So, my caution is to be aware that there is always this pool of potential others that is readily available.  It can be tempting to jump back into the pool rather than invest some time and effort in the current relationship.  I am done with online dating.  This one hurt.

reviews.review_title: “You CAN find your one true love online”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I'll admit, I was not a.believer in online dating several months ago. The only person I personally knew that tried online dating got married in 3 months, then divorced after a year. Not a good image.

But a friend convinced me to give it a try. What did I have to lose? Do I did. I started out with just a free account.   It turned out that free accounts could send messages but could not read messages. Major bummer.

That said, Zoosk does have a couple of cool features. First, you can send virtual "gifts" to other members as a way of showing interest or that maybe you liked their profile or pics. Second, you show your interests by categories (music. movies, television, people, etc.) Zoosk had a vast array of preset interests from which to choose.

Zoosk used this feature called Carousel in which they show you a pic of someone and their age. No profile or anything, just a pic. They ask "Do you want to met him/her". You must answer "Yes", "No", or "Maybe". If you answer Yes or Maybe, you earn a coin. You can earn up to 40/day. After that you can buy coins for a somewhat hefty sum or just wait until the next day to earn more.

These coins are used to buy certain items, such as the previously mentioned gifts, and unlocking profiles you want to view on a matched user. 

The problem with the coins is that paying members are required to use them too. If you don't have enough, you must purchase more. 

I feel that paying members should get a certain number of free coins and gifts per day. I also feel that no profiles should be locked to paying members. 

I also do not like that you cannot search on a username. If you happen top come across someone you like, you had better click the "Add" button so that you can find them later in your "Connections" otherwise you may have a very hard time finding them later.

I did not get a paid subscription for a few months because I was "Winking" at people and sending messages left and right with no response.  

For some reason I finally decided I'd try a paid membership for 1 month. 10 days later it happened. I got a message from someone who had just joined that day.  It was HIM.  He found me.  I saw the message come up just as he first sent it. I viewed his profile and knew immediately he was the man for me. We exchanged email addresses and hit it off. We are madly in love like neither one of us ever dreamed possible.

So in the end, even with what I viewed as shortcomings, Zoosk worked!

reviews.review_title: “Be 100% open and honest, share feelings and lifestyle, they will come.”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
As soon as I learned about CHATting, I hated it because you can't get hold of the person whenever you'd like. And let's be honest, if you are truly looking for a partner or life's mate then you want to COMMUNICATE any time you are free. This can be a minute or for hours getting to know someone. That doesn't happen with the CHAT texting. It is very time consuming and wasting of much effort when you don't hear back for days or weeks and the feeling is lost. 
I solved the problem after a few weeks of this. I sent out a text and told the person after finding a profile and photos that I really was interested in that I hated the CHAT method and that I was truly interested in her. I then wrote a long chat and gave a clear highly honorable description of the true inner caring and loving person that I am. I was inviting and offered an unforgettable pleasure and excitement that she would enjoy if she were willing to just read my profile and give herself a true chance to converse and share a moment. I told her I trusted her based on her profile of truth and gave her my cell phone.
Why? Because she was beautiful, educated, and I felt the need of caring in her profile. I knew from her photos that she would get literally hundreds of chats every week. She was a high demand gorgeous woman physically and smart. My profile was complete and the truth in each major phase of life who I was. It was well done, enticing, inviting and very promising to any woman wanting that man to be there star. The good about me far out-weighed the misfortunes and dislikes of my person. Humbly written, this was a catch for her and I let her know I felt the chemistry was there if her profile was true. 
She called me at 2;30AM a few days later after her long shift. It took her two times to read and absorb all I had written. But, when half-done, she was tired from work and just took the one opportunity I offered. I was not interested in the stupid CHAT game. I truly wanted to know the heart and soul of this beauty. 
When she called she was tired and happy. She wanted to call back next day. I said I am available ANYTIME. She was so happy. The next day, it was a 2-3hr call. We met two days later on her off day for wonderful evening of dinner and 1 wine.We had 1 1/2 hr wait at a Bistro dinner and I planned special treat for her tired soul, who had worked a double shift. I paid for a massage for her weary body and a separate one for me. She was so happy that I cared for her health. The masseuse thought we were married and asked if we wanted it done together. I was humbled and embarrassed. I hadn't considered that on 1st date. She looked at me so grateful and happy and told him, we want it together. I knew there and then that she trusted me and our chemistry was there immediately. She told me, please turn your head when we stripped down. I laughed and said, "Of course not", and laughed and said, "But I might peek you're so beautiful, no I'm just kidding". She laughed even more when I said "I peeked, NO just kidding." She said, "she did peek when I turned around".
The embarrassment was gone, we wanted each other from that moment.
I took her home early 10pm and let her get much needed rest after a fantastic and wonderful dinner time. She was on vacation for 10days just two days later with no big plans except to rest. I took her to my home next day, and we spent those 10 days together just listening to each other and sharing our hardships and happiness of just seeing each other. We did much more as you know. I let her know from the first sad story she told me that I repeated in my profile, I have one responsibility and that is "to make your life better". She saw that from the first date of massage when she was so exhausted, yet wanted to keep the date and her word of integrity after working two shifts 18hrs. I was unbelievably honored by this woman. How could I not think of how she gave of herself to start.
By the way, I am 66 and she is 48. Not your average woman, but a stunning beauty in every way. She looks about 32-33. Her zoosk has hundreds of chats weekly. She says I look about 50, well built athlete all my life. But the one thing that both humbly shared is the need to be cared for and care for the other person. That is the building block from the heart when one can listen to another's meaning behind the words, and not just the words making conversation.
We are together now as lifetime mates. We just enjoy being together and give in to each other whenever needed. Its all about loving and caring to hear and feel each others thoughts.
MOST IMPORTANTLY,  GIVING MEANS LISTENING AND RESPONDING IN A CARING WAY THAT HELPS THE OTHER PERSONS LIFE BECOME BETTER WHETHER IS THE MANY THOUSANDS OF SMALL THINGS OR THE FEW GREAT LARGE THINGS. ALL ARE IMPORTANT WHEN YOU TRULY CARE OR LOVE SOMEONE.

I let her know that my positive feelings are to make her life better from the heart and every other way possible. She worked late alternating hours. I told her call me ANYTIME because others did not and that ruined the start of communication with nearly all of the men. She called me

reviews.review_title: “It seems zoosk was designed *by* junior high kids *for* junior high kids...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I thought I did my due diligence before joining Zoosk. I researched lots of dating sites, I read reviews and descriptions, etc., and everything I read indicated that Zoosk might be a good choice - easy to use, fun, and the reviewers had success in getting good matches. I don't know what site these folks were on, but it was not the one I experienced. Simply put, Zoosk sucks. 

From the start, Zoosk encourages members to choose the most ridiculous, juvenile user names the suggestions are things like "sexyguy" and "waitingforyou" - seriously? What's wrong with your real name? Then it continues to the stupid "play carousel so we can pick someone we think you'll *really* like!" which provides users with no opportunity to actually read profiles before indicating whether one would like to meet that person. Two problems with this: 1) why not show me people you think I'll *really* like to begin with? and 2) how am I supposed to know whether I want to meet this person from only a photo? Then we mive on to the silliness of "earning coins" to do... something (I didn't bother finding out - it's too stupid). 

The whole thing is absurd! I thought I was signing up for an opportunity to meet adults, what I got was a silly junior high-level boy/girl party game. I swear I'm fun, and I am not a party pooper, but I'm  also an adult and if you're one too, this is not the place to meet someone who you'll want to date. I really wish I hadn't spent the $75 for a 6-month membership. Oh well. Live and learn...

reviews.review_title: “Get a load of these ripoff artists.”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: By now, most of you know me as being the victim of getting robbed by one of these sites. Unfortunately for me, I didn't do enough checking before I signed up. By the time I realized that all these pictures and profiles couldn't possibly be real, it was too late, as it could be for you if you're not following this. These are scam artists, and have a nice day trying to unload them once they get your credit card information. Take a good look at their terms of service and make sure your not standing on a bridge, because you'll want to jump off. They tell you directly that they use what is referred to as 3rd party representatives, which means that you're going to have idiots from the site contacting you and pretending to be the people you think you see in the profile pictures. Most of the pictures and profiles are photo shopped or stolen from Facebook or porn websites. Read all of their terms and conditions and then look down to see if your shoes are tied together, because that's what you'll feel like. They'll auto-upgrade you from a trial membership to a full, paid one, and then start charging your credit card for more scam sites. They were charging me for 3 different sites before I could stop them. Ultimately, I had to cancel my credit card and close my checking account to get rid of them. This site is no different when you register. Seconds after my information was sent, my email inbox was ready to fly. Dozens of women had viewed me! Too bad I hadn't given them a picture of myself yet or any profile info. Women contacting me from towns with the names spelled wrong. Who can't spell the name of their town?  One was emailng me from a town that was destroyed by a coal mine fire in the 1980s! Some of the profile pictures make no sense. One supposedly from California, had the Eiffel tower in the picture. Another, reportedly one of my "local neighbors", had Yosemite Park in the background. Others are of dogs or animated characters.  What kind of dopes do they think people are? What does it matter because all they want is to roll you for money. Notice the addresses of these clowns. Nigeria, Antigua, Malta, South Africa, Cyprus, Antilles, and they're going to try and match you up with someone from your own town? Good luck with that and guess where your credit card information is going when you register.  Don't expect their customer service to be much help or even in your language, either. Keep your money because these sites all land in the same category. Thieves.

I'm not really happy with the state of online dating sites these days.  I had a successful relationship through one ten years ago.  These days, they are too expensive, keep too many profiles of people no longer looking, have a higher rate of scams, and less tools for really meeting successfully.

That being said, Zoosk is one of the better sites today.  I was still targeted by a scam, in which we held a normal conversation for about a week before they tried asking for money.  So be aware, it happens everywhere.  I did meet my current girlfriend on Zoosk, though only the initial hello.  She did not buy a subscription because of the cost.  There's a lot of room for improvement, but it's still one of the top 3 sites you can use today.

reviews.review_text: I created a zoosk account without a photo of my me, it was trees. I did not pay for the service yet because I wanted to look around. As a long time member of many of many date sites 11 emails without a photo is well beyond normal, for a man. For woman this is normal but online dating statistics would show that only 5% of men receive 5.5 first contact emails per week. I can only suspect that they use false profiles and emails or try and get you to join. The only other option I can conclude is that Women must really like trees and are prone to email them more often.

reviews.review_text:

They trick you(Yes, trick you!) into purchasing a subscription that's cleverly designed to pay more for a longer period of time compared to the closely follow up subscription priced just below that for one month.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
Wow, where to start. I signed up because I read that it was the #1 dating app. I signed up for free and started getting messages right away (imagine that). However you can't read any messages unless you pay. I signed up so I could see these messages and decided on a 6 month membership because it was discounted and I figured it would take a little while to meet the a good match. Big mistake.

The so-called messages that I received were actually just "winks" and it is not clear if they were from actual people or just an automatic thing the site does to try to get people to sign up. The site seems to be more about chatting with people and the profiles usually have very little info. 

I tried to figure out how to cancel but it was really hard to find any contact info. When I contacted them and they told me I had a 3 day window to cancel since I live in California. There was still 1 day left and I cancelled immediately. However I did not receive a refund. Apparently all this did was make sure that my membership did not renew automatically.

Since I had already paid I continued to check in on the site to see if I could make the most of it. Wow, what a total waste of time. In 6 months time and a significant effort I did not wind up meeting one person and it was difficult to even get someone to chat with me. There was one woman that did want to meet but she was frustrated with the site so she quit. She sent me her number before she quit but I did not write it down immediately and once her profile was gone so was the message with her number.

My membership expired recently and I checked back to see some of the messages that I had received but all the communication that I had over that time was blocked. I could see the messages that I wrote but all of the responses were blocked. How bogus is that?

I am on 2 other sites that do not require you to pay to contact other users. In the same time I have met several women from those sites. The information that people provide in their profiles on those other sites gives you a much better idea if you are a good match. One of the sites even matches you up based on a quiz that you fill out. 

Bottom line, I would not recommend this site to anyone. It is worthless if you do not pay and not much better than that if you do.

reviews.review_text:
Don't do it because I am not sure if any of the women who visited my profile actually exist. And constant pressure to buy is a pain

reviews.review_text:
I have been on many dating sites for 2 years and I have had plenty of first meetings and even a short relationship but just couldn't find the man I wanted.
So  I took a break from dating sites from time to time only finding myself going back and each time being disappointed.  After about a 2 month break, I decided to sign on Zoosk as a free member and just peruse the site for awhile to see if I wanted to pay and advance my membership. On the 2nd day after signing up on Zoosk, I logged into the site and it gave me a row of pictures to click through.  One click, 2 clicks, 3 clicks.... and there he was.....  a picture of Jay!  I definitely hit the "YES" button.. He was so handsome and there was something about his eyes and smile that I loved.  He flirted back, I had to message this man so I paid my membership fee and started messaging Jay.  It was his last day on Zoosk and he wasn't going to renew his membership!!.  We met in person 3 days later and it was love at first sight.  We are planning on a  definite future together.  Thank you Zoosk.

This site and all dating sites that encourage people to find that are a God send.  As many bad experiences that people put on the other, the real goal is to find one out of this haystack.  I hope that I have found that person here.  I have no clue how I would have found her any other way.  Thanks!

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I joined as a free member and stayed that way for about a week and loads of people checked out my profile and sent messages I couldn't open. I also got a lot of the round robin type emails that get sent out and hopefully fool you into thinking you're doing even better than you are and tempt you to spend out on a contract. 

I paid a months membership and sure enough there were some personal emails as well. I continued to get some good interest and yet decided I'd not stay with this site after a month as I have membership elsewhere.

I contacted their customer service to check that I would still have access for the remainder of my paid for month and was assured I would even though some of the info on the site suggested to me that you'd lose your fee when you cancelled. They cancelled my re billing contract (without me actually asking them to do so. I'd only asked a question). Now real issue here and I did indeed still have access as advised but guess what??? This was a couple of days ago and I have had only two views since and no email or other contact from anyone! lol! 

The other strange thing was that when I joined as a free member (and I have to admit I was a tad cynical about this at the time) there was a very high proportion of profiles with pictures of professional quality depicting stunning women. I'm sure some of these were genuine :) However I have never seen this ratio of "supermodels" to normal mere mortals before.

Finally this happens in life I know. But it seems to happen on some sites more regularly and this site is one of them for me. Namely arranging to meet someone who continually tries to rearrange on you. 

I've been on sites where this hasn't happened in years of membership. I've been on sites where it happens almost as soon as you join and strangely seems to happen most frequently at the end of the month when your fee is due. someone pops up out of the blue and wants to meet you! Co-incidence maybe?

I sure wouldn't recommend this site, although I expect it works well for some.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I was on here for a week.  I was about to give up.  Many people never answer or won't actually spend any coins to open a chat or whatever.   But, you do get to see a lot of pictures and most people who are serious about finding someone, have filled out their profiles completely.  If they do not have the maximum pictures and their profile is not completely filled out, they are probably not trying any harder than the effort displayed in their profile.  As far as a specific review by a woman, I never encountered any weird or rude men.  I did notice a couple of profiles that I thought were probably spam.  I reported those.  The chat functions are slow and unwieldy.  But, by some miracle, I managed to meet a great guy.  So, don't give up right away.  Be VERY clear about how you are, what you want and the type of person/relationship you are looking for.  I think that is the best way to be successful.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
OK, it's been some time since I paid for a membership at Zoosk, but it seems to share all of the contemptible and deceptive practices of most online matchmaking sites, and throws in a few of its own as well. It has been interesting reading through the Zoosk reviews to discover some of the bad customer service and deceptive practices that I did not myself experience, but, based on my experience, I have no reason to doubt. 

PEOPLE, STAY AWAY FROM PAID DATING SITES! The Free ones are bad enough. At least at the free sites you don't lose money along with your frustrations and disappointments. The industry of paid dating sites needs to die (or, better, be destroyed), sooner rather than later.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: The problem with zoosk is not their ridiculously high membership fees, even if you get a discount.  The real problem comes in the form of "mutual matches." What zoosk fails to make clear, anywhere on their website, is that BOTH parties must pay the coins to unlock mutual match.  You pay your coins, and it looks like the match has been unlocked, but until the other party pays their coins as well, nothing will get through.  The other problem with this site is that carousel does not show you location, and it consistently matches you up with people who are not even in your demographic area. SO glad I only paid for a month.  I will not be renewing.

reviews.review_text: I actually met three women.  One rejected me from the beginning.  But she was "too smart and professional"  to be interested in me. Then I think I have met someone that she and  I just  click.  Along the way I met a couple that apparently were scam artists. website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: No customer service...EVER!  Oh...and were you a sucker like me?  Thinking it would get better when you paid 80 bucks for 6 months?  It doesn't.  Send a message to a lady on there?  Zoosk comes back and says "Want to see if she's read your message?  Click here for credits!"  Ummm...I paid 80 bucks...I'm a full member...why do I need to pay more money or play stupid "carousel" games to know if someone has read my message?  While I was ramping up to being a full member, I had no profile and no photo posted...yet I was getting HUGE numbers of "----- WANTS TO MEET YOU!" e-mails?!!!  "She" wants to meet WHOM?!!!  For all anybody knows at this point, I'm a friggin suspension bridge!  Why do you want to meet me before you know ANYTHING about me?!!!  My "Smart Pick"?  Why can I send her a silly friggin "heart"...but can't get to her account and send her an actual "Hi...how are ya?"  message?  Scammers can do it to me before they know the first thing about me...but I can't send messages?  Oh...and how do I know messages sent will ever be received?  How do I know the woman at the other end isn't told "You have a guy who sent a message...click here to play carousel for more credits...or enter your credit card number now."?  How do I know?  I don't know...I won't know...because Zoosk "customer service" never responds.  IC3 will be hearing about them next.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
Here's an update to my original review one month on (having cancelled my subscription!). It is an email reply from those low-life scammers at Zoosk, who I accused of mis-selling on the grounds they failed to make clear before I paid that I would only be able contact a microscopic percentage of the profiles on it. The first paragraph overflows with loveliness, though it's just words - they have absolutely no intention of creating a dating site with actual people you can actually date. The second one is where they legalise the scam - 'we've got you're money and there's nothing you can do about it.' OK, I've been scammed for £25 ($40), big deal, I'll get over it and learn my lesson. As for zoosk? Commercially, they're the equivalent of 16-year-old schoolboys who steal dinner money of blind 7-year-olds - scumbags of the highest order. 

So...

'... Thank you for contacting Zoosk Customer Support.

Im sorry that your recent experience on Zoosk didnt entirely meet your expectations. We realize that dating can be tricky. So at Zoosk our goal is to make things as fun and easy as possible. We are always working to maintain a community in which users feel comfortable to date their way, whether they want to browse, flirt, or find a soul mate. If you think there is something we can improve upon in order to provide you with a better experience in the future, please feel free to let us know.

Please recall that we displayed a confirmation screen before completing the transaction. This screen showed the total purchase amount, including all applicable taxes and Activation Fees. In order to complete the purchase you were required to view and accept this confirmation. We have established this confirmation procedure because all Subscription purchases are non-refundable.

We appreciate your interest in Zoosk, and we apologize for any inconvenience.

Best regards,

Zoosk Customer Support 

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

Shame you have to give this lot one star - they deserve a negative rating. Ultimately, this is a legal scam. 95% of all the people on Zoosk haven't paid, so can't reply to emails you send. The tone of their customer services emails is hysterical, e.g. we're the loveliest people on the planet, so just tell us how to improve and it'll be down in minutes', but the truth is they have no intention of doing a thing apart from grabbing your cash. It's a complete sham, so don't go anywhere near this lot.

reviews.review_text: At first I was hesitant about zoosk since I had never done the online dating before and heard horror stories about it. She is more than I ever dreamed of finding and after 4 months of dating we have recently been talking about our future plans and I couldn't be happier! Thanks zoosk for giving me something more than I ever expected to find! A word of advice to everyone. Just be yourself. Don't play yourself up only to be let down when they find out the real you because it WILL happen eventually.

reviews.review_text: Once you register at this "free" site, your hit with messages from women.. that you cannot read unless you pay for the subscription. They entice you to pay by having multiple women sending chat requests and messages your way. Once you join the real bull$#*! begins. Fake profiles messaging you at least once a day, site claiming someone is viewing your profile yet she has idea what you're talking about. My profile even sent a "wink" to a woman without my permission. The so-called "smart match " fails in revealing exactly where your match lives, only the distance. You continuously get notifications that "so and so" wants to meet you, but that is only the result of a feature called "carousel" that members play to aquire coins... they don't really want to meet you, they want the coins, and most are pretty far away to begin with. I've got messages from people 14'00 miles away sometimes further! These dating sites are supposed to be for people with full time jobs that don't have time for the bar scene, instead you get a bunch of games and scammers.

reviews.review_text:

After a few dinner dates we realized that we were better of being just friends due to the reasons mentioned below as my CON about this site.

CONS: 
1. Some guys on here say that they're looking for a serious relationship, when in fact they aren't.
2. Some of the men on the site are such perverts.
3. Some of the men say that they're single or divorced when they're in fact married or separated.
4. Men don't read your profile at all to find out what you're looking for.
5. On this site there are a lot of fake profiles.
6. Some guys put photos of celebrities, their dogs, kids, or pics that are 10 years old and upon meeting them they look totally different.
7. This site cost way too much and the guys that they pick as a smartpick isn't right at all.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
There seem to be about 5 interests that 90% of the women have ... "The Notebook," "House," "Kings of Leon," the "Twilight Saga," and "Vin Diesel."  Awfully suspicious!!!  I chatted with one woman for a while--definitely a real chat, and she told me a little bit about "The Notebook" and "House"; but I couldn't tell if she was a real person looking for a date, or some guy in Bangladesh following a boring outline.  I'm thinking of getting out, though I have the impression there are plenty of real people mixed in with fake profiles.

Update: I straight out called one "woman" out on being a bogus profile and said "you guys are going to get busted for this scam."  Message back: yep.

2nd update: I joined Match.com and found way better results immediately. I am now dating a woman from there steadily. But I did end up responding to a few women from Zoosk who contacted me, and I told them all about my experiences with these fake profiles, and I was surprised that there were a couple of obviously real people with fully, developed personalities. They told me it wasn't the same experience on the women's side of the site.  In spite of my own experience and regrets with Zoosk, I'm inclined to believe user experience probably does vary a lot. I also think a lot of the reviews on this very site here are fake, but I wouldn't discount all of the positive ones; I'd just recommend using a different dating site anyway.

reviews.review_text:
Worse dating site I have ever been on!!! DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY! Half the people on there haven't even subscribed so they can't actually read your messages. The site does not tell you who has subscribed, so, you have no idea if they have read your message unless you pay even more money. 
Im a 24yr old female new to town. I was just looking to meet someone to spend time with. Men from 500+ miles away were messaging me and I could not get that to stop. All were either way older than me, creepy, very unattractive, or all three combined. If I got a match, I had to spend coins to use it, which cost even more money. Try your luck with a different site. POF, which is free, is 5 times better. 
I hated it so much I called to get a refund of the $30 and to have them fully delete my account not just deactivate it. They refused to give me a refund but would offer me half off for future subscriptions. They also tried convincing me not to delete it incase I wanted to rejoin in the future. On the site it says people wont be able to see your account when it is deactivated but the woman I talked to said they still could. So, if anyone actually bought it, be sure to call them to fully delete it! Also, your info is still out there for 60 days after they remove it. So be sure to delete all your stuff before calling them!

reviews.review_title: “Fake profiles and overcharging. Bad business all the ay around.”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I signed up for a month because the site had a different approach and looked promising. The first problem, once I paid for a prescription was that if I wanted to contact any of the women, I'd have to buy coins. This was after paying $30 for a month. It was already more expensive than most other dating sites. 
The next thing was that they kept showing me all of these women who were supposedly interested in me and when I sent them a "wink"... I would automatically get a message back a second later saying that they liked getting a "wink" but would prefer that I send them a note. So I would do that and would get back another message that said that they appreciated the "wink" but could I send them a more personal note. 
I HAD JUST DONE THAT!!!
Totally fake profiles. 
I only had one woman right back to me who was real... I think.
I'm going to report them to the Better Business Bureau. And you should too.
They need to either change their horrible scam of a business model or be put out of business all together.

It took a little time, but I have met some very nice men here.  There was something about Tony's "hello" that made me think he was new to on-line dating.  He seemed shy and innocent.  After a little chatting we exchanged phone numbers and decided to meet that evening (Wednesday).  (he only lived a few miles from me, so that was extra convenient)

After the first meeting I couldn't stop thinking about him.  I had plans to be out of town on the weekend so didn't get to see him again til Sunday evening.  I was concerned he would meet someone else before I returned, but he later told me he was "gonna wait for me".  

Since that evening, we have been inseparable.  We can't wait to see each other and spend time together.  We are still learning each other, but with openness and honesty on our parts, it's fairly simple.  There is no doubt in my mind that his feelings are genuine, as mine are. reviews.review_title: “A Sham. Old Photos, Fake Photos & Cons”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: The approval format is a sham. I basically uploaded an x rated perfect date, and of course, it was approved. I think this company is linked with many dating sites of members long gone. Look at the profiles, many have a different format. How can a girl that appears about 20 be listed as a 61 year old if any approval system is used?  The scam here is a woman contacts you after reading your profile, asks a couple of simple questions and you never here from her again. That's when you have the option of paying for 'coins' to determine if she read your message, or to pay extra to boost your profile. If you notice practically all of your matches are far away. This way it takes some time before you know you've been duped. If some were local you would figure out right away it's odd that you never ran into them over a 30 year period in a town of 600. I wouldn't doubt it a bit if someone in a third world country is being paid a dollar a day to answer questions or send winks for both sexes. This cons are smart enough to understand that many people looking to date may pay to figure out why they are being blown off or not solicited. This is a total waste of money.

My final beef is they fuuuuuuking kept taking 75 dollars from my credit card without me knowing, without informing me, without asking me if I still wanted to take part in that waste of life with fake profiles.... website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: From someone who was seeking to use online dating as a resource for pre-selecting men of potential marriage match for me, I have a few suggestions that would make the site more useful (while those looking for more casual dating can continue to use only what suits them).  When I had first joined the site there were compatibility questions which I found very helpful and there was plenty of space available to provide more details in the profile.  Over time, the compatibility questions disappeared and when I went to edit my profile, I had to significantly reduce the content or it would not be saved.  It would also be nice to configure preferances such as distance and age range so one will not be bothered by the winks, message or even views of anyone outside of those preferances.  As I would check the new views, each pass over someone I had viewed before counts in the system as having 'viewed' their profile even though we are just clicking through the views see what the 'new' ones are.  This is misleading, causing others to think you are constantly 'checking them out' when you're really not.  Also when chatting with someone, the chat window we have for typing is so small (a single scrolling text line) it is challenging to review what you've typed before sending.  A large text box in which the text wraps and and ability to expand to full view when typing would be a great improvement!  Otherwise, I had a positive experience and did meet some quality people along the way.

I paid for a month on Zoosk (because if you don't pay, you go nowhere).  Then I learned that I have to pay again for access to the men who pop up and show an interest in me.  

To pay for what I thought I had already paid for, you need Coins.  To get Coins, there is something called Carousel where you earn Coins by indicating YES, MAYBE, or NO when a random man's face pops up.  Just his face.  No profile info whatsoever.  You can't read anything at all about him in order to make an informed choice.  You can't get a Coin for a NO answer.  You can only get Coins - which you will then use to buy access to the truly interesting man who is trying to reach you - by clicking YES or MAYBE.  

Of course, to be fair, if you want to spend even more on this absurd site, you do have another option.  You can outright pay cash for Coins.  

So to whore your way to a bigger cache of Coins, you choose MAYBE for  the 30 guys who look most like the man of your dreams and least like the man of your nightmares (30 is  the minimum needed to pay to play as far as I can tell). You choose MAYBE even if the man in the picture looks like Dog the Bounty Hunter and you are hopinng for Atticus Finch.  

Then later, when some of the MAYBEs contact you, and you finally get to read about them, you  learn enough about them to smile, grimace, or scream.

Supposedly you can Chat with someone who is on line at the same time you are.  But all that amounts to is sending him a message which he will see right away because he is on the site at the moment.  This is not like a Live Chat with AT&T.  If he's "Chatting" with a couple of other women when you send him that message, or if he's clipping his toenails but forgot to log out of his Zoosk account, Chatting is no different from simply sending him a message in the first place.  

I am hating this site.  I don't recommend it.  I feel like I'm in a casino whenever I sign on.  I won't be renewing after my month is up.

reviews.review_text: I agree with Tiny Tee.  This site is primarily manipulated by it's owners.  Most of the people who have supposedly "Viewed" you have never even seen your picture, much less read your profile. Neither have they sent you a "Let's meet" message.  If you delete a picture from your "Views" you will have that person's picture pop up within a short period of time as a "Viewed" you.  I deleted some 25 or more pictures in one sitting only to have all of them pop back up within less that an hour.  Now, you tell me, what are the odds in that happening?  I have contacted many of the people who supposedly viewed or messaged me and was fortunate enough to receive honest answers from quite a few that confirmed they had neither viewed or messaged me.  In fact several of them stated they had experienced the same type of problem.  One actually told me that she was in the last days of her subscription and where she was not receiving many contacts before was now bombarded with "Views and Want to meet" her messages.  She suspected it was to get her to renew her subscription.  I totally agree.  Don't waste your money.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: The Iranian-owned (nothing against Iranians; have many as friends) and developed site more often than not malfunctions. It is sneaky; it lies; it steals your money  and you have to call and explain ten times before they'll refund you.  It is almost impossible to un-subscribe.  They make it appear as if certain people are viewing your profile over and over when in fact they only looked at you once, months before. If you're a woman they automatically set your search preferences to men who are 2 or so years younger to TEN years older, so if you're not into men 10 years older you have to start from scratch re-inserting the age range, education level, smoking status, etc., every time you do a new search.  And if you want to search outside your city, you have to change your locator in your profile.  INSANE.  A user-UNfriendly site.  A huge pain, and a huge waste of money; I felt I was giving my money to extortionists.  Not to mention the vast majority of men of a dubious quality  marriage material?  Not exactly.  STAY AWAY from Zoosk if you value your money, your time and/or, especially your sanity.  The owners are raking in the bucks by doing NOTHING to improve their site. There are other far better dating sites; I've tried several; none even come close to being as pathetic and horrendous as Zoosk  the laughing stock of dating sites.  I feel like a complete moron for having ever joined.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I've tried a number of dating websites and recently I thought I would give Zoosk (another) try.  I had tried it some time back and it wasn't very good.  Sadly it is no better and is possibly worse.

I registered yesterday.  All looked well, easy to use interface and some pretty ladies.  I found a lady local to me that seemed nice so thought I would send a message.  I couldn't however do this as I would need to pay the subscription.  Ok that's fair enough, you can't expect everything for free.  I instead sent a wink and pressed the "added" button which I took to mean she would be added to a favourites list.

A few things happened next.  First I almost immediately (a matter of minutes) got a message from her, or at least a notification that she had sent a message (I couldnt read it without a subscription though).  Great I thought, this is a really great site, I never got that sort of success elsewhere.  I carried on looking through those on the website and sent another wink to another girl.  The same thing happened.  I started to smell a rat by this point.

Later I noticed that the "added" button I had pressed had been recorded as me sending her a "chat request."  That wasn't what I had intended to do so already I am sending out inaccurate messages through the misleading button "added."

I was suspicious that the first girl I had supposedly had a message from was real so I decided to try and google her using her photo.  I did actually find her LinkedIn page and managed to send her an email to her work address.  I wouldn't normally do this as girls tend to freak out at this sort of thing, but I felt I had a legitimate reason to email her; I wanted to know if I was about to be scammed by Zoosk.  The next day (today) I got a reply from her work address and she told me (thankfully politely) that she had not sent me a message and had in fact not been on the site in over a year.

Tonight I tried using the "added" button again on another girl and as before I had a "message" from that person.  However looking at the notification on one browser it said the girl had "sent me a chat" and another browser she had "sent me a message."

I am regularly getting all sorts of notifications from various people now which is way more interest that I got on POF.  I have read a great number of bad reviews about Zoosk and how it is a scam site.  I take them with a pinch of salt as some people expect to use a website and it to be totally free.  This is stupid, you can't expect a company to create a service and let you use it for nothing!  You will also find a number of disgruntled single guys who have a chip on their shoulder about online dating.

That aside, Zoosk does seem to be a dubious website from my short experience and I wouldn't trust it based on that experience and on the dozens of scathing reviews about the website.

My advice is be critical, careful and suspicious.  I'm sure there are some genuine people on there (like me), but you might have more luck elsewhere.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
Back three years ago I used Zoosk to meet a nice woman. At that time, I wrote messages and about two or three times a week I'd get replies. In three months, I dated seven or eight women, and met one whom I'd end up living with for a while. To make a long story short, things between us didn't work out. She was suffering from depression and wouldn't do anything proactive to help and we went out separate ways.

So because it presented me a number of opportunities then, I figured it would be good to use it again.

Cisco K. did a great job reviewing it. I'm going to basically repeat what he said.

I've been on for over a month now, and I've written messages to about 200 women. I'm fit, attractive, financially stable with a career love kids, have one teenaged son, love animals, I own a home and a car, and I'm clean cut with all my hair and teeth. Why have I not gotten a single response? I was teased with a couple women who "accepted my chat request", but they would never write me back. After the accepted chat request, I assumed they wanted to chat right then. I would write a short hello etc. and never would she answer!

I believe the majority of profiles are old and abandoned. They're left as decoys to entice people to join. I'm pissed because I purchased six months of this crap. I'm going to spread the word. It does this company no good to offer a service like this. If this keeps up, they will fail. The service is not good and I will never use Zoosk again. And others will catch on. That's the way consumers work. Word of mouth will prevail!

reviews.review_text:
Hello again to my fellow readers.  I hope U have taken my advise so far and also HAVE BEEN READING REVIEWS ON THE INTERNET AND LISTENING TO SOME VERY GOOD AND INFORMATORY ONES ON YOU TUBE before subscribing to any SEX, DATING, OR SINGLES SITES.  READ FIRST!!  They are from considerate people, probably just like me who just want to protect your WALLETS or for some, PURSES.    
Well, I did it again Guys!!  I am your "Guinea Pig" for another SITE.  This time it is listed as the #1 SITE.  Taking my own advice, Ihad only signed up for a month around July 5th. I quickly noticed all the Women on there from all races, types, and from all over the U.S.. Like always, I had text a few of my desired type, then just alittle while in, I started to notice I had text around 40. I had to immediatly stop. I said, what happens Cisco if more than enough answers and U like them all??  Since I am a Gentleman and really am not searching to hurt any feelings of the interested Females, I did stop and started to view all that had viewed me and was quickly going to message the ones I wanted to really correspond with. It sees that I had I had earlier sent messages to most, so, still being interestd in them, I sent another message. As I've said to U before;  "guess what"??  Most of them had "viewed" me again, then again, and again.  "WTF", I SAID!!  Why are they all just "viewing" me when I was really expecting a "message" by now!!  After I called the # for the site TWICE & through all the explaining and being credited a total of 300 coins, (which is optional for U to buy, but not necessary, and for me didn't see a need for) I went back and used the "coins" as suggested by those 2 phone calls on "boosting my profile".  Again, "WTF"!!  Man!!  I was getting noticed more and more and still more!! Almost 100!!  BUT, HOLD IT!!  THEY WERE STILL F~~K~N JUST "VIEWING" ME, AND NOT EVEN '1' MESSAGE  AS A RESPONSE!!  The site had told me that some of the Women didn't make the required payment to be able to text or message back. Now, Guys, (lol) after all the sites I have been on, I have never heard of this or even had a problem with an interested Woman sending a response to my initial message, and not only that!!  Remember Guys, I had an initial 40 total messages sent, AND U MEAN TO TELL ME ALL 40 OF THEM THOUGHT TO COME TO THIS SITE AND KNOWINGLY NOT HAVING PAID TO BE ABLE TO RESPONDWITH A MESSAGE ARE ALL JUST GOING TO "VIEW" US GUYS AND NOT DO ANYTHING TO LET US KNOW THAT THEY LIKE US OR SAY HELLO TO NOTHING AT ALL??  AND HERE  I AM, REMEMBER, PAID IN FULL AND TEXTING MY ASS OFF AND STILL NOT RECIEVING ANY RESPONSES FROM THEM??  "WTF" IS GOING ON HERE??  Why would a non paying Woman even go to the site in the first place??  I'd love to see what would happen if she really saw a Guy she really liked and could not do a dam thing about it??  As for me at this point fellas, I had just e-mailed Zoosk right before texting this review to U.  It was said that some Assistant will send a response to me in 2-3 days!!  I am as of now letting my "MONTH" subscription run out while waiting.  Also in the meantime, I SENT A LAST TEXT TO "EACH INTERESTED WOMAN" THAT HAD "VIEWED" ME IN ALOT OF TIMES,  THAT IF THEY WERE NOT GOING TO AT LEAST MESSAGE ME WITH A RESPONSE, THEN I HAD WANTED NOTHING MORE TO DO WITH THEM. I hope fellas that I will have better news to tell U all next time, but as of now at 2:15 am, (Pacific Time) Thursday, July 9th, 2015, my cellphone has been totally quiet since.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
There is a lot NOT to like about Zoosk. Like any singles site out there they have lots of pictures. But here is what is a rip off:

1. If you edit your profile and put something in there that they do not like - I simply told people when I was canceling so we could figure out alternative way to keep in contact, I got an email saying "You profile has been accepted with minor changes." Well, the :minor" change was to totally eliminate what I put in my profile ! They did this twice ! So, censorship is alive and well at Zoosk even though it did NOT violate their terms f agreement.

2. They have the "Carousel" which is a series of pictures of potential partners. You either say you are interested or not. Problem is all they will show you is the picture. No location, nothing that would indicate they would be a match for you. You have to get "tokens" to do this. Then once you say you want to meet that person it costs you 30 tokens to actually see their profile. I can honestly ell you that 99% of the people they sent me lived at least 75 miles away.

3. When I complained to Zoosk about censoring my profile, they cancelled my subscription ! They said I could still access my account for "free" although all I could do is see that people sent me messages. I could not rad anything or respond. Despite cancelling my membership when I looked at my account, they billed me for renewal for another month. When I wrote them complaining about charging me for a service they weren't providing me, they ignored my letter.

So, there are far better places to do business than Zoosk. To me their style of censorship and way of doing business, both when you have an issue with them, and taking you for a ride when actually using the site make this one of the worst online services !
