reviews.review_title: “I'm new to the online dating scene, but let me tell...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I'm new to the online dating scene, but let me tell you. I created the free account, and yeah I was skeptical. I kept getting messages saying so-and-so wants to chat, or they sent you a message. So I gave them my credit card info and signed up for 6 months. What a waste of money! There were no messages,  and I get no replies to messages. I'll send a wink, and get the same automated message. Save your money. Try Plenty of Fish. It's really free! Set up an account and you get to chat with people without giving out your credit card number. I even went out on a few dates. Yeah they have extra features you can pay for, but you don't need them, and there's no pressure to buy! I just wish I read reviews before I signed up, but when you see TV Comercial you automatically assume it's all good. Don't make the same mistake me and thousands of others made.

reviews.review_title: “This is the worst dating site I have ever dealt with”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: This is the worst dating site I have ever dealt with. SAVE YOUR MONEY!!! I was a member for 3 days and had nothing but problems with the site for the entire time. One time, no one could log on, and it keeps changing my preferences on its own, it changed my user name on its own. I deactivated my account taking my loses to save me anymore frustration. NO WORTH YOUR TIME!

reviews.review_title: “Been a member for months, I have talked to a few girls,...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Been a member for months, I have talked to a few girls, but only one girl was somewhat local, I would say 75% of the accounts are inactive. The chat system sucks, the whole site is pretty bad...I hated that i had to waste $75 to find that out.

reviews.review_title: “There is in automatic computer answering the winks...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: There is in automatic computer answering the winks you send out.  two of the winks I send out, the way they replied were the same msg. What a full of crap. I regretting paying money to this site.

reviews.review_title: “I am trying to figure out how to get OFF Zoosk as it...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I am trying to figure out how to get OFF Zoosk as it is the biggest waste of time I have ever experienced in the dating world... you'd be better off placing a Craigslist ad!

 Unless you want to pay lots of money you cannot meet anyone and need to buy "coins" to read or reply to messages, look at whole profiles or pics or accept chats... for 3 days I have tried posting "I am leaving Zoosk so please do not message me or waste your money trying to chat with me because I can't even see your messages" and whoever is approving ads deletes ALL that despite the fact it does not violate any written Zoosk rules... 

In other word you have NO right to free speech and you can't even say in your own profile you are leaving without that being deleted for no reason! 

I have met NOBODY here not even chatted to one in over 3 months... save your efforts for a site like POF, OKCupid or Meetme.com at least you have a chance there... once I leave Zoosk I will never waste my time there again and will be sharing this same review on a dating site ratings site later that Zoosk cannot delete (don't count on them leaving this review on their ad, they will delete it too!)

reviews.review_title: “My experience on zoosk has been beyond frustrating,...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
My experience on zoosk has been beyond frustrating, as:
1. The site is very contrived with all of the inadvertent "views."
2. When I have sent gals messages, I get a notification that they have either "accpeted my chat request" or that they "want to chat" with me.
3. I got suckered by the "mega flirt" feature, as I did notice that two ladies sent me the EXACT SAME message. It was not until quite a while later that I realized the why of that, and it was a result of seeing the template options in the "mega flirt" section (I also saw another, different exact same template message there, which I had received from another gal). 
All of the above listed reasons detract from any credibility that this site might have.
Granted, I did have what appeared to be legitimate conversations with a few gals, but the absolute sky-high rejection rate has been staggering, and I am a pretty decent looking guy. As has been mentioned by others, my guess is that the vast majority of women are not paying members, if real at all.

reviews.review_title: “I'd give it a 0 if I could”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I'd give it a 0 if I could.    This site is bogus. They use profiles that are not active and change the profile names and locations so they appear to be matches that you are searching for in your location. I saw one profile come up with three different names and locations!  They want money for any additional service too. Plus nooooo matches in my location except 10 at the most!  Total rip off!

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I am in South Australia. Everything negative that has been reported about zoosk on Jabber is absolutely true. I recently paid for 6 months subscription and cannot contact anyone .One " lady " contacted me after I supposedly sent a wink but I have never ever even seen her prior to her messaging me re. the wink  .Zoosk now want me to subscribe AGAIN to find out her full message and contact her back !  Not likely !!  I just wished I had read the reviews prior to doing my dough !!  David P.

reviews.review_title: “This online dating site is totally over run and hi-jacked...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: This online dating site is totally over run and hi-jacked by scammers!! BEWARE..... The few honest users you may stumble upon are few and far between. If you've had any experience with the low life predators out there, spare yourself .....

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I was just about to join.....so glad I looked at the reviews! I guess I will go with Match.com....thanks guys!

reviews.review_title: “Really difficult to cancel so always pay by credit...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Really difficult to cancel so always pay by credit card.  But to be honest not worth it.  Some profiles are real but most arent live and are just free ones and there is no way to differentiate what is live and what is not.  Terrible.

reviews.review_title: “Horrible horrible site, avoid at all costs!!”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Horrible horrible site, avoid at all costs!! it's just an expensive scam!!!!

reviews.review_title: “I would give a HUGE 0, but you have to give at least...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I would give a HUGE 0, but you have to give at least 1 star. I joined this fake site 1 week ago, immediately started messaging back & forth w/ a "fake" guy that "lives" 83 mi away. I think this person is an employee to get me "hooked" to Zoosk, / the "fake" attention. I will NEVER believe this guy is real. The person I was "corresponding" with was .. very very good at seeming real, they are not in another country. I can't point to any one thing that raised flags, except that "he" seemed too good to be true; never talked money, or "love" --- just "enchanting", I cancelled my "stupid tax" subscription within a few hours. I also wrote to Zoosk-- told them they had better not continue my subscription. I also made 3 more fake accts... and wow!! the phony "guy" sent my phony lady's messages within an hour or 2. I do have to add here, that I happen to know several guys (my age) personally on zoosk.. I went to HS with them.. and reconnected with 1-- so, there are real ppl on there.. but all the comments below mine are TRUE. So, you have to take every single message with a BUCKET of salt. I'm also thinking this is true for EVERY dating site, same as "real life".. You can't give your trust away, it HAS to be earned. I find online dating sites to be merely entertainment.. it feels addicting, logging on daily to "see what cute guy might notice me".. I imagine it's the same for most of us.. so, in the meantime, no one is able to filter through all the phony's, liars, cheats, .. and I think  much of it may be good ppl.. but no one can focus on the "new messager, bc we have soooo many ppl messaging, we don't want to ignore anyone.. etc,etc,etc", .

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: My experience was exactly the same - Lies! Lies! Lies!  What an expensive hunk of crap that experience was.  Maybe we should all start our own forum somewhere?  There's certainly enough single people here, we all have the disaster of Zoosk to get talking?  Reddit?

reviews.review_title: “i get tons of emails saying women want to meet me but...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: i get tons of emails saying women want to meet me but i have never even signed up for zoosk and they dont have my details. they were sold on to zoosk by another dodgy date site ,theyre all in it together to scam guys ,stay way from them all ,theyre all scammers

reviews.review_title: “I am really happy with the experience and feel so fortunate....”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I am really happy with the experience and feel so fortunate to have found that rare connection that some never get the opportunity to find.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
All fake ladies!!!!!!!!
Robot/system generated first contact messages, then nothing.
FAKE!!!!!

reviews.review_title: “Its always funny to see so many 1 star ratings then...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
Its always funny to see so many 1 star ratings then suddenly there is a high rating. Usually a 4 or 5 star "I love it"  review!  Usually by a fake account . . .

I tried Zoosk once.  I left it wondering how many bots are there?

Current stats at the time of this posting.
525 reviews with 388 one star rating!!

reviews.review_title: “Interesting and exciting experience to meet some normal...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Interesting and exciting experience to meet some normal people who were quite sincere about dating

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: It was good.

reviews.review_title: “total scam fake profiles to get you to bye the subscription”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: total scam fake profiles to get you to bye the subscription. The Sims fake messages to get you to buy the coins and by their gifts actually just send the note to a computer there's no real person at the other end. it is a total scam go to eharmony.com or match.com

reviews.review_title: “All I can say is the 2 reviews that gave this site...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: All I can say is the 2 reviews that gave this site 5 stars, Nice try founder and co-founder but majority rules here. I only gave it a 1 star because 0 was not an option. The worse site period....

reviews.review_title: “Zoosk is really great for meeting good matches..”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Zoosk is really great for meeting good matches..

reviews.review_title: “It was great, much better than some sites I had been...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: It was great, much better than some sites I had been on, so for now I will say good buy and hope it works for both of us. Arthur Wellman.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Nice little well thought out scam

reviews.review_title: “I found this site very confusing to use”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I found this site very confusing to use. I did not like the coins/carosel feature. I felt that the site should have used my preferences to prevent me from being an option on someone's carousel that did not match the preferences I chose for dating. I also didn't like that every time I scanned a picture to see who viewed me, it let them know that I viewed them.  And after I deleted a bunch of views, all of the men I deleted came back up on my recently viewed, because they thought I viewed them.  Very frustrating. However, I was fortunate to meet someone after several attempts to find the right person, so that was the bonus.

reviews.review_title: “I liked that there were possible matches close to me,...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I liked that there were possible matches close to me, but I had a hard time typing in the box.  I found it difficult to go over my text to check for errors that might cause misunderstandings, because the box is so small.  I would have preferred one like this one so I could see what I typed without having to scroll backwards, etc.  I was frustrated with the process.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: It is a scam. Complete BS. The website (or its creators) has no sincere interest in finding you a person that you might have a connection with. Their interest is, getting you to open your wallet again and again, and again. I have no problem for paying, for actual "things" that I could conceive as a tangible purchase, such as goods or service, Zoosk offers none of this. Complete crap. Will recommend against, to all who ask.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I paid $19.95 for "virtual coins".  These don't allow you to correspond with any members, but only to buy virtual gifts?  I wrote them an email and told them to take their virtual coins and shove them up their virtual ass.  The site is a scam.  Avoid at all costs.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Horrible site! Frustrate as all get out...stay away!!!Save your money...Match.com way more user friendly! They also have STIR events and get together...go with Match!

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
Disappointing.
Costly, plus additional charging.
Questionable replies.
Had photo removed, as it showed a shoulder, and barely visible area of stomach.
Verdict, in my opinion, a complete waste of time and money.

reviews.review_title: “Zoosk rips you off by making you buy coins after you...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
Zoosk rips you off by making you buy coins after you pay for subscription.   They hide that fact embedded down in their hyperlinks.  When you play carousel to earn coins they take that away after a short while.   Even earning coins to contact people you don't get to see their full profile beforehand-just a pic.   Terrible site!!! 
Here's their hidden info:      ZOOSK COINS
In our sole discretion, we may offer you the opportunity to obtain and redeem Zoosk Coins for use with our Services. We may charge fees for the right to use Zoosk Coins, or we may distribute the Zoosk Coins without charge, each in our sole discretion. When you redeem Zoosk Coins, we will redeem Zoosk Coins that you have purchased before redeeming Zoosk Coins that you have obtained on a promotional basis, or otherwise without charge. We have no obligation to continue offering any feature or function through the Services, including any feature or function that enables the use or redemption of Zoosk Coins.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I made the statement of along the line of I met a guy from Zoosk. I began talking too. I found out that he was a fraud, and that all he wanted was money. Of coarse he was from Ghana/ Nigeria running the biggest scam out of Nigeria. As it turns out the whole was a big scam.

reviews.review_title: “same story here fake messages fake replies etc etc”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: same story here fake messages fake replies etc etc. almost joined but balked at the activation fee so they offered to waive it , but i still declined.coincedentally after my refusal i started getting messages from numerous attractive girls out of the blue.

reviews.review_title: “I am finding that the overwhelming negative reviews...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I am finding that the overwhelming negative reviews about this site are true.  They incessantly lead you to believe that people are looking at you and are interested in you as a lure to get you to join or buy coins (I still don't get the purpose of coins).  I believe that my deactivated account will now join the other "zombie" accounts that stay online for other rubes to view and have false hope.  As a test, I tried to include in my description a suggestion to search for reviews on ZOOSK... almost immediately the addition was deleted from my profile... why don't they want people to read reviews on their service except for their own falsely positive ones?... obvious, isn't it.

reviews.review_title: “I sure wish I had read this list of reviews before...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I sure wish I had read this list of reviews before I spend any money on this crappy website. Within a few minutes I was very suspicious, and always reviews just confirms what I thought. What a piece of dung.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
refused to except photo
said it was a picture of a picture??
it was taken with i phone & uploaded,    i told them if they wouldn't except pic to refund money.     they wouldn't.
3 days on & unable to return messages to interested parties.
its a scam!!!!

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Worst dating site ever. It is basically extortion. It cost me $56.00+ for one month to try it. They charge an activation fee as well on top of the monthly fee. Then you cannot review mutual matches- you have to pay more to "unlock" them.  The carousel is a joke- it shows only someones photo, will not let you read the profile, and then asks if you are interested in meeting them.  The matches that they "pick" for you are usually nothing like someone you would be interested in. If you are not a member, you cannot respond to messages.  That is what sucked me into the one month most expensive dating site trial of my life. Awful, horrendous, just a money maker for Zoosk. I would recommend this site to no one....

reviews.review_title: “All I said was that she seemed to outclass the site...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: All I said was that she seemed to outclass the site itself and we both needed to get off of it. She said "call me".

reviews.review_title: “Zoosk is fake from start to finish-i intend to challenge...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Zoosk is fake from start to finish-i intend to challenge them legally.A friend of mine discovered his face on there-he doesnt use it-His home town was listed as miles and miles away and his birthday was fabricated.no one can reply to your message because they are all fake-they steal profiles from facebook,which is where they started as an app.Stay well clear of this site

reviews.review_title: “I should have checked out the reviews of this site...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I should have checked out the reviews of this site before I subscribed to it.... My story sounds like everyone else's here... They charge you to join and communicate with one another. But then they also want to charge you for every text that someone sends to you... That or they encourage you to submit to one of their junk sites either buy something to gain points... Which in turn takes over a month for it to apply towards your points... The survey questionnaire's are ridiculous they repeat some of the same questions over and over in different ways... Which is very strange...

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Huge ripoff. Insanely stupid design. It sends out fake replies to Winks, misleading you to think the person actually responded. You can turn this feature off if you know it exists and search for the way to do it. Then, you have buy "coins" in order to actually connect with anyone. Horrible. Worst experience ever. Stay away.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
This site sucks. Its a total rip off. Application fee? Didn't know I was applying for a credit card? Are you kidding me? And then there's the coins....what a joke. Even after you pay for the subscription AND the "application fee" you still have to purchase coins to unlock potential matches....THE WORST DATING SITE EVER!!!
Don't waste your time or your money.

reviews.review_title: “When I first joined Zoosk, they failed to mention the...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
When I first joined Zoosk, they failed to mention the $24.95 actuation fee. After I didn't finish payment they sent an email forgoing this fee.
As I started winking at the ladies, I noticed that two ladies gave the same return answers and two others also gave the same answers. To me this means that some type of computer answered my winks, not the ladies themselves.
I believe this is FRAUD.

reviews.review_title: “Dont waste your time,  but who knows!”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I have written an extensive review about Zoosk,  but think it is only fair to add this last one. When I joined,  I connected with a  real person,  met him twice, talked on the phone extensively,  but it fizzled out. That was my only luck. That was January of last year! January of this year I got a call from same guy, & we continued our friendship, & this time he was ready to accept my "no sex before marriage" condition. Well, we got married 2 weeks ago. So, hang in there, you never know.... or try Steve Harveys site. At least you know who owns the site, & you can always contact him if something goes wrong. Goodluck y'all.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
boobs flying off the page. i try a sleeveless shirt and its not appropriate!!!
ADMINISTRATIVELY BLOCKED without a singe reason given EVEN WHEN ASKED FOR. THE " VIEWS" are horsecrap. they are self perpetuating. if you breeze past someones picture..its a view they are told of, whether you went to read their profile or not, and then...when THEY LOOK AT YOU as SOMEONE WHO "VIEWED" them, you get a "VIEW" back. do NOT waste YOUR f ING time. Take the self perpetuating monthly fee and hidden SIGN UP CHARGE and go get blasted at a bar and screw whoever looks good by the end of the night. money well spent.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: IT SUCKS THERE'S HOT MEN

reviews.review_title: “I joined Zoosk because it said it was a free dating...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I joined Zoosk because it said it was a free dating website. Sure it's free to post, but once someone contacts you in order to read the message you have to pay a whopping $29. a month or $89. for 3 months. OK -- someone interesting looking wrote me so I paid up! Low and behold I start getting TONS of EMAILS everytime someone sorts through and looks at me. OK... I'm sure there's a way to turn that off... but the ultimate RIP OFF is the have a carousel for looking at pictures, and if someone likes me, and says they're interested, you have to BUY COINS -- andother huge expense!!! ZOOSK is a total rip off, and an annoying website that mixes everyone together so half the people you look at in the carousel are out of state. At first you can earn coins by using the carousel, so if there's mutual interest you can use the earned coins to see their profile. Soon after, you can only earn coins by signing up for paid products. ZOOSK is an unbelievable RIP OFF. If you want fee dating, that's truly  free (upgrades available) join POF or OK Cupid, you will not be happy if you pay for a Zoosk membership!

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Beware! I have only been on this site for 3 weeks and was provided with very few profiles in my area. Lots of NY so I decided to reach out to a NY guy who seemed interesting. Was texting with him and he said he had been robbed at gunpoint and needed me to send him $ to get him out if a jam. I immediately blocked him from my phone and from the website and immediately reported the scam to zoosk. Was informed that this occasionally occurs and that this person is more than likely in another country trying to pull off this scam. What kind of protection to the public is this? What a waste of time and $. These sites are exploiting people through their emotions. I'm hoping that a smart attorney will institute a class action suit to protect all of us in the future.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
Zero, negative, negative  rating.   STAY AWAY FROM ZOOSK.  
I am compelled to share my recent experience on Zoosk.  Zoosk now blocked my access because I sent messages to several women who did not respond to my initial message -asking if they were real.    I guess Zoosk didn't like my message.
 
I searched for a reputable dating website for my son who recently graduated from medical school and is beginning an internship with UCLA because he has been so busy with med school and had so little time for social activities.  
 
I  found some attractive and educated women on the Zoosk site that I recommended to him.   There have been no responses for 10 days after he sent messages to a dozen women.   I began to wonder if these women were real and actually exist.  I did some research about this site and found reviews that seemed to confirm my suspicion.   Mind you, albeit I am his mother, he is a good looking young man with an impressive resume.
 
We wasted time and money ($29.99).  Thank Buddha it was only for a one month subscription!    
 
This dating website fraudulent is a shill and lures people with fake profiles and responses.   Buyer BEWARE of  this website!

reviews.review_title: “THIS SITE IS HORRIBLE from many aspects”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: THIS SITE IS HORRIBLE from many aspects.  1. Fake profiles. 2. Horrible Customer service. 3. Female members were not attractive to me at all.  In my opinion they were desperate. 4.  Bad quality all together.  BE WARNED!!!!!

reviews.review_title: “I just cancelled my one month subsciption”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I just cancelled my one month subsciption. This site is very objective, starting with the fact that you can waive the subscription fee by just cancelling the first attempt and waiting for the follow up email reeling you back in. So I went for it; signed up for one month and I'm not impressed at all. 
The supposed view list is fraudulent as far as people actually ATTEMPTING to view your profile. You have to go through a list when you search profile; in doing this,  zoosk sends a notification to all the profiles you cljcked through telling them you viewed their profile...but this is an unavoidable feature on the site. 
I cancelled for two reasons:
1.) Zoosk was matching me up with guys that were at least 400 miles away from me that claimed to be in love(in addition to a second email basically stating the same feelings from another guy within miles from the first one).
2.) Very deceptive. You will get views from guys that look great, but you will get contacted every two seconds from bums in your local area. You will see through all the glam in no time...took me 3 days.

reviews.review_title: “I joined and used pay pal to make the purchase”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I joined and used pay pal to make the purchase.  As I clicked OK to pay a second charge appeared which said something like membership set up fee and it cost as much as the monthly charge itself.  A friend of mine told me she paid with a credit card and when the second membership setup fee showed up she clicked cancel.  The site then offered to wave the set up fee.  This site's computer program is terrible and requires the use of several separate pages to get the info on matches.  The site will also tell you a person is on line when in fact they signed off over a half hour earlier!  I would not recommend this site even to my ex !!

reviews.review_title: “I joined to see how the website was”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I joined to see how the website was. Don't trust this site. It will suck you in to spend money. You might get a fake person. It has free messenger for text and video chat. It is hard to say if you will find anyone.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: WARNING Stay away! I am a woman that is going though a divorce. I don't go to bars and a workaholic so I don't get out much in the social light and thought I would try the site for free at first. You will get all kinds of views immediately. After I paid $85.00 for 3 months ($25 fee I didn't know about up front) I found out a day later from a guy who was irritated that I viewed him 14 times in one day in which I did not. After thinking about it, I discovered that every time you scroll all the singles, it sends a message to them that you viewed them even though you never looked at their profile. When you scroll through all the people that viewed you, it sends them a message as well that you viewed them. When it came down to it, I think a lot of people are correct that all the good looking people are bots. With all the good looking guys who viewed me, only guys who were not so great looking contacted me. Then you embarrass yourself when you think someone is really interested because they viewed you a lot to find out that it automatically generates the view every time they scroll to see who viewed them. There is no way to get a refund and no way to reverse the charge from your bank. I have only been a member for 1 day and I am already sick to my stomach that I just threw away $85. My mistake at first was doing research on the best dating sites which was moreless probably paid for by the company to put in those articles. AVOID AT ALL COST or throw away your money. Now I have to ride out 3 months of this fraudulent site.

reviews.review_title: “DO NOT JOIN THIS LYING CHEATING WEBSITE”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
DO NOT JOIN THIS LYING CHEATING WEBSITE. YOU WILL BE DISAPPOINTING AND THEY WONT GIVE A REFUND.
Without doubt this is a modern day con. you never quite get the service the suggest unless you pay extra at every turn. It seems impossible to chat to another site user unless you pay for credits and that's the same even after you have paid the registration fee.

reviews.review_text: So many fake profiles ... clearly !! and so many responses ... !! I got highly suspicious when I saw so many responses from so many good loking (apparently sane) women and later found that these are just crappy bots apparently run by the website ... This is super Crap !! PLEASE DO NOT MAKE THEM RICH !!! These are a bunch of web developers trying to get easy money !! Sad people fall for such stuff :( ... includes me !!

reviews.review_title: “I never signed up for this site or even knew it existed...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I never signed up for this site or even knew it existed until I saw $75.00 was taken from my checking account by them.  Somehow they got my debit card info and decided to go to town on my account. I tried calling and emailing them and got nowhere. Of course I closed out my account and debit card and filed a fraud report with my back so I won't be out the money. My next step is to contact the Attorney General in California.

reviews.review_title: “I agree with the poster regarding fake views.I became...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I agree with the poster regarding fake views.I became suspicious when several apparently sane women would view my profile about ten times a day,including some that I messaged but with no reply.It certainly appears that if somebody has viewed your profile once,then every time they log in subsequently,you receive a viewed message.I think also in search mode,without clicking on the profile you generate a view.If I was a woman,and it appeared that the same person was viewing my profile 10 times a day,I certainly would not reply to any subsequent messages.What a truly horrible website/avoid!

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Many issues, where do I start.  I paid the $30 to try this for one month and I'm still unable to chat with people unless I purchase COINS to be more popular on top it. I even installed Adobe AIR and the messenger.  Since I have it for a month, I'll see if things improve but so far it's a complete waste of time and money...

reviews.review_text: About 9 months ago I tried Zoosk, paid and actually had some good experiences.  This month, after signing back up I see they have changed things. reviews.review_text: I signed up last night and immediately started getting messages from guys that said "OMG, you're so beautiful", "You're so hot, I forgot my pickup line", etc.  The problem is ...I hadn't even uploaded any pictures yet, so I knew it was bull$#*!.  I deactivated.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Zoosk is a total bumkum. It is indeed a rip off. I was trying out the $19 per month subscription but ended up $46 something cent charge. This is outrageous. The "Zoosk" site of a thing is totally "Waco".

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Worst dating site ever! You pay 30 bucks and unless the person subscribes, they cannot email you. They send fake views and messages. They monitor any negative word about the site so others won't find out. My matches are 10 years older than me and only 3 years younger. And not only do they charge you a monthly of 30 bucks, you have to purchase coins to see mutual matches and other features. Stay away unless you don't want to meet somebody!

reviews.review_title: “This site is setup to strictly take your money”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: This site is setup to strictly take your money.  First there's the 30 bucks for one month and their setup fee.  Now that you paid, the next thing you get is a whole bunch of "views" and messages stating someone wants to meet you.  But here's the kicker... to email or chat with that person you must pay for the privileged.  Let me say that again!  You've paid at least 30 bucks to join the site but now you have to pay to be "connected" with someone on the site who supposedly wants to meet you.  Let's not forget if you do see someone you like and send that person a message unless that person is a paid subscriber they cannot read your message but they do get a message stating you've left a message for them.  Once you've paid to subscribe, you'll find you must pay for additional services such as allowing you to contact someone interested in you.  The search function on this site is intentionally primitive as to not allow you to search by the person's profile name you know just in case you'd like to view the person who is interested in you profile... well you can't since you can't search by city, profile name, or anything else which would interrupt their ability to get you to pay more.  My favorite thing about the site was receiving a someone just sent you a message alert but when you do find that person's profile, they haven't logged in in hours, days, sometimes weeks so, how did they just send you a chat or message.  If you respond to one of these messages, you either receive no responds, a canned response such as "tell me more", or an actual response from the user stating they did not send you a message.  Not worth a dime

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I just got scammed out of $30!!! As soon as I signed up all of these ladies wanted to chat, after responding to them, about 15, only 1 responded to say "i'm sorry sir, but i did not write that"... I always research before I pay, I left my guard down and here I am.
I guess my message is WARNING...DO NOT SIGN UP TO ZOOSK

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Am I a sucker or what?  I usually check this stuff out and review before I join. Well all of my friends were "liking" it on Facebook and seemed to be putting comments on about it. Apparently, Facebook auto comments as well and does not notify the person who supposedly posted the comment, but notifies all of your friends. I started talking to someone on zoosk on the second day of joining. We spent hours chatting. After about almost a week I asked for a phone number. They were not comfortable at this time. By week two I was getting antsy like can we at least talk on the phone or something because I would like to know who I'm talking to. Now, don't get me wrong, the English, punctuation and grammar was perfect. We decided to meet on a Thursday. On the meeting day there was absolutely no communication, where to meet etc. on Friday morning the profile and user were deleted, gone, disappeared off the face of the earth. WOW is all I can say. As far as everybody else's comments, they are spot on except for buying coins. You get up to 40 free coins a day that you can use to send gifts to people, but you have to "like" 40 people a day in the carousel game. This is beyond the worst possible site in the entire world. I have been flamboozeled and I'm not happy.

reviews.review_title: “Writing this, I did some confirmation research and...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
Writing this, I did some confirmation research and have already found the limitless trove of "Zoosk is a scam" almost anywhere you can Google it. I'm posting it anyway because I've written it already. 

What gets me is why hasn't the main stream media outed this yet? This would be a great Dateline investigation piece.

There are two main indicators that Zoosk is a largely fraud-operation running scam:

1. Is the monumental disparity between the amount of messages/attention/potential (fake) profiles you are presented with before you pay, and the complete lack of all aforementioned AFTER you pay. 

If the amount of attention a user account with no profile information or even a picture gets 10 emails in it's first week, with no profile and a picture, then how is it that once the profile is filled out and a picture is uploaded those magic emails suddenly drop to nothing. 
Does Zoosk really think people believe that people are so desperate that they've resorted to spending their daily time on Zoosk writing emails to and wanting to meet someone based solely on a username and an age? Also, how dumb does Zoosk think that people are to believe that people are really interested in contacting completely un-filled-out empty profiles, when there are thousands of already filled-out profiles are at their disposal?
If after you've paid, you can barely get a person to read your email, if a person who is willing to reach out to a completely unknown stranger for no apparent reason, then critical *critical* logic should follow that they are literally willing to accept ANYTHING as a real match. 

2. They rely heavily on faked feedback loops. Feedback loops are when you get a "Like" or a "Comment" on Facebook. It keeps you coming back for more. Zoosk relies heavily on this pseudo-psychological element to whet your appetite. At first they'll flood your completely empty un-filled-out profile with people who are interested, then interest drops dramatically after you fill out your profile. "What happened? Did people just decided that they didn't like me?? I have to investigate. I need to reach out to more people!" - proceeds to contact 300 profiles. Unintentional or otherwise, this is how it works out there.

These are things that keep people coming back to the site: "Did someone like or reply to my email?" Zoosk manufactures a ton of feedback loops saying, "A person has viewed your profile."

Everyone has to "view" whichever/whatever profile Zoosk decides to throws in their face. It's literally not an indicator of anything. If anything else, they saw your picture and thought they'd look at your profile based on age and location, since that's the only thing they have to go on anyway.

If you do the "Search" option, you are automatically presented with profiles, which you are now viewing. How Zoosk decides if what constitutes as a "view" is anyone's guess, but they've now turned you into "a potentially interested person."

These are not true indicators of any kind of real interest, especially if they're not followed up by any kind of real follow-ups. Zoosk feeds people's false hopes by telling people that people have viewed their profiles. What's worse is I think that there are probably some poor souls out there who actually believe that this is some standard way of flirting on Zoosk, and think that people are just being coy or playing hard to get. "I need to pursue this person harder! Oh! I know! I will buy them a gift!" 
I wonder how many real matches resulted from some poor schmuck chunking out coins on gifts resulted in an actual date. 

It's very common knowledge that guys who buy women things first, convey that they have no value and have to spend money in order to get women's attention. What's even more cheesy is the flip side of that, is if after you've gotten to know a girl on Zoosk and you buy her one of those one-bit cheapo digital gifts, then you really seem bogus. If you've gotten to know her, dude, show some originality. Buy her a REAL GIFT. Not some cheesy dating site unoriginal term of endearment. Some girls say they like guys to buy them a drink and some are telling the truth, but to be quite honest it's more of a test to see if you're "just another one of those guys who'll just buy me things."

reviews.review_title: “Everyone is saying the site is a scam and the profiles...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
Everyone is saying the site is a scam and the profiles are fake. A few people have also said that nobody responds to their messages. Well sorry to tell you but there must be another reason they don't want to talk to you, because that is not true either. You do not have to be a boosted member to talk to people if you're smart about it. Think.... you get to send one message to each person. Instead of a stupid comment or pick up line, take advantage of that one message and send them your email, aim, facebook, or depending on your opinion my be your phone number. Then they can respond to you and start a lasting conversation that's FREE. 
I joined the site with a free profile 2 years ago. I searched only people in close distances to me. When I found someone I liked I used the one free message to send them my email address. 2 months after becoming a member I decided to meet a guy I had been talking to. We met up in a public place at the halfway point since we were an hour away from each other. 2 weeks later we were dating. 5 months later we were engaged. And 6 months after that we were married. We are now coming up on our first anniversary and expecting a baby together. I could not be happier and I owe it all to Zoosk. Meeting the love of my life did not cost me a penny and it definitely was not a scam. Obviously you people just aren't doing it right. Good luck.

reviews.review_title: “I thought I had met a great guy online, but it turned...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I thought I had met a great guy online, but it turned out to be a catfish and a phishing attempt for money. His name on the site is: goodguydr, and he gave his real name as Gaufrid Arndt, 41, Rancho Santa Fe, CA. He states in his profile, he is a Christian, and tells a sob story about his ex taking his five-year-old girl away and that is why he moved to the United States, to get a new start. He claims he is a civil engineer, and two days after we started communicating online, he says he has an overseas job in Spain for six weeks. At first, everything was going well with his job, and that he may come back December 7. Then, a week or so later, he says his tourist ticket is on December 14. He complains of the cold weather in Spain and says he misses me. States he has a condo in Sarasota, Florida - but there are no property records of the purchase. He asked me to call him in Spain. We talked a little more than a week. The last few days, he started to hint at work difficulties, that there was not enough money, that he needed $2000 from his account in Florida. But he didn't trust his friends, and he has no family. 

I was going to send him a handwritten letter but he refused to give me his hotel or his home address in Florida. After that, I think he felt he "hooked" me, and started to ask if I could ask others for money for him. Then he asked me directly, saying he is normally a very proud man, and it hurts to beg.

I blocked his numbers so he can't call me anymore. Asking for money is such a red flag. I hope no other woman falls for this scheme. He did what other dating scam websites said, he did direct me to start chatting on Yahoo Messenger instead of Zoosk.

He called me from a different number a few days ago.  First, buttering me up, then the next day, pretending to be angry at my Zoosk review.  I took it down, still wanting to believe this fantasy.  But I've reposted it to warn others of this fake.  And I blocked his number again.

I have talked to others, and they have had similar experiences.  A Jamaican man living in Philadelphia, and then when my friend wanted to meet, he hesitated and made excuses.  He, too, switched her to chatting on Yahoo Messenger.

Overall, it seems the quality of profiles are less than a couple free sites.  Oh, and Zoosk will only take down a profile if there is something overtly offensive.  Otherwise, they have to keep it posted.  I had some difficulty unsubscribing from the website also.  I had to call them directly to untangle the auto-renew.

reviews.review_title: “the site is obviously a scam and here's why”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
the site is obviously a scam and here's why.

- most of the profiles contain 1 photo and no descriptive information requiring a user to type in anything.

- as far as the women go, once you do a search, you will most likely get some "attractive" results right off the bat. this doesn't tend to happen on other dating site sorry. if you wink at one of them, you will most likely get an email response within the hour. once you try and read the email response, you will be asked for money.

- right after you setup your account, you will start to notice your view count and winks go up, even if you only put up 1 photo and didn't type anything into your profile. i don't care how unattractive you think you are, this will most likely happen.

- your search results will contain a lot of people outside your search radius and age range.

i could keep going, but i "deactivated" my account right away. there is no "delete" profile option which is a little concerning.

Tried to contact them again and again either by phone (number don't work) or the person emailing me back is a robot. Never refunded my money...REally pissed about it still. WORST DATING SITE.

Whic was so stoo-pid it was almost funny, even it wasn't so stupid and creepy. Zoosk's profile standards are as low as their business ethics--anybody can set up a profile with almost no information. I would regularly get matches from people with just a picture who were apparently illiterate. Also, after the exorbitant sign up fee, they kept trying to sell me "coins" to see matches, or to send virtual roses, etc. Really, this site is so idiotic, it's funny--as long as you haven't paid.

reviews.review_title: “I subscribed, and had fun with the site”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I subscribed, and had fun with the site. My issue with the site is that I never authorized automatic renewal of coins. My account filled up with coins several times when my account got down to 5- 10 coins. I received zero e-mail notifications of being billed for coin renewals at $19.95 a piece, so I assumed that the site was filling my coins as a promotional to keep people active with the site. I received a credit card bill with 6 charges of $19.95 and called them to dispute never being notified that I had been billed. I spoke with a rep and then a manager. The best they were willing to do was credit me back for 2 of the $19.95 charges. This site is clearly a scam. They may have fine print to cover themselves legally, but the site is an absolute fraud that preys upon lonely hearts. Stear clear of Zoosk.

reviews.review_text: This is a scam site. You're charge an up front fee and then they want "coins" to email of contact other members, ethics is about $2.00 per connection.  And they don't deliver emails unless you boost, which again is $2 per time.  What a rip!!  I've written the Colorado AG Office and they tell me I'm not alone in my complaint.  Stay away!

reviews.review_title: “As always I researched this website before joining...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
As always I researched this website before joining and found only top reviews by people seemingly not connected with Zoosk.com. The first hint that trouble was brewing occurred while paying the membership fee. Suddenly a "one time fee of $25.00" popped up increasing the price to about $100.00 for 6 months! I couldn't get any responses to messages I sent to other members and at the same time I noticed "buy coins" started popping up! I left the website and researched "Zoosk coins". The membership fee does not allow you to meet people. It merely allows you to enter their site to spend lots more money. At this point it's just a question of how fast you can run. Leave the site, lick your wounds and chalk this one up to experience. Be sure you close the account properly so they won't automatically renew your membership too!

Stewart C. Hagerman
Member: American Mensa Society

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: The site is an absolute joke.  There is a feature on it that allows you to see who has viewed your profile.  However, part of the feature is the option to view their profile in return.  What you don't realise is that even by looking at who has viewed you - a message is sent to the person to say that you have checked their profile even if you haven't - even if you are just deleting the profiles that you aren't interested in.  So it appears that you get someone who may be interested but they may just be deleting you too.  It is a vicious cycle and very disappointing when you think you keep getting repeat visits from certain people where in fact you aren't and very embarrassing because if you scroll through the views and they do as well it keeps appearing like they are interested.  Then when you try to delete your profile from the site it won't let you until your subscription has ended WTF!!! so annoying.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints

Get out of the house...stop making your cat your only friend and get to the gym.  These sites are for the desperate...they will always try to convince you that it's for "professionals with no time to meet people"...haha right..it's for the $#*! at the bottom of the barrel.

I then called customer service, flipped the f out, and got at least my first time application fee back, do not know about other part yet, customer service said that corporate would get an inquiry/request to refund the rest back, but I doubt it.  This site is trash, pure and simple, don't fall for it, please.

reviews.review_title: “Zoosk is half legit and half scam.Many of the profiles...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
Zoosk is half legit and half scam.Many of the profiles on their site are not real and just lifted from other personals sites. I joined a couple of weeks ago and been in contact with a few women who ARE members. But there are many more who're are not.
If you are considering joining keep this in mind:
(1) While looking through the profiles, you can eliminate any from consideration which don't include 'recently online' these profiles are people who haven't even done free browsing on the site. That's at least half. Even if you do see the words 'recently online' that indicates only that that person has browsed (but not necessarily joined)
(2) If you wink at someone and get this reply "I appreciate the wink. Leave a message and I will get back to you." It's completely BOGUS. That profile doesn't exist and zoosk is behind it and crossing the line into fraud; trying to lure subscribers.
(3) you can send one message to someone who has a profile. If they're a member, they can read it. In your message you can point out you're not a current member and leave your personal email coded (as in supplement words for punctuation)  It'll get through their filters and maybe you'll get a response
bottom line, try the free personals (OKCupid, POF, etc.) If you want to pay, match.com.

reviews.review_title: “My experience is the same as that of so many other...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: My experience is the same as that of so many other people:  I'm convinced that essentially every profile featuring a decent looking man with a well written bio is fake.  How do I know?  Well, not too long ago I tried a couple of other online dating sites and was bombarded with hits from men in all walks of life - not just the sad, seemingly desperate ones who are currently chatting me up on Zoosk.  Oh, get this.  The system periodically matches people up by common attitudes then makes you pay to connect with this great person for you.  As an experiment, I used 20 coins (which can also be accrued by participating in one of their sham surveys) to email said great match who Zoosk confirmed had also expressed an interest in meeting me.....and nothing.  No response whatsoever.  However, I was given the option to invest another 20 coins to determine whether or not my email had been read yet.  What a crock!!!  Not to overstate my value, but I'm generally considered to be quite attractive and have a well written, interesting bio of my own. Funny, before I signed up for the paid membership, I used the Search function to see who might live in my vicinity & there were many choices.  Suddenly, in a single day - since I paid - their profiles have all magically disappeared.  The saving grace here is the fact that I requested a temporary number from my credit card provider in case Zoosk were to attempt to bill me beyond the 30 day membership I signed up for.  Also, I enrolled over the phone rather than online specifically so I could tell the rep that I absolutely would not join unless the $35 new membership was waived & the the account NOT auto-renewed at the end of the month.  How sad that one must go to such lengths to get even the smallest bit of satisfaction I've received on the site so far (this is day 2).  Bottom line:  Even with the precautions, using this place to enhance one's social life is a waste of money.

reviews.review_title: “I am premium member ship, I paid 72 £ for 6 month member...”

So the manager agree to give me 400 coins free for me. And nothing changed, lots of women are watching my profile, but that's it, no massaging no nothing. Its the worst investment of all. I thought it will be fun to find some girl from virtual world, but...zoosk.com are crooks. DON'T PAY MONEY for membership it not  worth it.

Most of the paid functions on the site are a rip off, it's difficult to terminate your account, the help link on the site is blind/broken and you'll find yourself asking why the hell am I on this site when there are cheaper, better and less fraudulent sites out there on offer?

reviews.review_title: “If only I had read these reviews before I paid my money!”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
If only I had read these reviews before I paid my money!

I have been on dating sites, off and on, for nearly ten years and Zoosk is just about the biggest waste of time in the UK. I am pretty certain that they computer generate messages of endearment from the opposite sex as well as telling you that fictitious people want to chat or meet up with you. I may be wrong about this but when I reply to these 'interested' parties, I get no response! I am a fairly hardened individual but this scam can be very cruel for some lonely hearts. I would say that there are very few genuine people on zoosk in the UK. 
Tread with caution, be cynical and you will not be disappointed!!!!

reviews.review_title: “zoosk has this thing called zsms, were they say they...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: zoosk has this thing called zsms, were they say they match you. well if you say you like dogs and the other person likes dogs they match you, plus after you all ready paid you need to get coins ( pay again ) to use this feature. then if it says that the person is 43 miles away when you map quest they are really 80 miles away. you can not narrow the "on line now" feature according to miles, meaning if some one in new York is on and you live in ohio they show up..the carousel feature will not let you know were the person is, you just need to say yes or no and this feature cost you extra as well. and lastly they are relentless about if someone views you, you get an email for ever view, then when you check the views, then the same person views you again immediately. who cares about views ? the site is NOT #1 like the ratings say, it's a joke save your money you have been warned,,,,,

reviews.review_title: “There is no way of changing the ages set for search...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: There is no way of changing the ages set for search or the distance - you can edit for a search but cannot keep the changed ages.  For instance mine is set at 63 - 77 by who knows who and I want 55 - 70 max and that is being kind.  They grab coins which you have spent ages clicking to get when sending some emails by a pop up which you can't turn off.  Customer service is non-existent - no email to write to although I did get an answer to a telephone message before I paid to join but that never worked again nor now does the telephone number - just rings and rings and dies.  The reject feature doesn't work as the same faces keep showing up even though I have rejected them - report user is a better method to stop unwanted profiles.  I have never seen so many scruffy and frankly ugly men and so many smokers on a site.  The few exceptions live too far away - again can't change their 100 mile setting to 20 (35 would be better but doesn't exist).  Wish I had seen this site before I stupidly signed up because I had seen a couple of good looking guys.  I am not on facebook or twitter.

reviews.review_title: “I signed up and paid my amount, after i supposedly...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I signed up and paid my amount, after i supposedly got a message from this nice looking guy.I didnt get hardly any responses or views once i signed up. I looked for the nice looking guy and was a profile but it was really weird because it was in another state across the country. The ones I did get scared me half to death. I cancelled my subscription and asked to be taken off...to this day my profile is still active...I get all these hits,winks and messages, 5 times more than when I was a subscriber, and now i am getting all these teaser profiles, with great pictures, and live in other states. This last teaser was a guy on a 32 ft sail boat off the coast of Calif. near Carmel. Please give me a break. I am a country girl in Idaho.These poor guys who respond to my profile have no idea and think it is an active profile, and that someone is being rude to them. I have tried to change my profile and deleate but Zoosk denies and have sent me some rather intimidating messages that make me think my supposed account is flagged because I try to change and  Zoosk puts back the section back on or actually changes what I wrote. I don't play games. Stay away they are a rip off and could be dangerous to your safety.

reviews.review_title: “The worst experience I've ever had in dating”

Fake profiles, and zoosk wants you to pay every time you send a message to see if they received it !!! Wtf kinda bs is that !!! Don't waste your time or money the site should be shut down and I'd personally kick whoever runs it ass if given the opportunity. Don't f@#k with people's relationships or emotions!

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I've been using Zoosk for about 3-wks.  This was more of an experiment than anything else so my hopes were not high and I'm glad I didn't have high hopes.  I paid to be a member, $100 for I think 6-months.  I'm from NY.  First, I approached all the women in a very respectable way, Hi, my name is so-and-so, these are my hobbies / interests, what's yours?  1 out of 50 times I get a response which is pretty bad.  I get many views, but no one chats.  I did send a blast to 10 women asking them to give me a simple "k" to let me know the chat feature is working and two responded so I know it works.  I think the women / profiles are all legit but they are inundated with others guys or have already established chats with other guys.  Women who do not join, which I think most are not members, have limited chat / messaging features - limited as in they can respond to a message 10 times or something like that.  So women are even more picky on who they chat with.  The other downside is, the women I see are mostly divorced with kids.  Here's my estimate: 60% have kids living with them / divorced / starting over, 10% are ugly (sorry), 10% are in their 20s and 30s, and 20% are older than 30 (some are in nice shape).  A lot of the women are looking for a serious relationship.  I use this site as a test for my come-on lines and to build the nerve to hit on a hot girl in the real world.  It's also interesting to see the background on some women and how they were treated.   Some have massive chips on their shoulders.  It's also interesting to see them describe themselves - nice, easy going, low maintenance - okay, then why hasn't some guy picked you up?  My recommendation is, unless you have $100 to blow, it's not worth it.  If you've got the cash then this might be a fun thing as an aside to do but you should be actively finding a live girl in the real world.  I think of this almost like fishing, I put out 100 lines.  If I catch anything, it's a bonus, but I always have a steak waiting for me at home.  Hopes this helps!

I seem to get views but that's it but people are looking for what the super model I know I'm not the best looking person out in this world but then again I'm not that bad looking. Poor site

reviews.review_text: I paid for a 3 month subscription and got absolutely nothing for it.  I cannot say for sure that it is a scam, but it certainly seemed like it to me. reviews.review_title: “I recently joined because a woman who looked very interestin...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I recently joined because a woman who looked very interesting sent me, allegedly a "Wants to meet you" request. And according to her profile we would have ended up friends I believe, at the very least. So much in common. I'm not very "mainstream" or middle class. It's difficult to find a potential female friend or love on a dating site. I have, but not on Zoosk. I'm getting, allegedly 70 or 80 hits a day plus lots of  return visits. I've sent complimentary messages to a few. Complimenting profiles and pics. Women FAR away. No responses. Probably not paying members. No one but one far away looked like a potential friend anyway.
But back to the woman I DID want to meet. Her profile does not appear in a normal search of the close by city (SF) where she lives. Allegedly. I have not heard back from her. She has not yet read my message. Can she?
Was I snookered into spending more money than I was initially led to believe I would be spending in order to respond to a profile that does not exist?

reviews.review_title: “they control what you say and try to swindle money...”

DO.NOT.PAY!

You are allowed to send and receive one message to/from anybody, so I sent some of the "girls" my phone number and they all replied with "no, I'm not texting you, you have to sign up and talk to me on here first" - now ask yourself this: would a person who genuinely wants to find a date/relationship turn down an opportunity to contact someone only because they hadn't signed up to a paid membership? Don't think so! These "women" are Zoosk employees trying to extort money from you.

DO.NOT.PAY!!!

So I sent a wink to both. Both of the visitors were supposedly online recently, but not at the moment I sent my winks yet I got immediate, similarly generic responses from both. 
Of course, I couldn't read the responses without paying but I could see how they began and that was all I needed to see to know they had to be fake.

The dating scammers do not want you to hear their true accent ( they claim it is Italian) and jack men only want dirty talk by text.

reviews.review_text:
This site is crap! As long as you haven't subscribed, you receive tons of proposals from good-looking girls, one every 5 minutes. When you want to reply, then you're redirected to the subscription page. Sometimes you're proposed to turn on your webcam by a lady. You can accept or refuse to see her. If you accept, then you see a girl in front of her PC in an office somewhere in Romania, Lithuania or whatever...So again all fake profiles!
Then once you've paid, it stops right away. No more or very few proposals.
If you don't believe me, just create 2 fake accounts in two different countries. Create one in France one in Belgium for instance. You will see exactly the same fake profiles of ladies in the two countries!
This site is simply a scam! I don't understand how not much more people complained about it! How can such a site exist????

If anyone knows how to create petition/ claim against this site, please share!

Or does anyone know the company name and address behind this ripoff?

Thanks
Hope it will help you not to walk into the trap as I did !
John

I have sent dozens of emails to them asking for this problem to be rectified with not one reply. I then opened another profile and emailed them many more times still no response. I kept writing them messages in the "about me" section to see again if I would get a response.....still nothing. They were obviously reading these messages as they kept rejecting the content. So they owe me 3 months subscription fee and for that I will write bad reviews wherever I can. Use Plenty of Fish instead as it offers the same for ZERO dollars. reviews.review_title: “I'm a single female subscriber who's gone back into...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I'm a single female subscriber who's gone back into the dating pool.  And, what I have to say about Zoosk isn't at all flattering.  So, I hope that Zoosk listens to this review.
When I signed up for the site I was really enthusiastic.  But, over a period of three days I quickly began to see what Zoosk is all about.  Though I received (literally) hundreds of views/inquiries within a few days, neither myself nor my viewers could maintain contact because they were not a subscriber.  The initial $50 to activate and pay for a month is not at all worth the consistent let down of only being able to view hundreds of profiles of potential gentlemen that I can't chat with.
I called up the customer service line, and politely, calmly expressed my displeasure with the site and the lack of services.  I asked if there was a survey line that I could leave a survey at or a department that takes suggestions.  And, even though he was very polite in return and apologized for "me feeling that way" ( uh... ), he sent me to a one-question survey line asking if the customer service that I received was satisfactory.  Doh!
If Zoosk would allow subscribers to maintain a conversation with non-subscribers then the site would be well worth the money.  Maybe they will have a "change of heart" in the future when they begin losing their subscribers.  But, as of right now, in this turbulent economy where the middle class is shrinking and everyone who doesn't have money has to watch every red cent, Zoosk isn't ideal for people who actually want to meet new people.  Maybe, if you wanted to blow $50 for a month's worth of pictures of people you can't actually chat with...

reviews.review_title: “I think the word zoosk is actually a derivative of...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I think the word zoosk is actually a derivative of a latin word that translates as internet scam.  There is nothing that comes with their "free" signup except for notes from people you can't communicate with unless you pay.  When I decided to try it for a month, when I went to complete the transaction, they added a $24 "activation fee".  I cancelled the transaction.  I immediately began receiving emails saying the fee was waved for a limited time.  The site is set up so that the only real way to work is by buying their "tokens".  They supposedly match you with people, but you have to buy tokens to be able to investigate the supposed match, even though you already paid their monthly fee.  I set a search criteria with age range and max distance.  I got possible matches that were 10 years older than my criteria (and me), and over 100 miles away instead of the 20 miles I set.  I know there are plenty of rip offs on the internet, but zoosk has to be somewhere near the top of the list

reviews.review_title: “I joined for only one month, and NEVER clicked on coins...”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I joined for only one month, and NEVER clicked on coins or asked for 'boosts'...last weekend my profile was boosting left and right, and Sunday I checked my bank account...instead of the $45 for the one month fee and set up fee, Zoosk had charged me $85 and I DID NOTHING TO ASK FOR ANYTHING MORE!  Tohellwiththem, thiefs.  They are VERY tricky with the fine print, like auto this and auto that and it's IMPOSSIBLE to figure it out.  Stay away unless money is no issue to you.

reviews.review_title: “I agree with most of the other reviewers here”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: I agree with most of the other reviewers here.  It is confusing not knowing who is a member and who isn't.  I haven't used a site that required you to pay to unlock profiles before, this was not made clear before I paid my one month subscription. How can you decide if you want to meet someone if you can't see their profile?  How come not one person I said was a match thought I was? It could be me but it seems that quite a few others have had this experience.  It's a shame because some of the features could have made this a more dynamic site such as the matching and the carousel , if they had been set up differently.  I think there are very few paid up members among those profiles so the odds are really poor, and some of the paid up ones probably aren't happy to pay more to unlock a mutual match. The odds maybe a little bit greater than staying home and waiting for someone to parachute into my garden, but not much.One month was enough for me.

reviews.review_title: “spams the hell out of my email account with tons of...”

reviews.review_text: spams the hell out of my email account with tons of emails about some fake profiles that supposedly searched me. i had simply signed up, and did nothing to my profile. no info, no pics, nothing, yet i got constant FAKE messages from girls in my inbox. sometimes i would receive the same message from a different profile with different pics and name. i never tried the site out, but i know from this alone this site is a joke and needs to be shut down.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
The worst pseudo-legitimate dating site ever.  

Members cannot search the data base, are asked if they want to meet some person while receiving no information, and for thrills can play "roulette" that randomly selects a member for you to meet ... without telling where the person lives!
This is a double con, giving you nothing of value and also making you pay for it. Then, on top of the membership fee, there is a surprise "activation charge" of $29.95.  Suppose that's to discourage you from de-activating.

But I admire the creativity of a couple of the site's hoaxes.

1) Each day you are offered a "scientifically selected match" you agree or decline to meet. The other "person" simultaneously "decides." How convenient that you have been "scientifically selected" to meet an inactive member or a site sprite. Of course their is no agreement forthcoming, so the whole offer disappears until the next day's con game. 

2. Members are notified each time their profile is viewed. Big excitement to get so many nibbles, right? Wrong. The site computer generates fake "views," recycling persons - real or not - who have "viewed" you previously.  Delete a view notification, and within 2 days that person again will have "viewed" your profile. One "woman" allegedly viewed me 3 times in 24 hours, then gave no response to my contact. Guess she finally had decided against me ... at least until 2 days later, when again she "viewed" my profile.

reviews.review_title: “I signed up for zoosk and used it for several months”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I signed up for zoosk and used it for several months. Then one day I got a notice that my account was under review. Shortly after I was notified my account was closed. I sent several emails to support@zoosk.com but received no response. 

UNDISCLOSED REASON - Today I finally got around to calling their number. The representative confirmed that my account had been cancelled and that I had been reimbursed. I asked several times as to why and each time I was put on hold as they she searched for more info. In the end she said my account was "blocked" because of "fraudulent activity" - but could not state what that activity was, she claimed they were "not allowed to disclose" it, but from the sound of it, here computer screen didn't say and therefore she couldn't.

ACCOUNT STILL VISIBLE - But the worst part was that I asked them to erase my account. She said she could not do that, but not to worry because nobody could see my account since it was blocked. I then informed her that I am getting regular notifications each week from people who have viewed my account. 

CANNOT ERASE ACCOUNT - She said the most she could do was to turn off the notifications. It was at that point I realized I needed to warn others of this. I now have a profile that other humans believe to be active online that I cannot get rid of. This is a problem and it is very frustrating.

If someone sends a chat request, you can't even let them know you aren't a member. It's the worst site. At least you can actually message back and forth on POF. Zoosk sucks BIGTIME.

Now she has to go through a bunch of BS to get her profile that she didn't even create off of there. Its a total waste of time to even sign up they are a pain in the a$$. Totally Sucked!
